loans.name: Emma Aracely

texts.es: Emma Aeacely de 35 años de edad es propietaria de una venta de calzado plástico como lo son botas plásticas, Tarugos plásticos, ginas para damas y una extensa variedad de calzado plástico. Esta solicitando el crédito debido a la temporada de invierno ya que es una época en que la gente compra calzado de plástico para protegerse de la lluvia, ella quiere aprovechar esos ingresos para darle a sus hijas la oportunidad de seguir en la escuela y sueña con que se lleguen a graduar y por ello es que lucha diariamente. Ha sido usuaria de Fape y ha demostrado buen record de pago.
texts.en: Emma Aracely is 35 years old and owns a stand where she sells footwear made of plastic such as boots, cleats, flip-flops and a wide variety of plastic shoes. She is asking for a loan because the rainy season is approaching, and this is when many people buy plastic footwear to protect themselves from the rain. She would like to take advantage of this potential income to give her daughters the opportunity to continue attending school. Her dream is for them to be able to graduate and this is what she works towards every day. She has taken out loans from FAPE [Kiva Field Partner] before and has a good repayment record.

loans.use: buy plastic footwear

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Dilia de 35 años de edad, vive con su mamá y su hija en casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende  frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo,  etc. vive en un municipio de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Ana Dilia  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería como pollo, arroz, frijoles, harina, manteca, jabón, frescos, aguas, galletas,  etc. con el apoyo que se le brinde pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Ana Dilia is 35 years old. She lives with her mother and daughter in her own house. For 10 years now, she has devoted her time to selling groceries. In her business, she sells soft drinks, donuts, beans, rice, dairy products, soap, chicken, etc. She lives in a municipality of Choluteca, in southern Honduras.

Ana Dilia is an enterprising woman with dreams of success. She strives every day to improve her quality of life. She is requesting this loan to buy products to stock the convenience store, such as chicken, rice, beans, flour, soap, soft drinks, water, cookies, etc. With the support offered to her, she hopes to increase her income and improve her quality of life. She is a new client who hopes to work with Prisma. 

Her dream is to have a good business that is well-stocked and at the same time better her future together with her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  August 2014

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice, beans, flour, lard, soap, soft drinks, water, cookies, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ludybel

texts.en:
Ludybel is a 52-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ludybel has operated a fish vending business for 30 years and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Ludybel would like to save enough money  to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 45 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This summer their daughter began living separately after getting married. She has been working as an interior designer at a private firm since 2009. Her husband renders taxi services to local people. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as fiberglass, bricks, cement and foam for house renovations. As a result, her family will burn less coal for heating and then release less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa de 65 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su compañero de vida logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Felipa vive en casa alquilada con su compañero de vida y su hija que hace poco se fue a vivir con ellos, ella  esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas ya que le ha estado yendo bien en las ventas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Felipa is 65 years old and earns her living selling tortillas in her house. For several years, she's worked from Monday to Sunday. 

She has a lot of customers, as she's a very hardworking and friendly person. With the income she earns, and the help of her partner, she's able to pay for household expenses. 

Felipa lives in a rented house with her life partner and daughter, who came to live with them a short time ago. 

She's seeking a loan again to buy sacks of corn to continue making tortillas, as sales have been going well. With this, she'll earn a better income to have better economic stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn.

loans.name: Margarita Antonia

texts.es:
Margarita de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta 3°grado, era la mayor de sus hermanos y por lo tanto tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar, está casada y su esposo ya no trabaja pues es bastante mayor, tiene 2 hijos que son mayores de edad los cuales apoyan a sus padres económicamente.


Margarita tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas, está iniciando pues tiene dos meses en el  negocio, antes tenía un molino pero había mucha competencia y por lo tanto pensó en otro negocio, la venta de tortillas la tiene en su casa y espera que sea un negocio rentable para salir adelante.


El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar  4 sacos de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas, el lugar donde compra está a 12 km de su casa y por lo tanto quiere aprovechar el transporte en comprar todo de una vez.
  
Su sueño es siempre poder trabajar para mantener a su esposo ya que él trabajó por muchos años para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 52 years ols, she studied up until 3rd grade. She was the eldest of her siblings, so she had to devote her time to working. She is married and her husband no longer works as he is quite a bit older. She has two adult children who support their parents financially. 

Margarita has a business selling tortillas. She is just getting started and has only had the business two months. Previously, she had a mill, but there was a lot of competition, so she thought of another business. She sells the tortillas from her home and hopes it will be a profitable business and a success. 

The loan requested is needed to buy four sacks of corn to make tortillas. The place where she buys the corn is 12 km from her home, so she wants to take advantage of the transportation and buy everything at once. 
  
Her dream is to always be able to work and support her husband since he worked many years for her and their children.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Dilenia

texts.es:
La  señora Dilenia es una persona emprendedora,  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado. 
Doña Dilenia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de vacas para tener más mercadería para la venta, con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer y cubrir así sus necesidades.
Doña Dilenia uno de sus sueños es que en unos 3 años su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose para que se convierta en uno de los más grandes y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Dilenia is an entrepreneurial, honest and serious person. She lives with her husband and their three children in the south of Honduras. Her business is the buying and selling of cattle.

Dilenia needs the loan to buy cows to have more merchandise for sale. With the loan, she hopes her business' sales will increase to have more merchandise to offer and thus cover her necessities.

One of Dilenia's dreams is for her business to still be growing in three years, and consolidating it so that it becomes one of the largest and most recognized in the area and continues supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy cows for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Libertador Group

texts.es:
Dúo Cristo Libertador
Doña Elba Aracely es originaria de Tecpan, Guatemala tiene 36 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad esta su hijo de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos a mano y a la venta de medicinas naturales.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió  en sus tejidos y en la venta de medicinas naturales, gracias al apoyo de su esposo ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio, surtirlo con mas variedad de productos ya que asi tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a su hijo a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Elba Aracely is a native of Tecpan, Guatemala. She's 36 years old, of a young age. Her responsibility is her four-year-old son. She earns a living making fabric by hand and selling natural medicines.

She invested the loan she received in her fabrics and in the selling of natural medicines. Thanks to her husband's help, she's moving forward with her business, as it's the means she has to get ahead.

Her dream is to grow her business more and to stock it with a wider variety of products. Thus she will have better income and be able to send her son to school for a better future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make and sell traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Marcia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marcia tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo es empleado de una ferretería, tiene dos hijos quienes aún no estudian ya que están pequeños.


Marcia ha trabajado desde pequeña junto a sus padres, ya que a ellos siempre les ha gustado el negocio de comercio y transmitieron a su hija esta actividad. Marcia trabajó durante mucho tiempo en una tienda pero actualmente solo se dedica a cuidar de sus dos pequeños hijos, y su esposo es quien están pendiente de llevar el sustento el hogar.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar cemento y arena para repellar su vivienda, de esta forma se contribuirá a que Marcia y su familia vivan en buenas condiciones.

Ella desea es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, y sobre todo, ahorrar para que sus hijos se puedan preparar académicamente, ya que dice que la mejor herencia que podría brindarles es la educación.
texts.en:
Marcia is 28 years old. She studied up until high school. She is married and her husband works at a hardware store. She has 2 children who aren't in school yet because they are still young.

Marcia has worked from an early age with her parents since they have always liked the sales business and they passed this activity on to her. Marcia worked at a store for a long time, but currently she only takes care of her two young children. Her husband is the one who provides for the family.

She needs this loan to buy cement and sand to plaster her house. This will help Marcia and her family to live in good conditions.

She wants to keep working to help her husband with the household expenses and, above everything, save money so that her children can prepare themselves academically since they say that the best legacy you can give them is education.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster her house.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
La  señora Rosibel  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su  esposo  e hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   venta  tortillas. 
Doña Rosibel el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maíz, leña y cal,  con esta inversión  espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y también poder atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
 Doña Rosibel espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años sueña con que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno  de los  negocios más grande de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	


Choluteca, Honduras  –  Agosto   del   2014
texts.en:
Rosibel is a responsible, hardworking and honest person. She lives with her husband and children in the south of Honduras. Her business is selling tortillas.

Rosibel needs the loan to buy corn, wood and lime. With this investment, she hopes the sales in her business will increase to have more products to offer and also better be able to serve her customers.

Rosibel wants to cover the necessities she has and improve the quality of her family's life a bit. In several years, she dreams her business will continue growing and become one of the largest businesses in the region, and that her children will become good people with better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina de 54 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, pues sus padres vivían en una pobreza inmensa y eso les impidió darle estudios a Marina. Ella está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia.


Marina se dedica a la  agricultura y crianza de animales, sus padres le enseñaron esta actividad, ella cultiva maíz, yuca y frijol, y además cría ganado, su esposo es quien le ayuda en el trabajo que realiza ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar ganado, con este préstamo se está contribuyendo para que Marina continúe realizando una de las labores que más le gustan.


Su sueño es tener mucho ganado, terrenos propios donde mantenerlos en pastoreo, además sueña con seguir cultivando maíz, yuca y frijol.
texts.en:
Marina is 54 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school because her parents lived in extreme poverty which prevented her from getting an education. She has a life partner who is a farmer.  They have three children, only one of whom goes to school.  

Marina is a farmer and grows corn, yucca, and beans.  She also raises cattle. Her parents taught her how to do this. Her husband helps her with this work as this is their main source of income. She needs the loan to buy cattle and the money will allow Marina to continue doing the work she most enjoys. Her dream is to have a lot of cattle and her own land on which to graze them. She also dreams of continuing to grow corn, yucca and beans.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Elkin Alexander

texts.es:
Elkin, un joven de 25 años, vive en el municipio de Bello, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Este joven de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de comidas rápidas en el parque principal del municipio, tiene alquilado un pequeño local donde montara su empresa.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Elkin podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que pagara sus estudios y aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mesas, sillas, algunas adecuaciones locativas y en la compra de surtido e ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos.

Colabora a un joven emprendedor, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Elkin, a young man of 25 years old, lives in the town of Bello, a small city where the opportunities of getting ahead in life are hard and commercial competition is quite tough. 

This kid with an entrepreneurial mind and big wishes of getting ahead has the project of starting a business of fast food at the main park of the town. He has rented a small shop where he will establish his business.

With the help of this loan, Elkin will be able to fulfill his dream of being independent and generate his own incomes, which will help him to pay for his studies and help with the household expenses.

The money will be used to buy tables, chairs, supplies and ingredients for the preparation of food, and remodel parts of the shop. 

Help a young entrepreneur with a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and supplies for the preparation of food, and to remodel parts of the shop.

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es: Beatriz de 41 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 4 hijos 3 de ellos ya mayores de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos gracias a su trabajo de operaria en una empresa, dicha actividad la realizada desde hace 19 años. Beatriz desea reparar el baño, la pila y el servicio sanitario de su vivienda ya que tiene bastante tiempo de haberlos construido por lo que se están deteriorando, es por ello que Beatriz solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y tubos de pvc,  para reparar el baño, la pila y el servicio sanitario de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Beatriz of 41 years old is a single mother and lives in her own house along with her 4 children, 3 of them of legal age. Thanks to her tenacity she has being able to support her 4 children. She works at a company as an operator. She has performed this activity for the past 19 years. 

Beatriz wishes to repair the bathroom, the sink and the sanitary service of her house, since they were built a long time ago and are now deteriorated. This is the reason why Beatriz is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to buy: cement, sand and PVC tubes, in order to repair the bathroom, the sink and the sanitary service of her house.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand and PVC tubes to repair the bathroom, the sink and the sanitary service of her house.

loans.name: Mayra Ivette

texts.es: Mayra labora como docente en un colegio público y sus planes a futuro es seguir estudiando para poder llegar a ser directora, ella continua con el proyecto de construcción de su vivienda, espera con este crédito terminar las partes principales aunque le haga falta ciertos detalles que se pueden ir haciendo con el tiempo, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para comprar los materiales y continuar el muro perimetral que colinda con el vecino, esta obra le vendrá a dar privacidad a su familia y seguridad.
texts.en:
Mayra works as a teacher in a public school.  Her plans are to continue studying so that she can be the director one day.

She continues working on building her house and hopes to finish the main parts with this loan, although there are still some details that will be done over time. At this time she is asking for a loan to buy the materials she needs to continue work on the outside wall bordering her neighbor. This will give her family privacy and security.

loans.use: Comprara cemento,arena, hierro, bloques.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling seashells in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of seashells to sell at her business.

Josephine successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Josephine's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of seashells to sell.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor de 61 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos, dos de ellos trabajan y el otro estaba estudiando pero dejó sus estudios después que murió su madre.

Victor trabaja en  la albañilería desde hace varios años, trabajo que aprendió cuando era ayudante de otros albañiles, cuando no tiene trabajo de albañil vende productos como pan y galleta para no quedarse sin ingresos para el hogar, además Victor cultiva  maíz pues es algo que también le ha gustado hacer desde hace mucho tiempo.

Con este crédito se ayudará a Victor para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para cultivar maíz.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos con un trabajo estable y con salud para poder enfrentarse a la vida y luchar para siempre lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Victor, 61 years old, is the father of three children.  Two of his children are working and the other was a student, but left school after his mother died.
Victor has worked as a mason for several years, work he learned while an assistant to other masons.  When he has no work as a mason, he sells products such as bread and crackers in order not to be without income for the household.  Victor grows corn, and this work is one he has enjoyed doing for a long time.

This loan will help Victor buy fertilizers and seeds to grow corn. His dream is to see his children have regular work and good health to meet life and fight to always achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for growing corn

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en: Artemio manages a bakery business in his town. His bakery is known in town because of its delicious bread. His specialty in his bakery is “buko roll” bread with coconut stuffing. Due to a rapid increase of his customers, Artemio wants to serve them well so that they stay regular customers. In this connection, Artemio is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and coconut for his bread ingredients. Artemio hopes to meet all his customers' demands, to increase his sales, and to have a continuously profitable business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and coconut for his bread ingredients.

loans.name: Sunjidmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Sunjidmaa is 32 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a geologist at a private firm since 2010. Her husband is an interior designer and works on his own. Their son began high school this autumn. The family lives in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Sunjidmaa is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass, foam and felts for her ger. After insulation, her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to insulate her home in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is married with 4 children. She is 49 years old and lives in Lawigan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines.

Rena sells different clothes to earn a living and had this business for 16 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 30,000 for additional capital buy more clothes to sell/retail.

Rena has been a member of PMPC this year, 2014. In the future, Rena hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell/retail

location.town: Liloy- Lawigan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy. She is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase a variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education,and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Nancy would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store will make her store attractive and will increase her sales and income. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She is looking forward, with thankfulness in her heart, for the financial assistance that will be given to her.

Nancy aims for her business to grow and she desires to give her family a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Sara Norma

texts.es:
La constancia, la disciplina y el amor por su trabajo, han permitido durante cuarenta años que doña Sara tenga un negocio estable. Ella está muy agradecida por el financiamiento de Kiva a través de MiCrédito, ya que gracias a este logró comprar electrodomésticos, tales como grabadoras, sillas de plástico, platos de vidrios, entre otros. Esto le permitió ganar más clientela y generar más ingresos, lo que benefició en la economía familiar. A sus 60 años tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando, siempre se levanta con mucha energía para atender a sus clientes y ofrecerles atención y productos de calidad.

Solicita un segundo crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar electrodomésticos tales como licuadoras, microondas, abanicos, sillas de plásticos, instrumentos de cocina, entre otros. Asegura que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá satisfacer la demanda de su clientela y al mismo tiempo aumentar sus ingresos. Entre sus planes futuros está mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y lograr establecer un negocio más amplió, hará todo lo posible por hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Perseverance, discipline and love for her work are what have allowed Sara to have a stable business for 40 years. She is very grateful for the Kiva financing she has received through MiCredito (My Loan), because thanks to the loan she was able to buy household appliances such as recorders, plastic chairs, glass dishes, etc. This permitted her to get more customers and generate more income which benefitted her household finances. 

At 60 years old she still wants to continue to work and gets up every day with a lot of energy to tend to her customers and offer them quality products. She is asking for a second loan to improve the productivity of her capital. She needs to buy appliances such as blenders, microwaves, fans, plastic chairs, kitchen tools, etc.  She is sure that the loan will be very helpful because she will be able to satisfy the demand of her customers and increase her income at the same time. Her future plans include improving the condition of her house and to expand her business. She will do whatever she possibly can to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy household appliances such as blenders, microwaves, fans, plastic chairs, cooking utensils, etc.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María de 69 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos para brindarle la oportunidad de seguir estudiando y además la escuela estaba demasiado lejos de su casa, tiene 6 hijos que ya formaron sus propios hogares, su esposo falleció hace años por lo tanto María solo vive con una nieta de 14 años de edad.


Desde muy pequeña, María ha trabajado en la agricultura ya que sus padres fueron agricultores y realizaban cultivos de maíz, frijol y sorgo. Actualmente María siembra maíz y frijol, y para esto recibe ayuda de dos de sus hijos y sus nietos. El lugar donde cultiva está aproximadamente a 1 km de su casa y para llegar se va a pie. 


El crédito será invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz y frijol y así podrá asegurar estos granos para la alimentación del próximo año.

Ella sueña con tener una mejor vivienda, ya que actualmente vive en una casa de bahareque y está dañada, además le gustaría dedicarse a la crianza de pollos.
texts.en:
María is 69 years old. She studied up until the 3rd grade because her parents didn't have the financial resources to provide her with the opportunity to continue studying and also because the school was too far from home. She has 6 children who already have their own families. Her husband passed away years ago, so María only lives with her granddaughter who is 14 years old.

From an early age, María has worked in agriculture since her parents were farmers and they had corn, bean, and sorghum crops. María currently grows corn and beans and to do so, she receives help from two of her children and her grandchildren. The place where she grows her crops is about 1 km from her house and she gets there by foot.

The loan will be used to purchase farming supplies to grow corn and beans so she can secure these grains for food next year. María dreams about having a better house, since she currently lives in a wattle and daub house and it is damaged. She would also like to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Jackellin Rosario

texts.es:
El amor por la tecnología y la sed de conocimiento por los nuevos inventos tecnológicos, llevaron a Jackellin a tomar una de las decisiones más importantes de toda su vida, estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas. Cursa cuarto año en modo sabatino. Tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y no tiene hijos Los días de semana aparte de estudiar para adquirir nuevos conocimientos sobre computadoras, colabora en el trabajo de sus padres, quienes son agricultores y toda la vida se han esforzado por brindarle lo mejor. Razón por la que quiere progresar y ser un soporte en la economía familiar. 
Jackellin solicita el crédito para pagar la mensualidad de la carrera que estudia, Ingeniería en Sistemas. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que no quiere perder un año de estudio por falta de pago. Es una joven inteligente, responsable y emprendedora. Su meta es lograr obtener las notas más altas y recibirse con honores, de manera que pueda enorgullecer a sus padres y estos estés satisfechos por los logros de su hija. Entre sus planes futuros esta seguir estudiando lo que más le apasiona, anhela obtener un posgrado y una maestría. Aspira encontrar un trabajo donde llegue a poner en práctica todos sus conocimientos y habilidades.
texts.en:
The love of technology and a thirst for knowledge about new technological inventions led Jackellin to make one of the most important decisions of her life: pursuing an education in Computer Engineering. She is in her fourth year of courses, taking them on Saturdays. She is 21 years old, is married, and has no children. On weekdays, she studies to acquire new knowledge about computers and helps with her parents's work as farmers who have worked hard to provide her with the best. For this reason, she wants to progress and be a support for her family's economic situation.
Jackellin is requesting a loan to pay for her monthly tuition in Computer Engineering. She relies on this funding because she does not want to lose a year of study because she is not able to pay. She is a smart, responsible, and enterprising young woman. Her goal is to get the highest grades and receive the highest honors so that her parents will be proud of and satisfied with the achievements of their daughter. Her future plans are to continue studying whats she is passionate about, yearning to obtain a postgraduate degree and a master's degree. She aims to find a job to implement all of her knowledge and skills.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her education in computer engineering

loans.name: Rahiema

texts.en:
Rahiema has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for four years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Rahiema would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 30,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Rahiema dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en: Chanty (in the photo), age 24, is single and lives with her parents in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She is a third-year student, majoring in accounting at the Accounting Institute in Phnom Penh. She asks for a loan in order to pay for her school fees. In addition, Chanty is a receptionist for a private English school when she finishes class. She will graduate in the year 2016 and she hopes to become an accountant for MFIs for Bank!

loans.use: To pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Vilma Haydee

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 33 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 3° grado debido a que no creció con sus padres y la desintegración la afectó, está soltera y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estudian, el otro es menor y aun no ingresa a la escuela. 

Vilma administra una pequeña tienda desde hace unos 5 años, anteriormente  siempre se había dedicado a los oficios domésticos pero luego su madre le apoyó económicamente para que pusiera la tienda y tuviera sus propios ingresos. 

Ella necesita el crédito para terminar la construcción de su casa, comprará cemento, cerámica y pagará mano de obra.

 A ella le gustaría que sus hijos logren estudiar una carrera universitaria y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Vilma is 33 years old and only studied until the 3rd grade because she wasn’t raised by her parents and the separation really affected her. She is single and has 3 children, 2 of them attend to school, and the other one is still too young and doesn’t go to school yet.

Vilma has managed a small store for the last 5 years. Previously, she had been dedicated only to the house chores, but then her mother started supporting her financially so she could establish her own store and have her own incomes.

She needs the loan to finish building her house. She will buy cement, ceramic, and pay for labor.

She would like her kids to study a career and become professionals.

loans.use: to finish building her house, and buy cement, ceramic and pay for labor.

loans.name: José  Mauricio

texts.es:
José tiene 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos.

José se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo, José se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana junto a sus hijos, y en el resto del día cuida otras parcelas.

	Este crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como semilla, veneno, abono, para sembrar una parcela de maíz.

Sus planes a futuro son comprar más animales y con ayuda de otro crédito espera lograrlo.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old. He is married and has four children. 
Jose is a farmer. His parents taught him this work. Jose wakes up at 4:30 am to go to work in the morning with his children. They care for their plots for the rest of the day.
This loan will be used to purchase agricultural inputs such as seed, pesticides, and fertilizers for his corn plants. 
His future plans are to buy more animals. He expects to achieve that goal with another loan.

loans.use: to grow corn

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 47 años de edad, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, solo vive con ella pues todos sus hijos ya viven aparte.

Juan se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcela que alquila, y durante el resto del día trabaja en otras parcelas o cuidando a sus animales.

Él solicita este crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla y abono para sembrar una parcela de maíz que espera le produzca una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia.

Sus planes a  futuro  son incursionar en sembrar cacao para lo cual espera que su esposa lo apoye y juntos lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Juan is 47 years old, is married, and his wife works in their home.  They live alone since all of their children are grown and gone.  

Juan gets up at 5am to go to work each morning on the plot of land that he rents.  During the rest of the day he works on other parcels caring for his animals.  

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase agricultural products such as weed killer, seeds and fertilizer in order to plant a parcel of corn.  He hopes that it will produce a good harvest for the sustenance of his family.

His future plans involve beginning to plant cacao and he hopes that his wife will be able to assist him so that together they can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products such as weed killer, seeds and fertilizer in order to plant a parcel of corn.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Evelin es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, tiene un bebe de 1 año y su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, persistente, divertida, sincera, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio es un atienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad, ubicado en la ciudad de Cochabamba que está situado a 2.558 metros sobre el nivel del mar y se encuentra en la parte central del país limita al Norte con Beni, al Sur con Potosí y Chuquisaca, al Este con Santa Cruz y al Oeste con La Paz y Oruro, gran parte del departamento es montañoso y está atravesado por la Cordillera de Cochabamba que forma parte del ramal oriental de la Cordillera de los Andes, La Cordillera de Cochabamba es una agrupación de montañas entre las que se destacan Tunari, Arkupunku, Cocapata, Mazo Cruz, Yanaqaqa, Totora.
Evelin es de tez morena, cabello largo castaño, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el quechua el cual utiliza con su familia y en el comercio utiliza el español (de pie a la derecha, pantalón rojo, sueter negro). Su negocio es una tienda de barrio que atiende de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche. Sus deseos por mejorar su calidad de vida la han llevado a formar una banca empresarial de personas con diferentes emprendimientos y necesidades similares. La estrategia de Evelin es bastante sencilla; Ella vio que las tiendas cercanas cerraban a mediodía, cuando mucha gente viene de sus trabajos a comer a casa, lo mismo sucedía por la tarde, que cerraban a las 21:00 como muy tarde, también se dio cuenta que las tiendas regentadas por asiáticos no cerraban, sus horarios eran más amplios, pero la clientela no se fiaba mucho de ellos, por todo esto decidió abrir su tienda de 7 de la mañana a 12 de la noche, incluido fines de semana y días festivos. Al momento su tienda es un próspero negocio.
Ella sueña ampliar su negocio y alquilar un cuarto más grande, por el momento su necesidad es la de abastecer sus anaqueles con todo tipo de alimentos de primera necesidad realizando la compra por mayor de alimentos y artículos de limpieza para el hogar, ella desea poder pagar una buena educación para su pequeño bebé y desde este momento ya está en sus planes.
Es por esos motivos que Evelin solicita un préstamo para la compra por mayor de artículos de primera necesidad y con los beneficios darle una buena educación a su bebé.
texts.en:
Evelin is a 25 year old single woman with a one-year-old baby. Her business is a neighborhood general store. 
She is enterprising, feisty, strong, persistent, funny, sincere, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is a general store in her neighborhood located in the city of Cochabamba which is 2,558 meters above sea level located in the central part of the country bordered on the north by Beni, Potosi, and the south with Chuquisaca, east of Santa Cruz, and west of La Paz and Oruro. Much of the Department is mountainous. It is crossed by the Cordillera de Cochabamba part of the eastern branch of the Andes. This Cordillera is a grouping of mountains that include Tunari, Arkupunku, Cocapata, Mazo Cruz, Yanaqaqa, and Totora. 
Evelin has a dark complexion, long brown hair, and medium build. Her mother tongue is Quechua which she speaks at home. She uses Spanish for commerce. She is standing on the right with red pants and a black sweater. She attends her neighborhood grocery store business that is open from Monday to Sunday from 7 am to late at night. She desires to improve her quality of life which has led her to form a loan group with people with similar businesses and needs. Evelin's strategy is quite simple. She saw that nearby shops closed at noon when many come people come home for lunch. Many also closed in the afternoon. She also realized that the stores run by Asians did not close. Their hours were longer but the clientele  did not find them very trustworthy. Therefore, she decided to open her shop from 7 am to 12 midnight, including weekends and holidays when her shop is a thriving business.
She dreams of expanding her business and renting a larger room. Now her need is to fill their shelves with all sorts of food staples by making the purchase bulk food and cleaning supplies for home. She wants to pay for a good education for her little baby. He is already in her plans. 
It is for these reasons that Evelin requesting a loan to purchase wholesale necessities and with the earning she will give a good education for her child.

loans.use: to stock her general store

loans.name: Oscar Daniel

texts.es:
El Jove Oscar Daniel de 27  años de edad vive en su casa propia junto a sus padres  se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta abarrotería en general, vive en un municipio Choluteca,  al sur de Honduras vende productos como, arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, frescos, café, y otros mas,   sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y personas de las comunidades y aldeas y caseríos cercanos a su él.
Oscar Daniel es un hombre emprendedor y lucha día con día para superarse junto a su familia, es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de café, confites, bombones, y pan, leche, huevos, arroz, aceite, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita seguir adelante con su negocio y le genere los ingresos necesarios para seguir apoyando a sus padres en el hogar. 
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida junto con su familia.


San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Agosto 2014
texts.en:
The young man Oscar Daniel is 27 years old and lives in his own home with his parents.  He has worked for the past 10 years selling groceries in a general store.  He lives in the city of Choluteca, in the south of Honduras.  He sells products such as rice, sugar, butter, beans, soft drinks, coffee, and other items.  His customers are all his neighbors and people from the community and surrounding villages close to where he lives.

Oscar Daniel is an entrepreneurial man who struggles day after day in order to help his family get ahead.  He is a hard-working man with a desire to work with Prisma, Kiva's field partner.  He is asking for a loan in order to purchase coffee, pastries, candies, bread, milk, eggs, rice, oil, etc.  He hopes that this investment will allow him to grow his business and to generate the income necessary to continue supporting his parents in their home.  

His dream is to grow the business and to improve his quality of life along with that of his family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to purchase coffee, pastries, candies, bread, milk, eggs, rice, oil, etc. for his grocery store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 49 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Rosita has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 5000 each month doing this type of small business. Rosita has a requested a loan for additional capital to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business.
Rosita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rosita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business.

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara, aged 20 years old, is single and lives with his parents and sister and brother in a village about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Tara is a motorcycle repairman. He plans to buy a motorcycle for family transportation because he does not have his own. Hence he decided to apply for a loan in order to add it to his own money for making the purchase.

loans.use: To add to his own money to buy a motorcycle for family transportation.

loans.name: Erasma

texts.en:
Erasma is 45 years old and comes from Cogon, Ozamiz City. She is married with two children. Having started her food processing business from a mere capital of 2000 PHP, she is coping well with the challenges of her business. Her husband who is a carpenter is very supportive in taking care of their business.

Erasma joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans to buy raw ingredients. She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future. She dreams also of having a good life with their children and she started saving now for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Jose Hernan

texts.es:
El señor José de 36 años de edad vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos, vive en un municipio de Choluteca,  al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de Pan, el vende semitas, polvorones, guarachas, lenguas y también vende manteca, azúcar, pasta de dientes, etc. 
Don José sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas de las comunidades, aldeas y caseríos cercanos, el se trasporta en su vehículo a vender todos los días su producto, es un hombre emprendedor y lucha día con día para superarse junto a su familia.
Don José está solicitando el préstamo para comprarle 4 llantas nuevas para su vehículo, polvorones, lenguas, guarachas, etc. y así tenerlo en buenas condiciones de trabajo y poder transportar su producto, espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida junto con su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto 2014
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and lives at home with his wife in children in a town called Choluteca in southern Honduras. He has sold bread for ten years. He also sells various types of rolls and sweet buns, as well as butter, sugar, toothpaste, and more.
Jose's clients are his neighbors and people in his community and the villages and hamlets nearby. He has a vehicle he uses to sell his product every day. He is an entrepreneur and works day-to-day to support his family. Jose is requesting a loan to buy 4 new tires for his vehicle as well as the types of bread and rolls he sells. He will have better working conditions and be able to transport his product. He expects that this investment will help improve his income. 
His dream is to grow his business and enhance his family's quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 20

loans.use: to purchase new tires for the vehicle he uses to deliver bread

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through PMPC to purchase materials, such as wood, nails and glue, for furniture making. Modesto has been in this business for 10 years now. He would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials, such as wood, nails and glue, for furniture making

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is thankful that she was previously granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy computer units, accessories and spare parts for her computer shop. Her earnings helped provide for her child's education and meet the family's daily personal and household needs. 

Jocelyn would like to again apply for a PHP 15,000 loan to cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily household needs and her children's school needs. Jocelyn looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes that her business will grow and expand so she can save for her children's college education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of her computer shop.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. She not only practices her hobby; she earns an income, as well. At the age of 22 and married, Mary Ann busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, Mary Ann applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Mary Ann wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo, 44 years old, is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and two children. Leonardo has a furniture business which he handles personally. 

Leonardo wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan to enable him to purchase furniture materials and designs. This will help him attract more clients so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase materials for furniture making

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 53 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado, debido a los pocos recursos económicos que tenían sus padres se le dificultó continuar con sus estudios, hoy en día está casado y su esposa trabaja en la costura, tiene 4 hijos y todos son profesionales en la costura.


Luis es sastre, ya tiene alrededor de 40 años trabajando en la costura, decidió dedicarse a esto por un tío que lo indujo, entonces Luis buscó quien le enseñara a cortar pantalones y poco a poco después continuó con las demás prendas, es así como ahora él fabrica prendas para niños, para ocasiones especiales como para bautismos y elabora uniformes escolares, en este negocio se involucran toda su familia y el horario de trabajo es variado, según como estén de materia prima y los pedidos que tengan.   


Él solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para comprar materia prima como lo es tela, botones, hilo de diferentes colores y otros, es así  como Luis piensa cumplir con la demanda de los clientes.
  
Su sueño es seguir fabricando prendas, cumplir con la demanda de los clientes, apoyar a sus hijos que aún se encuentran estudiando.
texts.en:
Luis, age 53, studied until the 4th grade. Due to the lack of economic resources that his parents had, it was difficult for him to continue with his studies. Nowadays, he is married and his wife sews. He has 4 children and they are all professionals in the skill of sewing. 

Luis is a tailor and has worked in this activity for the past 40 years. He decided to dedicate to this activity because his uncle encouraged him to, so Luis looked for someone to teach him how to cut pants. Little by little he continued his learning with other garments. 

He now makes children’s clothing for special occasions, like baptisms, and also makes school uniforms. The whole family gets involved in this activity and the working schedule changes depending on the raw materials and the orders that they have. 

He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to buy supplies, like fabric, buttons, thread of different colors and others. This way, Luis will be able to satisfy his client’s requests.

His dream is to continue making clothes, satisfy his clients’ needs, and support his children who are still studying.

loans.use: to buy supplies, like fabric, buttons, thread of different colors and others.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 37-year-old lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda with her 4 children aged 16, 13, 11 and 8; all attend school. She also has 3 additional dependents. She sells dry food, farms, and has a produce store. Limited capital is her challenge, but she hopes to educate all of her children. Christine needs a loan to buy maize, beans and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: José Santiago

texts.es:
José tiene 60 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, está casado y su esposa le ayuda en las actividades agrícolas.


José se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos y en la tarde trabaja cuidando las vacas.


	El presente crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. cuenta  con la experiencia necesaria de varios años para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha y llegar a obtener buenos ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Sus planes a futuro son comprar más ganado y generar más producción de leche.
texts.en:
José is 60 years old and he makes his living in agriculture and grains. He is married and his wife helps him with farming activities. José wakes up at 5:00am to leave for the plots where he works in the morning along with his children. In the afternoon, he works late taking care of the cattle.

The current loan he needs is to buy agricultural inputs like pesticide, seeds, fertilizer, etc. He has the necessary experience from various years of work to produce a good harvest and obtain a good income to sustain his family.

His future plans are to buy more livestock and generate more milk production.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as pesticides, seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Lari Pioneer Vegetable Processors (C.b.o) Group

texts.en:
Purity, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Lari Pioneer Vegetable Processors Group. She is a single mother aged 60 years, with one child in primary school.

Purity raises poultry, an enterprise she started after Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) training where she acquired skills on savings, enterprise development and financial management. She is happy about HiH EA because the training has helped her gain business management skills.

In 2013, she borrowed Kenya Shillings (Ksh) 10,000 from HiH EA Enterprise Incubation Fund  (E.I.F) to boost her farming, and  finished repaying in April 2014. She is now requesting a new loan to further expand her business through the purchase of more chickens. 

Purity hopes that the loan will boost her business and hence her income. This will ensure food security in her household.  Purity is grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy additional chickens

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en:
Phoeurn, 42 years old, is a local farmer from Kampot province. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is pursuing a bachelor's degree at a local university. Phoeurn has previously borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. Her living conditions are getting better than before and she can keep her child until he gets his university degree. 

She now wants to focus on her daughter's education. Therefore, she has applied for a new loan in order to pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a new job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is a dedicated housewife, living in Lahore with her husband and three children. She is 39 years old. Her husband drives a three-wheeled rickshaw in his community. He provides pick-up and drop-off services, and transports people to different locations within Lahore. As he is the sole person earning, it is very difficult for them to meet their daily expenses. He works really hard to pay for these expenses. 

Due to constant driving, his rickshaw needs repair, as the tires have worn out, the seats need to be replaced, etc. Therefore, Seema has requested a loan to help her husband pay for the repair cost of the rickshaw. 

They are thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their assistance.

loans.use: to cover the repair cost of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Ana Andrea

texts.es: Doña Ana Andrea de 62 años de edad tiene mas de diez años de estar recibiendo el apoyo de Fape KIVA esto le a ayudado a que su negocio de tortillería y venta de comida le siga dando los ingresos necesarios para seguir ayudando a sus hijos y ahora también a sus nietos a que estudien y se superen. Solicita el crédito para la compras de maíz, por quintal, leña de robLe y pino y así mismo materiales para cocinar.
texts.en:
Doña Ana Andrea of 62 years old has received the help of Fape KIVA for over 10 years. Thanks to this support she has obtained the necessary income from her business making tortillas and the sale of food, to support her children and grandchildren to study and get ahead in life. 

She is requesting this loan to buy corn in quintal, oak wood and pinewood and supplies for cooking.

loans.use: to buy corn and wood for her business making tortillas.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 30-year-old man who deals in farming i.e. banana and tomato farming. He faces a problem of weather changes but hopes to educate his children and construct a house. He needs a loan to improve on his banana plantation by mulching.

loans.use: to improve on his banana plantation by mulching.

loans.name: Remegious

texts.en: Remegious is a 49-year-old man with 4 children. He has a produce store and also earns from selling firewood. He faces a problem of limited capital but hopes to educate his children. He needs a loan to buy rice, beans and maize to sell and to plant rice.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and maize to sell and to plant rice.

loans.name: Nemi

texts.en: Nemi is 63 years old and widowed. He lives in a rural community where he operates a motorcycle transport service to generate additional income. Due to life's hardships, Nemi aims to earn a higher income to satisfy his family's necessities. To continuously operate his motorcycle, Nemi would like to take out a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sprockets, oil, wheels, gasoline and accessories needed for his motorcycle. He believes that this financial assistance will enable him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy sprockets, oil, wheels, gasoline and accessories needed for his motorcycle

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en: Milagrosa is 52 years old and from Cogon Ozamiz City.She started her food processing from a mere capital of 3000. She is coping well with the challenges of her business.She has joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans.She is now requesting a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her business.She is determined to maintain a good credit-standing whatever may happen,so she can always go to the cooperative in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet to improve access to water and sanitation for the family.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina, 20 years old, is single and she lives in Ermera. She sells clothes because she earns a good income from this business. Angelina is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business by buying more panties, shorts, shirts, kids' clothes and other items to sell. 

Angelina opened her business in 2006 with her own working capital of $500. She lives in the center of the area so many people come to buy her clothes. Angelina hopes that, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, her management can be strong. She also has animals, such as cows, pigs, chickens and dogs, at her house.

loans.use: to buy panties, shorts, shirts, kids' clothes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 25, married, and a mother of three children. She is a housewife and takes care of her household. Her husband is responsible for bringing income for the family. He provides whitewash services in the community. He has five years of experience and is skilled and good at his work. That is why he has made a good customer base. But still, his income is not sufficient and he has to work really hard to meet his family expenses.  

Currently he is getting orders for which he needs paints, lubricants, brushes, and oils for paint purposes. But due to insufficient income, he is unable to buy the raw material. Nadia has therefore requested a loan to help her husband with the purchase of raw material. 

They are thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva. Their dream is to educate their children and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's paint work (whitewash).

loans.name: Suqra

texts.en:
Suqra is a 54-year-old IDP (internally Displaced Person) who lives with her husband and two daughters in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a veterinarian but the family's main source of income is gardening. Suqra grows fruits such as cherries, peaches, pears and plums and vegetables such as cucumbers, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, etc. Her monthly income is 250 AZN.

Suqra has been working as a gardener for 33 years and has good experience. She knows everything about gardening. She sells her harvest at a local bazaar and local people like Suqra’s fruits and vegetables. 

Suqra’s income doesn’t cover the family’s demands. She has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy garden tools and fertilizers. Once the garden's productivity improves, Suqra will be able to pay for her children education and cover living costs.

loans.use: to buy garden tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 33 years old, married and has two children. He is raising his family in a rural community and aiming for a happy and successful life. 

To attain his goal, he operates his motorcycle transport business to generate additional income. To continuously operate his motorcycle, he wants to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders through ASKI amounting to 5,000 PHP to buy wheels, gasoline and other spare parts for his motorcycle. Through this loan, he believes that he will further improve his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy wheels, gasoline and other spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita, a responsible mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruit and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruit and vegetables for retail

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita requested a PHP 50,000 loan through PMPC to buy more meat to sell. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of meat

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella, is 57 years old and a resident of Catadman,Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has one kid. She owns a "sari-sari store" (small grocery store) that forms part of their house, and her neighbours are their clients. 

She has decided to improve their small business to support their family. So, she has requested a loan at Paglaum MPC in the amount of 10,000PHP. Aside from the financial assistance, she also received add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: The borrower will use this loan  to buy goods to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana has been involved in business activities since 2006. She started with her own working capital of 600 USD. She is 32 years old and has two children. She has a kiosk in her house and she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin which she will use to buy additional stock of water, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, biscuits, candies and other items including soft drinks and hard drinks to sell. She has many animals in her house like buffaloes, pigs, chickens and dogs. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she can improve her business management.

loans.use: to buy water, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, biscuits, candies and other items including soft drinks and hard drinks to sell.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en:
Shareefan is 35, married, and the mother of two children. She is a hardworking and caring housewife. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has four years of experience in this field. He has been driving a rented rickshaw until now, but most of his income washes away paying for the rent, and they are left with little money to pay for their household expenses. They pass their days with great difficulty. 

Now Shareefan’s husband has decided to buy a new rickshaw of his own to generate more income. Shareefan has therefore requested a loan to help her husband buy a new rickshaw. They will pay off this loan in easy installments. Her husband is hopeful that this will have a positive impact on their income and that they will be able to educate their children.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is 23, married and blessed with one child. Her husband runs an auto spare parts shop in the community. It has been two years that he has been running this business. As it is a new setup, he has to work really hard to generate good income for his family. He still has some start-up costs to cover. He is skilled and behaves well with his customers; that is why he has been able to attract more customers. 

He wants to buy more auto spare parts to avoid any shortage and loss of potential customers, but he is currently short of funds. To help her husband with the lack of investment, Seema has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. 

Her husband's dream is to become successful in his business and to provide their child a good life.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's auto spare parts sales business.

loans.name: Shafaq

texts.en:
Shafaq is 32 years old, divorced and a refugee. She lives with her two sons in an IDP settlement. 

Shafaq is a farmer and has been breeding cows for 10 years. She breeds, fattens them and then sells dairy products and meat at a local bazaar. She has worked in this field for 10 years and earns 200 AZN monthly.

Husbandry is very popular in Azerbaijan. People buy dairy products every day and use meat to cook delicious national dishes. 

Shafaq’s income doesn’t cover her family’s demands. She needs money to pay for her children's education and utilities. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy three cows and increase productivity. 
She loves her sons and wants to provide them with bright future.

loans.use: to buy three cows.

loans.name: Ulduz

texts.en:
Ulduz is a 55-year-old divorced woman. She is a refugee and lives in an IDP settlement. She lives with her brother and earns money for living by working as a gardener. She has been raising live plants for 32 years and knows everything about planting. She gets 140 AZN monthly.

Ulduz is very a kind and friendly woman. Local people know her very well. She sells plants and beautiful flowers. She loves her job very much and says that flowers like people and get offended when no one take care of them.

Ulduz is very a responsible woman. She wants to help her family in such a hard period. She plans to expand her assortment of plants and flowers and sell more. This will increase her income. Ulduz applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy more fertilizer and quality garden tools for her flowers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and quality garden tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more empty bottles, iron, plastic and other scrap material to sell.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en: Mrs.Primitiva is 62 years old, married, and a resident of Cabunga-an Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a operator/driver. They are blessed with five children. Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, she decided to engage herself in selling.  She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with a capital of 3,000PHP. Their primary customers are their neighbours. Successfully, she was able to manage it well and able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, which she became a member of last in November 2009. She was able to avail herself of eleven loans, and paid them back religiously. Now, she has applied for a loan of 50,000PHP to finance the additional stocks to purchase for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to buy goods and products for selling at her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 43 years old, and is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and nine children. She is a farmer who plants corn, beans, and is a coconut wine retailer.

Aurelia wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda cooks and sells 'banana cue' and 'camote cue' which are various street foods within their community. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through operating and maintaining their tricycle unit.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 12,000 to buy products like bananas, camote, sugar, oil, and the gas needed to increase her profit.

Hilda hopes to have another tricycle. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more bananas, sugar, oil, and the gas needed in her other business.

loans.name: Jacline

texts.en:
Jacline is 39 years old and married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with six children. She sells and supplies water in Mombasa town, and has been in this business for seven years now and it has been profitable. Her current monthly salary is KES 40,000.

She will be using this loan amount to buy more stock of water cans. This will help her sell and supply more water to her customers. She plans to use the anticipated profits to improve her business.

This is Jacline's second loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loan successfully. 

In future she hopes to improve her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of water cans.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a thirty-nine-year-old married woman with three children, living in Fort Portal- Uganda. She deals in produce, mostly maize farming, buying and selling, and also operates a bar. She used the previous loan to buy stock of beer, soda and spirits to sell.

Gertrude faces a challenge of limited capital but hopes to educate her children. She needs a loan to buy maize seeds to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Shehzadi

texts.en:
Shehzadi is a young woman of 25, married and blessed with one child. She is talented and hardworking. 

She started making and selling embroidery work to support her husband as their family income was not sufficient. She has been in this business for two years now. She makes fine and intricate designs using different threads and beads and is appreciated by her customers. As her customer base has increased she needs more raw material like fabric, threads, beads and pearls for which she does not have sufficient money. Therefore she has requested a loan to buy the required raw material and make beautiful embroidery to sell. She will pay it off through her income. She is happy to be empowered and plans to enhance her business by increasing sales. 

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy material for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Petrona Virginia

texts.es: La señora Petrona es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, el mayor tiene 7 añitos y estudia la escuela primaria, Petrona sustenta su familia gracias a su labor como asistente del hogar por medio tiempo, también hace  tortillas y frijoles cocidos para vender en su casa, uno de sus deseos es mejorar las condiciones de su humilde vivienda y está trabajando en ello, es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar materiales y hacer instalación de tuberías para aguas negras y construir inodoro y baño.
texts.en:
Petrona is a single mother with 3 children. The eldest is 7 years old and is studying in primary school. Petrona sustains her family thanks to her labor as a part time assistant in a home. She also prepares tortillas and cooks beans to sell from her home.

One of her desires is to improve conditions in her humble home and she is working on that. That's why she is requesting a loan to purchase materials and install sewer lines and a toilet bowl and bath.

loans.use: buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, a toilet bowl, and sewer lines to install in her humble home.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 26-year-old man, married to Eunice, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with one child.  Isaac has been operating a clothing sales business for a period of five years, earning an income of KES. 5,000 at the end of every month.

Isaac is now servicing his third loan of KES. 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya; he intends to use this amount to purchase more stock of shirts, blouses, trousers, sweaters, dresses, and shorts to sell to his customers.

Isaac plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot, build a permanent house for his family, and he hopes to expand his business and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, trousers, sweaters and dresses to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Farming, also called agriculture or husbandry, is the cultivation of animals and plants for food and other products used to sustain life. Agriculture in Kenya continues to dominate Kenya’s economy, and is also the largest contributor to Kenya’s gross domestic product.

Charles, 40, started farming approximately six years ago, and although he began farming as a hobby, it eventually became his career. His half-acre of land located in the Kapsowar area of Kenya houses poultry and dairy cows. Charles passionately loves poultry farming. The Kapsowar area is populated, and has a ready market for poultry products. However, Charles' biggest challenge is lack of funds, which is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy poultry. 

Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and you don’t need to be a large scale farmer to benefit from it. Through the loan, Charles will be able to sell eggs, meat, and poultry feathers to the already existing market. The demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people as can be proved when you visit fast food joints in his area. 

Charles has been facing challenges accessing finances, but he feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. Charles chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low, and is on a reducing basis. Charles underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Through the loan, Charles' income will increase and his life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for his family and a positive impact to the community.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is 29, married and blessed with one child. She lives in Lahore with her family. She has been sewing clothes in her community for the last 10 years. She started sewing at a very young age as a hobby but now it is a source of income generation. She sews a variety of designs and her customers are happy with her work. She has managed to maintain a good customer base. She is now self-employed and contributes to the family income along with her husband. As her husband does not have sufficient income, this combined income allows them to meet their daily expenses. Due to constant usage her sewing machine is not working properly and she needs to sew her orders timely. This is why she has applied for a loan to help her repair her sewing machine and start sewing like she does normally. She wants to become successful and attract more customers in the future. She plans to save money so that she can provide higher education to her child.

loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
Etibar is a 43-year-old internally displaced person. He is married and lives with his big family in an IDP settlement. He has three daughters and two sons. He is a farmer and grows wheat in a small field. He has been working in this field for 16 years and earns 220 AZN monthly. 

Agriculture is a major industry in Azerbaijan. Wheat is in high demand because people use it to make flour and for baking. Etibar grows wheat and sells it at the local bazaar. Local restaurants and cafes buy wheat and flour from Etibar.

Etibar’s big family has not got enough money to cover their demands. Etibar plans to buy an additional field and grow more wheat. He hopes that the increase in income will help his family and his children will be able to get a good education.
