loans.use: to buy an additional field and grow more wheat.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina wants to thank the lenders for the previous loan. She has been able to use this loan to re-façade her house and replace the doors. She is still a housewife taking care of her children and home while her husband transports goods for others as a way to provide for his family. 

Sabina has been pleased with the process and the results of their loans. Her home will be more insulated and comfortable in the upcoming cold and wet seasons. Now she would like to request a loan in order to renovate her toilet, which is in urgent need of repair. She is very grateful for the opportunities to improve her living conditions and the health and wellbeing of her family. She wants to thank all of lenders for their support.

loans.use: to renovate her toilet, which is in urgent need of repair.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, cultiva maíz, frijol y hortalizas, es casada, actualmente vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos de 8 y 16 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, sus hijos mayores ya son independientes, los cultivos de hortalizas lo hace junto a su hermano generándoles muy buenas ganancias, también tienen ingresos del cultivo de granos básicos, son actividades que ha desempeñado desde muy joven.
Con el préstamo comprara abono, fertilizantes y semilla, para sus diferentes cultivos, de esta manera obtendrá mejores cosechas, mejorara su situación económica y seguirá distribuyendo sus productos para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, una ventaja para el negocio es que en las tierras que realiza la siembra tiene  sus propias fuentes de agua. 
Su visión es ampliar el área de cultivo, mejorar la producción y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria grows corn, beans and vegetables, she is married and currently lives with her husband and two of her children who are 8 and 16 years old and are at school. Her older children are already independent. 

She grows vegetables alongside her brother, and this generates very good profits for them. She also has an income from the growing of staple grains, carrying out these activities from a young age.

With the loan she will buy manure, fertilisers and seeds for her various crops. This will improve her economic situation and enable her to continue to distribute her products to keep her customers happy. One advantage for her business is that the land that she sows has its own water sources.

Her vision to widen the cultivated area, improve production and cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and seeds for her different crops and so obtain better harvests.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is a 51-year-old resident of Cavite, Philippines and she is a widow. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard for her son and to provide income for their everyday needs.

Emerenciana maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are relying on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Emerenciana dreams of success in business and also in life. She hopes that they will always be happy and she wants for her son to finish his college degree. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Zineta

texts.en: Zineta would like to thank all the lenders for the support that has been given to her several times since 2012. She has been very satisfied with the Kiva loan process and results and still continues to borrow money to improve her living situation and standards. Once again, she is requesting a loan to purchase additional materials and expand her business even more. This loan will help her to continue with her handicraft business which has grown and improved with each loan so far. As this is the 4th time she is requesting a loan for this business she is very confident that it will help her to generate more income and continue to improve her family’s lifestyle and conditions. She is happy to continuously be given support and these opportunities, and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and expand her business even more.

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en:
Danijela wants to thank all the lenders for her previous loan, which was used to purchase phone equipment to sell in her mobile shop. The loan allowed her to expand her business and provide for her daughters. 

Because of the success of her last loan, she is again requesting a loan to purchase more equipment for the same business. She is very satisfied with her business and grateful that she has an opportunity to continue to be able to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase more phone equipment to sell, which will help create more sales and generate more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 10 kilos of fish.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thankful that she was previously granted a 40,000 PHP loan, which she used as additional capital for her egg vending business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply for another Php 40,000, which she will use to buy additional dozens of eggs and salted eggs for her store.  The more items displayed at the store will mean more sales and thus increase her earnings. It will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expense. She wants to express her thanks and appreciation for the financial grant in advance. 

Elizabeth hopes to be able to expand soon. She dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional eggs and salted eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken and flour for her dishes, as well as making her place of work suitable, so she can satisfactorily start her business.

loans.name: Idah

texts.en:
Idah  is 37 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. She has four children, two sons and two daughters. 

Idah has bred chickens for over 20 years and farms the chickens beside the house. She has asked for a loan of 6,000,000 rupiah from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. She will  build a bathroom, a septic tank, and a closet in their home. 

Improved sanitation will provide better health for her and her family. Idah is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita lives in Oecusse. She is in agriculture and now she is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. 

She is selling tomatoes and vegetables because she earns a good income from this business in her life. She will use this loan to buy more manure, tomato seeds, vegetable seeds and other materials. 

She started to sell tomatoes and vegetables in 2011 with her own working capital of $35. She lives near the main road so many people come to buy her tomatoes and vegetables. She also takes them to the market for sale. 

She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she can better manage her life.

loans.use: to buy manure, tomato seeds, vegetable seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Manong

texts.en:
Manong is 50 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one daughter. For five years she was selling food made from vegetables flavored with peanuts. She was pleased to be able to help her husband to improve their lives.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8,000,000 rupiah. This loan is used for the improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 

The sanitation able her and her family to have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity, and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo is 44 years old and chose to be single. He lives in a rural community and operates a motorcycle transport business to generate income. He aims to earn more income to satisfy his needs, save for future emergencies and support the education of his nephews. To continuously operate his motorcycle, he would like to take financial assistance of PHP 12,000 to buy accessories and spare parts for his motorcycle. Having this financial assistance, he believes that he will increase his income and provide safe transportation to his passengers.

loans.use: to buy accessories and spare parts for his motorcycle

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina, age 41, is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 weekly. Her net income from this business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children and food expenses. Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to take a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her vegetable production. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her vegetable production.

loans.name: Camaladdin

texts.en:
Camaladdin is a 31-year-old IDP. He is married and lives with his family in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates their children. They have a daughter and a son and live in an IDP settlement.

Camaladdin is a farmer and has been breeding cows for eight years. He has good skills and knows everything about husbandry. The family sells dairy products in their yard to the local people. Every morning neighbors come and buy milk, cheese, butter and other products from Camaladdin. His monthly income from this is 160 AZN.

Camaladdin loves his family very much and wants to provide his children with a bright future.  He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to restore his cow stall and buy quality equipment for his small husbandry business. This will increase the productivity of his cows and the income of his family.

loans.use: to restore his cow stall and buy quality equipment for his small husbandry business

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Gideon is 35 years of age and one of the most hardworking men in his village of Koibarak, in the area of Kapsowar in Kenya. He has a wife and 4 children and wanted to lay a good foundation for his family and grandchildren to come. That is why he started farming and has been practising mixed farming for the past 2 years. His primary sources of income have been eggs, crops, and some personal business that he does so as to accumulate more wealth.

Gideon is very passionate about dairy farming and, as he always says, “dairy farming is close to my heart.” He has nicknamed his dairy cow “Birirmet.” Dairy farming in Kenya has seen an upsurge in growth, and milk prices in the recent past have skyrocketed. This has translated to increased earnings for farmers. Gideon, being a very hardworking and visionary farmer, will want to take advantage of the ready market; that is why he is kindly seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy a good-quality breed of dairy cow.

Gideon has already decided what type of dairy breed he requires and, because of his immense knowledge on preparing hay, his cows will have plenty of food and will produce more milk. Gideon projects that the cow he acquires through the loan will be producing more than 10 liters a day.

Because there is a ready market for milk, he does not worry too much about competition and marketing the milk will not be a challenge. He will be selling it directly to the market as well as to big dairy-processing firms, which will result in increased earnings. Additionally, Gideon has planned that instead of selling the milk in its raw form, he will be packaging the milk, and this will also improve his income. Profits from selling milk will enable Gideon to be very successful.

He also plans that through accumulated profits, he will be able to construct a biogas digester to produce energy that he will use in cooking and other domestic chores.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Heriberta

texts.es:
Ana, tiene la necesidad de invertir nuevamente en la venta de ropa y en la tienda, por lo que requiere un nuevo préstamo para comprar variedad de ropa, aceite, huevos, galletas, gaseosas y otros productos para que sus clientes encuentren en su negocio lo que están buscando.
Con el préstamo anterior incremento su inventario, aumento sus ganancias, ha cumplido con sus compromisos y su núcleo familiar vive en ambiente mucho más digno.
texts.en:
Ana needs to invest once again in her store and clothing business. For this reason, she needs a new loan to buy products including a variety of clothing, cooking oil, cookies, eggs, soft drinks, and other items, so that her customers will find what they need at her store.

With her previous loan, Ana also expanded her inventory and increased her earnings. She has been able to fulfill all her obligations and now her family lives in better surroundings.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, cooking oil, cookies, eggs, soft drinks and other products so that her customers will find what they need at her store.

loans.name: Maqboolan

texts.en:
Maqboolan is 50 years old, married, and blessed with 5 children. Her husband drives a rickshaw. Now that her children have grown up, one of her sons drives a van. Together they contribute to the family income. As their family is big, so are their needs. Therefore, they have to work really hard.

Her son has been driving this van for many years now. That is why it needs to be repaired. Also, his income is affected if his van does not drive smoothly. Therefore, Maqboolan has requested a loan to help her son pay for the repair expenses. Her son will pay off this loan in weekly instalments through his daily income. They are thankful to BRAC Pakistan and to Kiva.

Maqboolan's son wants to save money to buy another vehicle to rent out and generate more income.

loans.use: to help her son repair his van

loans.name: Bayartsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Bayartsetseg, 36 years old, lives with her husband and children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been teaching literature at a high school since 2010. Her husband is currently unemployed, but looking for jobs intensely. Their children go to elementary school. She is requesting a loan of 1,100,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a middle aged dairy farmer that hails from Kapsaiya, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya. This lady who has now become a passionate crusader and practical dairy farmer who went into farming early, when their area was still in the dark about modern ways of profitable dairy farming. For the past three years she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk and some variety of crops she plants. Proceeds from dairy farming have always not been enough to support her four children. 

Jane loves to take care of her dairy animals and has even nicknamed one of them “Birir,” which makes her a very proud farmer. Jane is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow so that she can fully utilize the space in her farm and so that she can seize the opportunity for the ready market of milk that is in her village. Through increased profits Jane will be able to comfortably provide for her children and will also be able to secure a future for her eventual grandchildren. Jane is confident that if you invest in her, she will be able to turn around her life; and with the accumulated profits, she will be able to open a large milk shop that will sell to both wholesalers and retailers. Jane is patiently waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow.

loans.name: Felipa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Felipa de 58 años de edad, ya lleva 25 años llevando al éxito su ferretería, junto con el apoyo de su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella anteriormente había solicitado un préstamo en KIVA y MiCrédito para comprar martillos, clavos, llaves para plomería, entre otros productos que sirvieron para generar mayor ingreso en sus ventas, tan bien le fue que pudo cancelar su préstamo anterior antes de lo establecido. Por esta razón, se siente muy agradecida con todas las personas que le extendieron la mano para poder crecer personal y profesionalmente en su negocio.
Ahora, esta licenciada en Administración de empresas, quiere seguir escalando para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar cerraduras, clavos, candados, serruchos, tubos pvc, entre otros productos que usualmente ofrece en su ferretería. Materiales que le ayudarán a ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementarán sus ingresos. Al terminar de pagar le gustaría volver a invertir de nuevo en su negocio, para poder llegar a ser una persona autosuficiente.
texts.en:
Felipa is 58 years old, she has been successfully running her hardware store for 25 years, with the support of her husband and her two children.

She has previously asked for a loan from KIVA and MiCrédito to buy hammers, nails and water taps for plumbing among other products. This enabled her to generate more income from her sales, so much so that she was able to pay back her loan early. For this reason she feels very grateful to everyone who reached out to her to allow her to grow personally and professionally in her business.

She is now qualified in Business Administration, and wishes to continue upwards to offer her children a better quality of life. She is therefore asking for a new loan to buy locks, nails, padlocks, saws and pvc pipes, among other products that she usually offers in her hardware store. These are items which will help her offer a greater variety to her customers and increase her income.

On finishing paying for the loan she would like to invest again in her business, to be able to become a self-sufficient  person.

loans.use: to buy locks, nails, padlocks, saws and pvc pipes, among other products.

loans.name: Heset

texts.en:
Heset is 39 years old and the father of 4 children. 

In order to earn a living, he sells mobile phones in the market as his main source of income. Although he started with a small number of phones, he has now managed to multiply the number and ensure more profit. 

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more mobile phones, which will allow him to resell them at a profit and thereby increase his family income. He hopes in the future to be able to rent a shop to sell his phones as he currently sells in the market and has to endure difficult weather conditions such as rain and cold all day. 

Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Venidora

texts.en: Venidora is a businesswoman, and she is requesting a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She is selling soybean cake, potatoes, and tomatoes because she earns a good income from this business in her life. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more soybean cake, potatoes, tomatoes and other things to sell. She started to sell these in 2010 with her own working capital of $60.00. She is selling in the center of the market, so many people come to buy her soybean cake, potatoes, and tomatoes. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her management.

loans.use: to buy soybean cake, potatoes, tomatoes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda has three grade school children. She is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a warehouse supervisor. At present, her husband’s earnings are enough to sustain their needs, but Yolanda wanted to help her husband to gain income for the future of their children. With this, Yolanda engaged herself in retailing business where she sells school supplies and a variety of grocery items near a school. Yolanda wants to extend the products she is selling. That’s why she decided to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy school supplies and grocery items to sell. Yolanda believes that by availing the loan, she will increase her sales and income as well. She hopes to save some of her income for the preparation of her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
Alasgar is a 37-year-old IDP and lives with his wife and two daughters in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of their children. He works as a laborer but his main job is farming. Alasgar has been raising seasonal vegetables for 12 years and has good skills in this area. His monthly income from vegetable sales is 170 AZN and these earnings don’t cover his family’s demands. 

Raising vegetables is much expanded in Azerbaijan because the national cuisine is full of delicious dishes. People use vegetables to cook such dishes as kyukyu, lobya chigirtmasi, dovgha, etc.

Alasgar loves his family very much and does his best to provide a good life for his family. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan because his income doesn’t cover most of his demands. He will purchase good garden tools and build a greenhouse for his garden. This will protect his garden from bad weather.

loans.use: to purchase good garden tools and build a greenhouse

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar, 25, is married with a daughter. She is a refugee and lives with her family in a settlement for internally displaced persons. Her husband is a labourer and tries as much as possible to earn money for the family. Gulnar works hard, and the main source of the family's income is gardening. 

Gulnar has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for four years. She has good skills and earns 190 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) per month.

A very responsible woman, Gulnar wants to help her family. She sells fruits and vegetables at a local bazaar and works very hard. Local people buy fresh fruits and vegetables because they are useful for good health. Besides that, people use fruits to make juice and vegetables to cook delicious dishes. 

Gulnar has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy new garden tools and restore a handmade greenhouse. She wants to take proper care of her harvest and raise her family's income.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and restore a handmade greenhouse

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
Bendita  has been involved in business activities since 2012. She started with her own working capital of $600. She has a kiosk in her house. 

She is requesting a loan of $600. After taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she will use it to buy additional supplies including sugar, shampoo, eggs, noodles, water, candies, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. 

She is happy with the loan offered to her from Tuba Rai Metin because, with it, she will improve her business in the future. She also has animals in her house like a cow, pigs and dogs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, shampoo, eggs,  noodles, aqua, candies, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con sus cinco hijos en una humilde finca en zona rural de Santa Bárbara, Antioquia. 

Ella es madre soltera y durante todo este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a sus hijos por sus propios medios.

Ella se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

Ella trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos de engorde y así poder capitalizar su negocio de una manera efectiva ya que de este negocio dependen económicamente sus hijos.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Maria is a countrywoman with drive and perseverance.  She lives with her five children on a humble farm in the rural area of Santa Barbara, Antioquia. She is a single mother who has had the bravery and courage necessary to raise her children alone.

She makes a living by raising pigs.  She has done this work for 12 years with the goal of obtaining sufficient resources for supporting her family. She works every day because the pigs require constant care, food, and monitoring so that they develop properly and are ready for sale.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy pigs and sell them.  This will help her grow her business which is important because her children depend on it.

Her dream is to see her children become professionals and she also dreams that they get the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy and fatten up pigs in order to increase her income and improve the quality of life for her 5 children.

loans.name: Theany

texts.en: Theany, a mother of two dependent children, is a villager from Kampong Chhnang province, where her business is run. To struggle for a living, she grows soybeans, sesame, and raises pigs. This business has generated her about 20,000 KHR. This is not the first loan for Theany with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely, and it improved her lifestyle to better than before. Now, she recycles her loan, in order to buy solar panels to generate electricity for her household.

loans.use: to buy solar panels to generate electricity for her household.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 35-year-old hardworking man, married to Fridah who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with one child. Martin has been operating a transportation business for a period of two years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.
 
Martin was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to renew his licence and to acquire insurance.

Martin plans to buy an additional motorcycle and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success and provide the best quality education to his children.

loans.use: To pay for the renewal of his licence and insurance.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 66, is a hardworking woman who is married to David and blessed with four children. She earns additional income to support the family.  

For five years, Rose has been operating a retail shop and a posho mill as a secondary business. She earns an income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

Rose is now requesting her second loan, for 27,000 KES, through Vision Fund Kenya. She intends to use this loan to buy sugar, rice, cooking fat, wheat and maize flour to sell daily to her customers.

Rose plans to use the anticipated income from this loan to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking fat, wheat and maize flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Rosalina would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed in the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Rosalina's  profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

In the future, Rosalina hopes to grow her business. An active community partner of C.C.T., she meets with her fellowship* group every Tuesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sohaila

texts.en: Sohaila is 39 years old, married and has two children. She is a caring and responsible housewife. Her husband runs an auto spare parts shop in the nearby market. He has two years of experience in this business. He is hardworking and polite. Currently their income is low and it’s difficult to meet the daily household expenses. In his shop he sells auto spare parts like carburetors, batteries, headlights, wind screens, tuning plugs, air filters, oil filters, timing belts, break pads etc.  He wants to enhance his business by increasing sales, and for that he needs to buy more spare parts. That is why his wife has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help her husband buy spare parts. They dream to have a good standard of life and to educate their children.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for her husband's auto shop.

loans.name: Kimhong

texts.en: Kimhong, age 62 and a resident from Kampong Chanang province, is a father of eight children. Nowadays, he needs to support only one child who remains in school.  The main sources of his income are from rice cropping, snacks selling, and a CD (movie) leasing business. This is the first loan for Kimhong with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). Now, he applies for the first loan in order to buy solar panels to generate electricity for his household. He hopes that he can reduce his costs for electricity consumption.

loans.use: to buy solar panels to generate electricity for his household.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Kimsreang

texts.en: A resident from Kampong Chhnang province, Kimsreang is a mother of five children and is 45 years old. To earn a living, she sells snacks, grows lotus, and catches fish for resale to earn a decent income. She has been involved in her current businesses for ages and it has returned to her about 30,000 KHR per day. This is the original loan for Kimsreang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to buy solar lighting for her household. She hopes that she can have sufficient electricity for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy solar lighting for her household.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es: Joel tiene 25 años de edad es casado. Él se encuentra en el VI ciclo de psicología y a la vez trabaja como administrador mercante y da  clases de música. El crédito invertirá en el pago de la mensualidad universitaria. Su meta es hacer la especialización en psicología organizacional y trabajar en una empresa de prestigio. Joel agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Joel is 25 years old and married.  He is in his sixth cycle of psychology.  He also works as a merchant administrator, and he gives music classes.

He will use the loan to make his university payments.  His goal is to specialize in organizational psychology and to work for a prestigious company.

Joel is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support provided.

loans.use: to make his university payments.

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Khuraman is 49 years old and married with a son and two daughters. Her husband works in local water sources administration. The members of her family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. Unfortunately, Khuraman’s husband doesn’t earn enough and the main source of income is gardening. Khuraman raises seasonal fruits. She has worked in this field for 22 years and has good experience. Her monthly income is 200 AZN and this money doesn’t cover her family’s demands. 

Khuraman sells fruit raised in her garden in the backyard. Local refugees visit her every weekend and buy her harvest. They prefer to buy fresh fruits from personal gardens because it’s cheaper for them. 

Khuraman applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy a place for her own grocery store at the local bazaar and sell fruit there. She knows that there are many people visiting bazaars and this brings more income. She hopes to earn money and make her family’s life better.

loans.use: to buy a place for own grocery at a local bazaar to sell fruit

loans.name: Darkhanbat

texts.en:
Mr. Darkhanbat, 41, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been running a photography studio for the past four years. His wife is unemployed and stays at home. Their two children attend high school. 

Mr. Darkhanbat is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam to renovate his house. His house has deteriorated over the years and needs urgent renovation. The renovation will not only provide his family with a comfortable and warm place to live, but will make his house more energy efficient resulting in less coal being burned and less pollutants being released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house and make it more energy efficient

loans.name: Leyda Jackelinne

texts.es:
La joven Leyda de 25  años de edad, vive con su esposo  en casa de sus suegros,  vive en un municipio de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada, vende pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, etc.
Leyda es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día está solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa clasificada, como blusas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, etc. con este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Leyda su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto 2014
texts.en:
Leyda is 25 years old and she lives with her husband in her in-laws house.  She lives in the Choluteca area in the south of Honduras.  For 3 years she has run a clothing sales business.  She sells new and used clothing such as pants, tops, boxers, underwear, t-shirts, etc.

Leyda is an entrepreneurial woman with dreams of getting ahead.  She works hard every day and is seeking a loan so that she can buy clothing for sale, such as blouses, pants, suits, skirts, etc.  With this loan she can buy these items and increase her income, which will help improve her quality of life.  She is a new client that wants to work with Prisma.

Leyda's dream is to have a successful business and increase her clientele.  She also wants to improve her family's future.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – August 2014

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, suits, skirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her further studies.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, mantiene su negocio de venta de tortillas activo, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, cal, leña y láminas, tendrá materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas y mejorar el local de su negocio,  de esta forma seguirá teniendo los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante.
La Sra.: Francisca ha tenido resultados positivos con la inversión del crédito anterior tales como: mejores ingresos, ventas mayores, nuevos clientes, cancelo sus deudas y lo más importante que abastece a su familia con una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Francisca is keeping her tortilla selling business active.  She decided upon a new loan to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, and metal sheeting.  This way she will have raw material to make and sell tortillas and to improve her place of business.  This way she will continue having the income she needs to get ahead.

Francisca has had positive results by investing the previous loan.  These results include improved income, greater sales, new customers, and debt repayment.  The most important is that she provides her family with better food, clothing, and health.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 45-year-old married man, with six children who are young and dependent. He operates a kisubi business (distillation of local brew), and grows tomatoes and bananas. He is facing a problem of low capital. Robert needs a loan to buy land for agriculture.

loans.use: to buy land for agriculture.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang, 58, is a villager from Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a mother of four children and a breadwinner who does soybean farming as the single source of income. This business has generated her about 15,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Heang with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely, and now she can improve her lifestyle gradually. Now, she wants to take a new loan in order to buy solar lighting for her family. She hopes that she can reduce the expenses that she uses on battery charging for electricity.

loans.use: to buy solar lighting for her family.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Caritas Felices Group

texts.es: El grupo “CARITAS FELICES” es un grupo conformado por socios trabajadores y  ansiosos por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Olga tiene 50 años de edad es casada con 06 hijos independientes. Ella compra cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor para venderlos al por menor. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más cerveza y gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Olga es la que encuentra sentada en medio.
texts.en:
The "Caritas Felices" group is comprised of hard-working members that are eager to improve their family's quality of life. 

Olga is 50 years old, she is married, and she has six independent children. She sells beer and soft drinks. She buys in bulk and sells at retail prices. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of more beer and soft drinks.

The group is thankful to the KIVA lenders for the loan.  Olga is sitting in the center in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila is a 59 year old refugee. She is married and has two daughters and two sons. The family has lived in an IDP settlement for a long time and gets earnings from gardening. Nazila raises seasonal vegetables and sells them at a local bazaar. She has worked in this area for 33 years and gets 250 AZN monthly.

Nazila is a very solicitous mother and does her best for her children. She works as a nurse visiting ill people and treating them. But her main job is gardening and she loves her job very much. She takes care of fruit trees and raises them properly. 

Nazila’s income doesn’t cover all of her family’s demands. She wants to buy quality fertilizers for her harvest and enlarge the productivity of her garden. She hopes that this will help her family to earn enough money for living costs.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizers for enlarging the harvest and productivity of her garden

loans.name: Nelly Azucena

texts.es:
Nelly de 30 años de edad, es licenciada en relaciones públicas, estudió en la universidad gracias al apoyo de sus padres, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al pintado y enderezado de vehículos y también  a la carpintería, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad y es el único que depende de ella.

Nelly es comerciante, ella tiene una línea de joyas y las vende por medio de revistas a sus clientes y negocios, tiene más de seis meses en esta actividad, la necesidad de ingresos al hogar la llevó a emprender su negocio, anteriormente trabajaba en un hotel. Para vender sus productos visita a sus clientes casa por casa y trabaja de 9:00 am a 3:00 pm.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más joyas, cadenas, pulseras, anillos para seguir adelante con su negocio.

Ella sueña con salir adelante con su esfuerzo y trabajo, y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Nelly is 30 years old and is licensed in public relations.  She studied at the university thanks to the support of her parents.  She is married and her husband is a painter, a car mechanic, and a carpenter.  They have a 3 year old son and he depends on her.

Nelly is a salesperson.  She has a line of jewelry and sells it via magazine to her customers and to businesses. She has run this business for more than 6 months. The need for more household income led to her starting this business. Previously she worked in a hotel.  In order to sell her products, she visits her clients at their homes and she works from 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy more jewelry, chains, watches and rings in order to grow her business.  Her dream is to get ahead by using dedication and hard work, in order to provide the best for her son.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry, chains, watches, and rings in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 50-year-old, married lady with six children who are adults, two of whom attend school. She deals in farming livestock and also earns from a salary as a teacher. She faces a challenge of limited capital and school fees, but she has hopes of educating her children. She needs a loan to buy a heifer cow for her farm.

loans.use: to buy a heifer cow for her farm.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a hardworking father with five children aged between 30 and 19. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling rice, beans and maize. Deo earns additional income from a salary. He has hopes of developing his business to the highest level, and will use the loan to buy more beans and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mevlide

texts.en:
Mevlide is married and the mother of four children. She earns a living by selling honey that she collects from the bees that she raises. Her product is of high quality and has a distinguished taste that brings her many customers and makes her very popular. Mevlide is in the picture with her husband

In the beginning she had a small number of bees and hives, but has now managed to expand and has a need to purchase additional food for the bees. She is requesting a loan so that she can adequately provide them food so they can produce a higher quantity of honey. She loves what she does and hopes to continue her unique and special business. Her customers are pleased with her products and look forward to her honey. 

She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase additional food for her bees to produce higher quantities of honey.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
A rural village from the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia. Savy is 50 years old and married with six children. She and her husband are hardworking farmers who make a living through farming rice and cassava. She and husband have been in this business for almost 20 years. From the current business, she earns about US $11 per day to support the needs of her family.

Savy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles and successfully paid back the past loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped with her family’s business. Now she is applying for a new loan to pay for her son’s tuition fee to study vocational training. She hopes to keep her son there until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fee to study vocational training

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 45-year-old man with three children and three dependents. He has a banana plantation and operates a hotel in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He faces a problem of limited capital; however, he hopes to improve his income. He needs a loan to buy maize flour and beans to sell.

loans.use: to increase his stock of maize flour and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mbula

texts.en:
Mbula is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to John who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with three children.  Mbula has been operating a grocery stall business for ten years earning her an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Mbula was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer, and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000. She intends to buy cabbages, onions, potatoes, green vegetables, kales and fruits to sell to her customers on a daily basis. Mbula plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to buy her own family land.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions, potatoes, green vegetables, carrots and kale to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena, vive con su compañero de vida y un bebe de tres meses de nacido; como una forma de tener ingresos para cubrir parte de las necesidades de su hogar se dedica  a brindar el servicio de cosmetología y vende ropa para caballeros, damas y niñas/os, a vender ropa le ensenó su suegra hace 4 años, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. 
Solicita capital para efectuar la compra de vestidos, ropa interior, pantalones, faldas y otras prendas de vestir para tener un negocio más competitivo, espera atender mejor a sus clientes, aprovechar la temporada de mejores ventas e incrementar sus ganancias.
Sus proyectos son expandir su negocio, mejorar la calidad de vida familiar y su situación económica.
texts.en:
Lorena lives with her life companion and a three month old baby. As a way to make money to pay for the household needs she works as a cosmologist and sells clothing for men, women and children. Her mother-in-law taught her about selling clothing 4 years ago. Her timetable is from 8 am until 5 pm.

She is requesting capital to undertake buying dresses, underwear, pants, skirts and other clothing to have a more competitive business . She hopes to serve her clients better taking advantage of the best season for sales and increase her revenues. Her plans are to expand her business and improve the quality of life and the economic situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy dresses, underwear, pants, skirts and other clothing

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is age 39 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province and she has five children, two of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 19 years, earning about US $11 per day to support the needs of the family.

This is the sixth loan for Phea with VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan to pay for her son’s school fees. She hopes that her son will get a good job after his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s school fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ermelinda, se dedica a los trabajos de cultivo de granos básicos y la crianza de cerdos, prática la actividad desde hace 10 años junto a sus hijos, en horario de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, el ofició lo aprendió de sus padres. Emerlinda vive con sus hijos, es soltera, todos dependen económicamente de ella.
El crédito lo utilizará para comprar insumos agrícolas y cerdos,  con los que preparará el terreno y ampliara su negocio, de esta manera generara más ganancias, la productividad de sus cultivos aumentara y dará a su familia un mejor estilo de vida. Sus riesgos son un mal clima y que los cerdos se enfermen.
Sus sueños son crecer con su negocio, cancelar sus deudas y seguir velando por dar una vida más confortable a su familia.
texts.en:
Ermelinda cultivates basic grains and raises pigs. She has done this work for the past 10 years with her children.  She works from 7:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon.  She learned how to do this work from her parents.  Emerlinda lives with her children, she is single, and everyone in her household depends on her economically.

This loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies and pigs. She will use both to prepare the land and grow her business.  This is how she will generate a higher income because her productivity will increase and she will be able to provide her family with a better lifestyle.  Her risks are poor climate and that the pigs could get sick.

Her dreams are to grow her business, pay off her debts, and continue working to provide a more comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pigs, which she will use to prepare the land and grow her business.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is 61 years old and married with a son. He is a refugee and the family lives in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and his son is a laborer. Kamil is a farmer who has raised hens for 40 years and knows everything about housing poultry. He gets 270 AZN monthly. His son helps him to work in this field.

Breeding and keeping of chickens is widespread on private land because birds need unpretentious food, care and maintenance. Additionally, Kamil knows that the number of eggs laid are a lot more than with other types of poultry. Kamil raises them and then sells the chicken meat or eggs at the local bazaar. 

Kamil lives in an old house that has bad conditions for keeping poultry. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy a small incubator for housing poultry and increasing productivity.

loans.use: to buy a small incubator to house poultry

loans.name: Dulguun

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulguun, 24, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Since 2013, she has been selling clothes to locals. Her husband provides taxi services. 

Mrs. Dulguun is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to install vacuum-insulated windows and a hardwood floor in her home. The insulation will help her family save energy because her house will no longer lose as much heat through the windows and floor.

loans.use: to install vacuum-insulated windows and a hardwood floor to preserve energy

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenetsogt, 24, lives with his wife, son, and mother in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling). They live on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Since 2012, Mr. Erdenetsogt has been providing taxi services to locals. His wife works at a barbershop as a hairdresser.

Mr. Erdenetsogt is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass, foam, and felt for his ger. Insulating his house will not only allow his family to live in a comfortable and warm place, but will also benefit the environment since they will burn less coal and release less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy insulation materials to insulate his home

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana de 58  años de edad,  tiene un hijo  que depende de ella, vive con su esposo, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de venta de cerdos para destazo y venta de maíz.
Doña Ana sus clientes son venta las personas dueños de bodega y personas que se dedican a la comercialización de cerdos, su venta es una vez por semana y vende un promedio de 8 cerdos por semana.
Doña Ana está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz y unos cerditos para sus negocios, con el apoyo del crédito espera suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que tiene para esta ocasión ya que vende también maíz a las pulperías. 
Uno de sus sueños es tener un negocio de pulpería bien fuerte en su casa y crecer en su negocio de cerdos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old and has one child who is dependent on her. She lives with her husband in her own house. For the last number of years she has been working selling pigs for butcher and selling corn. Ana's clients are owners of supermarkets and people who deal in selling pigs. She sells once a week and sell 8 pigs on average.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy corn and some piglets for her business. With the help of the loan she hopes to fill the need she now has for loans as she will also will sell corn to stores. One of her dreams is to have a successful store in her house and expand her pig business.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014.

loans.use: to buy corn and some piglets for her business.

loans.name: Pari

texts.en:
Pari is 25 years old, married with a son, and they are refugees living in an IDP settlement. Pari’s husband is a laborer but his earnings are not enough for family. Pari is a gardener and she has been raising fruit trees for years. She is good at this and earns 160 AZN monthly, but these earnings don’t cover the family’s demands. Pari raises and sells fruits at a local bazaar, because people have high demand for fresh fruits. They buy fruits in order to prepare fresh juice, jam or fruit pies. 

Pari loves her family very much and she wants to provide her lovely son a bright future. She wants to increase her income and to pay for his future education. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy garden tools to increase productivity of her garden.

loans.use: to buy garden tools to increase productivity of her garden.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 66, and a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Jil, a rag maker.  She manages her household while operating the business.  She works hard to continually provide income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Alma operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and to increase her sales she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. 

Alma hopes to be able to grow her business. She desires to deepen her relationship with her husband, and for them to enjoy good health in their final years.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed to sell at her Variety Store.

loans.name: Ahorrar Es Exito Group

texts.es: El grupo “AHORRAR ES ÉXITO” es un grupo conformado por 06 socios empeñosos en mejorar su calidad de vida. Senobea tiene 49 años de edad es divorciada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica la venta de comida en forma ambulatoria desde hace muchos años. Ella aprendió dicha actividad cuando trabajaba en el restaurant de su amigo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios nuevos para su negocio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Senobea es la segunda del lado derecho viste saco negro.
texts.en: The “AHORRAR ES ÉXITO” communal bank is made up of six persevering members who want to improve their quality of living. Senobea is 49 years old, divorced with two independent children. She has worked selling food itinerantly for many years. She learned how to do this working in a restaurant of a friend. She will invest the loan in the purchase of new utensils for her business. The group is grateful to the lenders at Kiva for the loan. Senobea is the second from the right wearing the black jacket.

loans.use: to buy new utensils.

loans.name: Hurby

texts.en: Hurby was born in 1961. She is a kind and hardworking woman. Hurby is widowed. She is careful mother of four children. Two of them are non-adults and two of them are adults. Seven years ago she began her own business deal. She began a business selling greens. Hurby, little by little, developed her business. Now, she sells fruits and vegetables in a local market. Hurby is going to increase her working capital and maximize profits. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy fruits and vegetables. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Alba Maria

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de tamales por encargo.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Alba y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Su lugar de trabajo es su propia cocina, desde donde deleita sus clientes con sus ricas preparaciones de tamales.

Alba desea mejorar su venta de tamales y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de una nevera, utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos como carne y harina para continuar realizando sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Alba is a humble and hard-working woman that dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her children.  She lives in La Dorada where she works spectacularly in the kitchen.  Her business is in the preparation of tamales for sale.

She sells her dishes primarily to her neighbors who know the specific flavor of Alba's food and they know that they will always get delicious and well-prepared food when they buy from her.

Her place of work is in her home kitchen, where her customers come to enjoy her delicious tamales.

Alba wants to increase her sales and wants to work more comfortably. For this reason, she is seeking a loan so that she can buy a fridge, kitchen utensils, and to buy ingredients such as meat and flour in order to continue making her recipes.

This loan will help her business get ahead in order to increase her income, which will enable her to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, kitchen utensils, and ingredients such as meat in order to continue preparing her tamales and increase her sales.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 39 years old and does a motorcycle transport business. He also sells coconuts in Mombasa town. He is married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with five children. He will be using this loan amount to buy more stock of coconuts to sell. This will enable him make more income. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his business. This is his fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future, Lawrence hopes to have a successful business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Valences

texts.en: Valences is a 42-year-old man with 7 children of which 3 go to school. He is a farmer who deals in maize, vanilla and also livestock such as goats. He faces a problem of limited capital but hopes to educate his children. He needs a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 40-year-old married man with 4 children aged 10, 8, 6, and 4. All of them attend school. He also has 4 dependents. He is a tomato farmer and also earns income from a fresh food shop. He faces a challenge of limited capital but hopes to educate all his children. He needs a loan so as to increase the acreage of his tomato garden.

loans.use: to grow more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old hardworking woman married to Titus who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with five children. Mary has been a tailor for a period of six years earning her an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Mary was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to buy materials, threads, zips and buttons to add to her current stock which is about to be over.

Mary plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy materials, threads and zips to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 44 years of age, is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. She does dairy farming and has been in this business for the past 10 years and it has been profitable.

She plans to use this loan amount to buy another dairy cow and thereby increase her stock of dairy cattle as well as make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her farming business.

This is Maria's fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has been paying her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, be successful, and have a peaceful life.

loans.use: To buy another cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 47 year old hardworking woman married to Peter who adds additional income to support their family and they are blessed with two children.  Agnes has been operating a fruits and vegetables business for five years earning her an income of 8,000 KES monthly at the end of every month.

Agness was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of 5,000 KES and intends to buy avocados, oranges, bananas and vegetables to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Agnes plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and also desires to further their education to higher levels.  She also hopes to have growth in her business and to live a stable life.

loans.use: To buy avocados, mangoes, oranges, bananas and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado, esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene dos hijos de los cuales solo 1 estudia pero ambos dependen de Ezequiel.


Él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, cuenta con 20 años de experiencia en esta actividad, lo aprendió de sus padres y el lugar donde trabaja está cerca de su casa.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes  para el cultivo de maíz y para pagar la mano de obra.


 Sus sueños son construir su propia vivienda ya que ahora vive en casa de sus padres, sacar adelante su familia y ver crecer a sus hijos, que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ezequiel is 41 years old and studied until the sixth grade. He is coupled and his partner takes care of the household duties. He has two children, of them only one studies although both depend on Ezequiel.

Ezequiel makes his live in agriculture and the cultivation of grain; he has twenty years of experience in this business. He learned it from his parents and the place where he works is very close to his house.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizer for the cultivation of grain and to pay for labor.

His dreams are to build his home because he now lives in his parents' house, move his family forward, watch his children grow. He hopes that they study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the cultivation of corn and to pay for labor

loans.name: Armend

texts.en: Armend wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan that he used to purchase new tools and raw materials for his welding and iron business. As he is still in the same business, and has seen successful and has seen improvement since his last loan, he would like to again borrow money for iron and other materials. He is confident that he will continue to see improvement in his business and income based on his growth so far. He is hopeful that he will be able to continue to improve his family’s living conditions and is grateful for such opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase iron and other materials to expand his current welding business

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
José, tiene un negocio de venta de lácteos y cultiva granos básicos, vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos con edades de 14, 12 y 8 años, él es el único que trabaja para cubrir las necesidades de su familia; realiza la venta de lácteos con ayuda de su esposa  de 6: 00 a.m. a 12:00 m. todos los días de la semana, ya tiene clientes establecidos, el oficio lo aprendió de su jefe de trabajo, cuando era empleado.
Comprará queso ($ 700.00), crema ($ 396.00) y el resto lo invertirá en insumos agrícolas, tendrá suficiente mercadería para abastecer y atraer a nuevos clientes, también podrá ampliar su recorrido y seguirá cultivando granos básicos, espera mejorar las ventas y los ingresos para responder de manera positiva a sus compromisos, su riesgo es ser blanco de asalto al momento de salir a vender.
Su visión es mantener su negoci0o funcionando para tener recursos económicos que le ayudaran finalizar la construcción de su vivienda, dar educación a sus hijos y que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José has a business selling dairy products and growing basic grains. He lives with his life companion and his three children aged 14, 12 and 8 years old. He is the only one who works to pay the household necessities. He makes the milk sales with the help of his wife from 6 am until a 12 noon, every morning of the week. He has fixed clients and he learned the business from his boss when he was an employee.

He will buy cheese ($700), cream ($396) and the rest he will invest in agricultural inputs. He will have enough merchandise to stock up and attract new clients and also to expand his market. and he will continue to grow basic grains. He hopes to improve his sales and income to respond positively to the obligations he has. His fear is to be the victim of a robbery as he goes out to sell.

His vision is to keep his business functioning which would give him the resources that will help him complete the construction of his house, educate his children so that they have a better future.

loans.use: to buy cheese and cream and with the rest buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Celia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Celia de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta 3º grado, tiene tres hijos, dos asisten a la escuela y el otro trabaja.

Celia se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, mientras que su esposo trabaja como albañil y en la agricultura, todos su hijos se involucran y trabajan juntos por un mismo objetivo que es salir adelante.

El crédito lo necesita para construir un baño, una pila y mejorar un muro, y así tener su vivienda en mejores condiciones.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Celia is 46 years old, has studied through third grade, and has three children; two of her children attend school, and the third works. 

Celia dedicates herself to household work, while her husband work in construction and agriculture. All their children are involved and work together for the same goal of going forward.

The loan is needed to build a bathroom and a sink and to improve a wall, and it will, thus, improve the conditions of her home.

She dreams that her children will be prepared academically and that she can continue improving her home.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and sink and to improve a wall.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 28-year-old married man with two children aged six and four, both who go to school. He also has two dependents. 

John is a farmer who deals in maize and beans. He faces a challenge of limited capital but hopes to stock maize. He needs a loan to stock maize and beans for growing.

loans.use: to buy maize and bean seeds for growing

loans.name: Pedro Juan

texts.es:
Pedro de 48 años de edad, solo estudió hasta 6º grado, su pareja se dedica a las labores del hogar y a atender un molino de maíz que tiene en su casa, tiene 6 hijos que viven con él, por lo que son 7 personas las que dependen de Pedro.

Actualmente, él se dedica a vender repuestos y accesorios para vehículos y lo hace desde hace 10 años, ademas de esto trabaja en la agricultura y lo aprendió de sus padres, sus hijos se involucran para realizar el trabajo agrícola, horario de trabajo no tiene pues él regresa a casa hasta que termina con las actividades programadas cada día.


El crédito lo necesita para invertir en la siembra de ajonjolí.

Los sueños de Pedro son tener un local para su negocio ya que hoy en día vende los repuestos de casa, también desea tener una casa digna para su familia, él sabe que con la ayuda de Dios y los prestamos lo hará posible.
texts.en:
Pedro is 48 years old and only studied up to the 6th grade. His partner dedicates herself to household tasks and to attending to a corn mill that they have at home. He has six children who live with him, so there are seven people who depend on Pedro.

He currently makes a living by selling replacement parts and accessories for vehicles, which he has done for the last ten years. In addition to this he works in agriculture, which he learned from his parents; his children are also involved in his agricultural work. He doesn't have a set work schedule, as he just returns home when he finishes with the activities scheduled for each day.

He needs the loan to invest in planting sesame.

Pedro's dreams are to have a place for his business, as he currently sells replacement parts from home. He also wants to have a dignified house for his family. He knows that with God's help and the loans he will make this possible.

loans.use: to invest in planting sesame

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora de 48  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 12  años al negocio de venta de comida como baleadas, pupusas, tajaditas, papas fritas, frescos, agua en bolsa, etc. vive en un municipio de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Doña Aurora es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de 5 quintales de papas, frescos, agua, aceite, queso, etc. para elaborar sus comidas  es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido, al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto 2014
texts.en:
Aurora is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own home. For 12 years, she has been selling food, including baleadas (wheat flour tortillas, folded in half and filled with mashed fried beans), pupusas (filled corn tortillas), wedges, fried potatoes, refreshments, water bags, etc. She lives in the municipality of Choluteco in the south of Honduras. 

Aurora is an enterprising woman with dreams of going forward, and she fights day after day to improve her quality of life. She is requesting the loan to buy 500 pounds of potatoes, refreshments, water, oil, cheese, etc. to make her food. She is a new client with dreams of working with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and good selection, and at the same time to improve her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – August 2014

loans.use: to buy 500 pounds of potatoes, refreshments, water, oil, cheese, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Kasenyi Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Pascal, aged 30 years, is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd., Ishaka Branch and a member of Kasenyi Twimukye Group. He is married with four children and all attend school at the moment. He runs a shoe shop selling shoes for both children and for the elderly as his main source of income and his clients are people around his local area. He is also a farmer where he earns income to support his family. 
Pascal has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX (Two million Ugandan shillings) to buy more shoes for the business this being a back to school season. He will make sales and raise enough income. He started his businesses in the year 2008 to have a steady source of income to look after his family. 
He is a hardworking man giving his businesses 8 hours a day and 6 days a week which has enabled him to grow his business from one level to another. He is however faced with the challenge of debtors but has learned to manage them. He hopes to be financially stable and educate all his children in the future. He thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. (MDI) for the financial support they are rendering to him.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Jose Mardo

texts.es:
José, se dedica a tender su taller de estructuras metálicas y a realizar trabajos de albañilería, está felizmente casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad; fundo su negocio hace 30 años, el oficio lo aprendió a desempeñar con un amigo, la ventaja es la calidad de su trabajo, lo que la hace contar con muchos clientes.
Invertirá en la compra de hierro, láminas, varillas, etc., todo lo necesario para equipar su taller de estructuras metálicas, espera poder atender la demanda de la temporada para mejorar su situación económica y cumplir con las obligaciones que tiene como jefe de su hogar.
Espera apertura un nuevo taller de  estructuras metálicas, tener mejores ingresos y continuar trabajando con créditos en Padecomsm.
texts.en:
José, who makes a living in his metalworks shop and doing masonry jobs, is happily married and lives with his wife and two sons who are both adults.

He founded his business 30 years ago. He learned the trade to get out of debt with a friend and now his advantage is the quality of his work. He now has many customers.

José will invest in the purchase of iron, steel, rods, etc. -- everything that one needs to outfit his workshop. He hopes he will be able to process the the seasonal demand in order to improve his financial situation and meet the obligations he has as the head of his household.

He hopes to open a new metalworks shop, have better earnings, and continue to work with loans from Padescomsm.

loans.use: to buy iron, structural steel, rods, etc., everything necessary to outfit his metalwork shop.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 25 years old and sells retail goods in Mombasa town. She sells them within the town and also at the market place. These goods include food items such as bread, scones, sweets, cakes and polythene bags for packaging. She is married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. She has been in this business for two years now. 

Jesca will be using this loan to buy more stock of sweets, cakes, juice, bread and scones to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business. 

This is Jesca's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business and to be able to offer employment to other people in her area.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sweets, cakes, juice, bread and scones to sell

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Con Talentos Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres con talentos La encargada de este grupo es la señora Deicy Leticia quien se dedica a la venta de ropa típica güipiles, cortes, fajas, blusas de diferente precios desde hace 11 años.  Es vendedora ambulante y muy conocida, su sueño es llegar a tener un local propio  en el mercado del pueblo para no caminar,  cuenta con el apoyo intachable de su esposo y le motivo el amor de sus tres hijos.  Tiene varios pedidos de trajes típicos, como güipiles y cortes, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza para comprar la ropa que le falta, por tal motivo necesita nuevamente un crédito y así no quedarles mal a sus clientes que son personas muy cumplidas y responsables.
texts.en: The Dúo Mujeres con Talentos group is led by Mrs. Deicy Leticia, who has sold traditional clothing—such as regional dresses, skirts, corsets, and blouses—for 11 years. She is a traveling salesperson and is very well known. Her dream is to have her own location in the market in the town so that she doesn’t have to walk. She counts on the amazing support of her husband, and she is motivated by the love of her three children. She has various orders for traditional clothing, like regional dresses and skirts, but she doesn’t have the money to buy the clothing she lacks. For this reason, she needs a new loan, so that she won’t let down her clients, who are very generous and responsible people.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to resell.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 36 years old and has two children. She is hardworking. The need to provide for her children drove her to establish a beauty salon. She has a salon along a busy street in Mpigi town. The clientele in the town is big and there is an assurance of income, however she is limited by the few items to provide all the necessary services to her clients. Her clients are the local community.
