Getrude hopes to expand the salon in the near future. Her challenge is clients who want credit, yet she has to restock the salon. In the photograph is Getrude with the UGAFODE credit officer in her salon.

loans.use: To buy driers and relaxers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food, drinks, pans and plates to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita, is aged 53, married to a driver and blessed with five children. 

Elsita has owned and operated a transportation business for almost ten years and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her daily net income on this business is usually spent on purchasing vegetables to sell to generate additional income. 

Due to insufficient funds, Elsita would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 34-year-old woman and married to Benjamin. She is blessed with two children, and adds additional income to support the family's welfare.  Joyce has been operating a retail shop and farming business, as a secondary business, for eight years. She earns an income of 8,000 KES at the end of every month.

Joyce was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now accessing her first loan of 10,000 KES and intends to use this amount to buy rice, sugar, cooking fat, wheat flour and maize flour to sell to her customers on a daily basis. Joyce plans to use the anticipated income to pay the school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking fat, wheat flour and maize flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto, tiene 19 años de edad, está en relación en unión libre con su esposa y reside en una aldea del municipio de Siguatepeque.  Se dedica a la agricultura, siendo su fuente de ingresos la producción de café, el cual vende en la zona donde vive. Esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y cultiva en un terreno de su casa. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 lempiras para invertirlo en el mantenimiento de su cultivo en fertilización y limpieza. Su plan es aumentar la producción y con los ingresos hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en: Modesto is 19 years old, is in a civil union with his wife and lives in a village in the municipality of Siguatepeque. He makes a living in agriculture, his source of income being the production of coffee, which he sells in the area where he lives. He has done this activity for the last five years and grows coffee on the land around his house. The loan he has asked for is for 10,000 Honduran lempiras to invest in the maintenance of his crop, in fertilizing and cleaning. His plan is to increase his production and to do improvements on his house with his earnings.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizing and cleaning to do good maintenance on his coffee farm

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 23-year-old married man with four dependents. He has a shop and he also deals in produce mainly maize, rice and beans. He faces a problem of limited capital but hopes to educate his children. Robert needs a loan to buy maize, rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce of maize, rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He grows pepper and tea, and started these farming businesses with the hope of generating income for his family. He faces challenges of price fluctuation, pests and diseases, and farm input costs. However, he hopes of expanding his farm. He needs a loan to pay wages to his workers.

loans.use: to pay wages to his workers.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene dos hijos los cuales  estudian y dependen de él..


José se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ya tiene 20 de realizar estas actividades las cuales la aprendió de sus tiene mucha experiencia en este trabajo y lo realiza cerca de su casa.


Él solicita este crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para sembrar dos hectáreas de maíz, además pagará la mano de obra.


 Sus sueños  son construir su propia vivienda ya que ahora vive en casa de su suegra y preparar a sus hijos académicamente.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old, did not have the opportunity to study, and is in a relationship. His partner dedicates herself to household tasks. He has two children who are studying and depend on him.

José makes a living in agriculture and raising cattle. He has already done these activities, which he learned from his parents, for twenty years. He has a lot of experience in this work and does it near his house.

He is asking for this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to plant two hectares of corn, and to pay for the labor.

His dreams are to build his own home, as he currently lives in his mother-in-law's house, and to prepare his children academically.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to plant two hectares of corn, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 40-year-old man who is married with four children. He buys and sells maize and beans, and he also earns an income from driving a boda-boda. He faces challenges in price fluctuations of his products but hopes to have a self-sustaining business. He needs a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas, 29, is a small-scale dairy farmer based in the North Rift region of Kenya. This area has a thriving market for maize and dairy products. To take full advantage of this, Cosmas practices both dairy farming and crop farming. These activities have enabled him to support his family of two children for the last three years. His primary income sources are milk and maize seeds. 

Cosmas is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He loves dairy farming because, compared to products in other sectors, the promotion of milk is very easy. There is no need for unique stores, and the costs of promotion are very low for any dairy product.

With your investment, Cosmas will be able to increase his milk production and fulfill his loan obligation in the scheduled time. After that, his income will go to farming costs, which are his highest monthly expenses. His family will benefit from the increase in their asset base.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: La Fuerza De Carapongo Group

texts.es: “LA FUERZA DE CARAPONGO” es un grupo conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Teodocia tiene 61 años de edad es soltera con hijos independientes. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda a las cual se dedica hace muchos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes y cerveza que adicionalmente vende. En su tiempo libres presta servicios de limpieza. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Teodocia es la primera persona sentada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The Carapongo Strength (LA FUERZA DE CARAPONGO) is a group made up of members dedicated to retail. Teodocia is 61 years old, and is single with independent children. She  Ella implemented her small shop in her home where she's lived for many years. The loan will be invested in buying more groceries and beer that she sells additionally. In her free time she offers cleaning services. The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan offer. Teodocia is the first seated person on the left.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and beer.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 62-year-old man married to Mary, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  Fredrick has been operating a livestock farming business for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Fredrick was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to additional goats to sell to his customers. 

Fredrick plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to his children and hopes to become a successful business man.

loans.use: to buy additional goats to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 32 years old, married. and together with his spouse, blessed with four children. He also supports seven people. He is a brick seller in Kisumu town. He has been in this business for five years and right now his monthly income is KES 30,000.

He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of materials for making bricks for sale. These include sand and wooden brick frames. This will enable him to sell and supply more bricks to various construction sites and thereby make more profits which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 1974 born Kenyan farmer whose farm is based in the North Great Rift Valley region. He is a husband and a father of five children who has been doing mixed-farming for over ten years.  His primary income sources are milk and crops.

Edwin loves dairy farming for it is one of the few industries where the investor gets earnings that are assured each total 30 days. However, he lacks capital to expand his dairy farm. He decided to join a group that would guarantee his loan from Kiva through Juhudi Kilimo. 

Edwin is seeking a loan to purchase  a dairy cow. This investment will generate enough income to help him to manage his debt to lenders. He plans to use the proceeds of this investment to build his asset base and settle farm-related expenses. His family will greatly appreciate the improvement in their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gulfareen

texts.en:
Gulfareen is 25 years old, married, and blessed with a son. Her husband runs a fruit shop in the nearby market where he sells fresh seasonal fruits like apples, bananas, pears, peaches, apricots, lychees, etc., to his customers. He has been in this business for five years now. He is a hardworking person and tries to meet all the needs of his family. But the income he generates is not sufficient. They pass their days with great difficulty. 

In order to increase sales, he wants to buy more fruits to resell them. Therefore, Gulfareen has requested a loan through BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. They are hopeful that, given the increased demand in summer, sales will increase and so will their income which they want to save for their son's future.

loans.use: To help her husband buy fruits for his fruit shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an education loan in order to cover the school fee for her granddaughter who wants to pursue her bachelors degree majoring in banking and finance.

loans.name: Las  Delicias-32 Group

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, madre de un hijo de tres años y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es emprendedora, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, Amigable, generosa, comprensiva, responsable, Paciente, solidaria y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la provincia cercado que es el centro de la capital y  limita al Norte con las provincias Quillacollo y Chapare; al Sur con Capinota y Esteban Arce; al este con la provincia Chapare y al oeste con las provincia Quillacollo.
Adriana es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el quechua, el cual utiliza para comunicarse con sus parientes, utiliza el español para el comercio (a la izquierda, sueter naranja). Debido a la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida, formó una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo y ayudarse en el desarrollo de sus comercios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de temporada en un cuarto que alquila y lo utiliza como tienda. Al principio ella vendía ropa ofreciéndola a sus amistades y familiares, ahora se encarga de buscar ropa de primera selección con diseños novedosos, únicos, impecables, Colores llamativos, fondos sobrios, etc. Siempre trata de que sea ropa de moda, la cantidad de ropa que necesita para vender es grande y para un público femenino, que va desde los 20 a los 30 años. Y tiene las condiciones y características de que esta hecho de excelentes materiales y buena confección.
Ella sueña ampliar su negocio y contar con vendedores, muchas fotos y maniquíes, por el momento su necesidad es la de comprar ropa por mayor para abaratar costos  y generar un mejor ingreso económico para el bienestar de su pequeño hijo.
Es por esos motivos que Adriana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y con los beneficios darle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 27-year-old single woman, with a 3-year-old son. Her business is in clothing sales. She is enterprising, affectionate, sensitive, sincere, friendly, generous, understanding, patient, cooperative and very hard-working. She does business in the province whose center is the capital and is bordered on the north by the provinces of Quillacollo and Chapare; to the south by Capinota and Esteban Arce; to the east by the province of Chapare and to the west by the province of Quillacollo.

Adriana has dark skin, long black hair, and is of medium height. Her native language is Quechua, which she uses to communicate with her relatives. She uses Spanish for business (she appears on the left, with the orange sweater). Because she needed to better her quality of life, she formed a team of people with different businesses and similar needs in order to request a loan and help themselves develop their businesses. Her business is the sale of seasonal clothing in a room she rents and which she uses as her store. At first, she sold clothing by offering it to her friends and relatives, now she is responsible for finding top-quality clothing with unique and clean new designs, attractive colors, serious backgrounds, etc. She always tries to find fashionable clothing. She needs a lot of clothes to sell and her target is women, between the ages of 20 and 30 years old. The condition and features are such that it is made of excellent material and put together very well. 

She dreams of expanding her business and having salespeople, lots of photos and mannequins. For now, she needs to buy the clothing wholesale in order to keep costs down and generate greater economic income for the well-being of her young son. 

That is why Adriana is requesting a loan to buy clothing wholesale and with the proceeds give her little boy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing wholesale and with the proceeds give her little boy a better quality of life.

loans.name: Clisanta

texts.es:
La señora Clisanta  de 65 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 08 hijos  y ninguna de ellos dependen de ella, vive en su casa ubicada en una colonia en el sur de Honduras vende todo tipo de  mercadería y ropa con la ayuda de una hija.
Doña Clisanta atiende a sus clientes en su casa de habitación y también  sale a vender ambulante a varios lugares de San Lorenzo, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc.  Desea hacer más grande su negocio  y de esa manera  tener más ganancias para poder seguir apoyando a su hija que también es madre soltera con tres hijos.
Doña Clisanta uno de sus sueños  es apoyarle  a que  su hija pueda construir la casa en donde pueda crecer a sus tres nietos.
La señora clisanta es muy perseverante y esforzada a podido salir adelante sola y mantener a sus hijos creo que es un gran ejemplo para todos  y como cliente es excelente muy puntual 


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Clisanta is 65 years old and is a single mother. She has eight children, none of whom depend on her. She lives in her house located in an area in the south of Honduras. She sells all kinds of merchandise and clothing with the help of a daughter.

Clisanta attends to her customers at home and also goes out to sell in an itinerant fashion in various places in San Lorenzo. She is asking for the loan to buy blouses, dresses, pants, shirts, skirts, etc. She wants to grow her business and thus have more earnings to be able to keep supporting her daughter who is also a single mother with three children.

One of Clisanta's dreams is to support her daughter in building a house where her three grandchildren can grow up.

Clisanta is very persistent and hardworking; she has been able to get ahead by herself and to raise her children. I think she is a great example for everyone, and as a client she is excellent and very punctual. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  August 2014.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, pants, shirts, skirts, etc. for her business

loans.name: Zephania

texts.en:
Zephania is a 56-year-old man, married with six children. He deals in farming, i.e., onions, Irish potatoes, and bananas, and also he earns from a retail shop. 

He faces a challenge of price fluctuations of agricultural products; however he hopes to have a self-sustainable business. He needs a loan in order to do a house completion.

loans.use: to complete constructing his house

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley, 33, is a smallholder dairy farmer based in Eldoret, which is one of the fastest growing agricultural towns in Africa. Stanley stays with his lovely wife and three children. He has been doing mixed-farming for the last seven years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. He also offers transportation solutions on his motorcycle for a small fee to other farmers. 

Stanley is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. This is in a bid to grow his asset base and dairy farm. He finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable job since it is not as reliant on rainfall as crop farming. With capital, development is possible even on days when the weather is very hot and dry. 

With your investment, Stanley will use the extra income to take care of other farm-related costs. This, in the long run, will bring his family untold benefits.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 49-year-old man married to Rachel. She adds additional income to support their family's welfare and are blessed with three children. Daniel has been a farmer for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Daniel was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 15,000. He intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and grafted mango crops.

Daniel plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot and build a permanent house for his family. He hopes to expand his business and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and grafted mango crops.

loans.name: Jose Balmore

texts.es:
José, se dispone a sembrar para la época de verano y opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono, insecticidas y semilla, así tendrá granos básicos para abastecer a su familia y el resto lo comercializara para tener ingresos con los que cubrirá las necesidades de su hogar.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a comprar ganado y cerdos, con dicha inversión obtuvo mejores ingresos con los que ha cambiado el estilo de vida familiar, cancelado sus deudas y ha mantenido su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Jose is getting ready to sow for the summer season and he's chosen to request a new loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seed. In this way he will have basic grains to provide for his family and he will sell the rest to get income with which he will cover the household needs.

He used the previous loan to buy cattle and pigs. With that investment he earned better income and he has been able to change the family lifestyle, pay off debts, and stay in business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seed.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is not true for Naomi, 22, who is based in the Eldoret area of Kenya and is a mother of one lovely daughter, she has been practicing mixed farming for the past seven years. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking Lelmet (the name of her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. 

The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Naomi is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling, and also to start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy an additional quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, 39, is a smallholder dairy farmer in Eldoret, home to many of the world-class marathon Kenyan runners. He is a husband and a father to two boys and two girls. Richard has been doing dairy farming for 14 years! He also grows horticultural crops for both subsistence and commercial purposes. 

Richard is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He loves dairy farming as much as he loves horticultural farming. He enjoys dairy because of his background. The advantage to farmers with a dairy background is that they have hands-on farming experience. 

This additional cow will bring Richard more milk for sale. The higher returns will enable Richard to meet his family's needs and settle other farming costs.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Sepelian

texts.en:
Sepelian is a 46-year-old woman married to Joseph who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with five children.  Sepelian has been operating a cloth and dressmaking supplies business for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Sepelian is now servicing her second loan of KES 40,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy additional dresses and materials to sell to her customers.

Sepelian plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy additional dresses and materials to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah is a 46-year-old woman. She is married to Emmmanuel, who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with two children. Reginah has been operating a farming business for ten years, earning an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Reginah was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now taking out her first loan of 20,000 KES. She intends to use this amount to boost her farming plantation by buying seedlings, pipes and fertilizers and paying the labourers who will work on her farm.

Reginah plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children, and she hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, pipes and fertilizers and to pay for laborers for her farm.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary, 30, is a smallholder farmer in Eldoret, Kenya. Dairy farming is arguably the most lucrative business in this area. Hillary lives together with his young wife and child. He has been practising mixed farming for the last 4 years to take care of his family. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and maize.

Hillary is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He enjoys dairy farming above all other farming activities because he sees this business as a flexible investment: cows are easy to buy and sell. While buildings and equipment depreciate, cows don’t.

With your loan, Hillary will be able to build up his herds before making fixed investments in land. With the business plan in mind, he stands to grow his business and make more income to take care of other farming expenses. His family will benefit in many ways from your investment in Hillary.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yudah

texts.en: Yudah operates a salon. The business makes money, but he is always interrupted and challenged by continuous electricity shut-downs. He is also a driver; he started this business to supplement his income. He will use this loan to buy a generator so that he can solve the problem and make more income. He hopes to be in a position to take care of his family's needs. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Esphone

texts.en:
Esphone, 24, is an ambitious young farmer from the North Rift Valley region of Kenya. He is still single with no children. He has been doing mixed farming for the last seven years.  His primary income sources are milk, egg,s and maize.

Esphone is seeking a an investment in the form of a loan worth KES 68,275 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He loves this space because the need for milk is always on the increase because it targets almost everyone, including the both the vegans and non-vegetarians. 

He will use the generated income to settle the loan obligation before channelling it to other farming expenses. He aspires to increase his asset base in preparation for the future responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, 44, is a smallholder farmer based in Eldoret, Kenya. He has a lovely 42-year-old wife and four children. To sustain his family, Richard has been involved in mixed farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk and crops.

Richard is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. He is planning to expand his dairy farm. He loves dairy farming because despite volatile milk prices, hundreds of new farmers are joining this industry each year. Compared to other types of livestock farming, dairying can provide a higher income per animal, monthly paychecks, and, in many areas, more markets.

With your loan, Richard is going to make more money, which will enable him to meet his family’s basic needs. He will also be in a position to pay for the many farming expenses he currently foregoes because of budget constraints.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en: Dononzio is 42 years old. She buys and sells produce. He has six children. His other source of income is coffee growing. He began the business to support his family because he didn’t go to school. He will use the loan to buy more beans and maize that he will sell to make a profit. He hopes to buy a vehicle and transport his own goods. His challenge is a rainy season. He is an average worker. In the photograph is the client and the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: to buy maize and beans

loans.name: Adipa Group

texts.en:
Forgive is a group representative of Adipa Group of Gold Coast Camp in the Assin North of the Central Region of Ghana. She is 41 years old and married with five children. All of the five children who are ages 25, 23,21,17,and 14 years are currently attending school. Forgive is a cocoa farmer but also grows cassava, yams, and plantains for home consumption. 

Forgive produces palm oil, which she sells to individuals from the nearby villages. Forgive's main priority now is to secure a loan to purchase a clean cook stove (a.k.a. Elsa Stove) that utilizes waste products, such as Virgin Pellets (palm kennel shells) as fuel.  Forgive will use the by-product from her oil processing as fuel and will not incur any fuel costs when she starts to use the Elsa Stove. She will be able to save some money for her household using the stove. 

This stove is the product of a research project supported by the African, Caribbean and Pacific (ACP) Group of States Science and Technology Programme and co-financed by the European Union (EU) to eliminate both indoor and outdoor air pollution and to reduce deforestation. Forgive is now applying for a loan of GHS 1,700 to purchase the improved stove to protect her family from indoor air pollution. Forgive is thankful to her microlenders for their generous support in saving her family from health hazards.

loans.use: to purchase a clean cook stove

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate has a cereals business in Mombasa town and has been running it for five years now. She is 30 years old and single, with no child. Her current monthly salary is KES 15,000.

She will be using this loan amount to buy more stock of cereals to sell. These include rice, beans, maize, wheat, and sorghum, among other cereals. She anticipates to make more profits which she will use to expand her business by buying more stock of cereals. 

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has repaid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Saidpocho

texts.en:
Saidpocho was born in 1962. She is a very kind woman. Saidpocho is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. 

For than 10 years, she has been busy with animal husbandry. Saidpocho buys cows, feeds them for some months and then sells them in a local market. Her children help her with feeding the cattle. Saidpocho has great experience in this field. 

Saidpocho uses a lorry to transport the cows. Now her lorry is broken and she must repair it. Saidpocho is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to repair her lorry. She awaits your mercy and needs your support.

loans.use: To repair the lorry she uses in her agriculture business

loans.name: Kitumba Makune Group

texts.en:
Rest is a 22-year-old lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a retail shop that deals in soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, soap, and others. She also earns from farming. 

Limited capital is her challenge; however she hopes to have a self –supportive business. Rest is a member of Kitumba Makune group where members guarantee each other in order to access credit. She needs a loan to buy sugar, soap, paraffin, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, soap, paraffin, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Ann, 27 a mother of 4 who has defied the notion among her friends that farming is an old-fashioned way of earning a living. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and farming. 

Ann hails from Eldoret, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns and this boosts crop production in the area. Ann being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. Being a hardworking mother, Ann has always ensured that she puts food on the table for her family. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school. 

Ann detests living in conditions of poverty and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking a loan of 52,750 KES in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow.  This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market and this means improved cash flow. Through improved cash flow this means that profits will be higher and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her kids to school. 

Through your loan Ann will be empowered economically and be able to improve her standard of living and also those of people living within the area. Ann is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Rhuel

texts.en:
This is Rhuel, 35, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Rubilyn. With his wife, he manages their household while operating the business. He works hard to provide income to meet the family's daily personal and household needs and the school needs of his three children.

Rheul has a stove-making business. He buys raw materials used to manufacture stoves. His finished products are distributed to markets and general stores, and he also displays them in a small place that he owns. He also sells fabrics in the town market. He earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in profit every day.

To help him run his business, he is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan, which he will use to buy more raw materials for his stove-making business. This will in turn boost his income as he expands his business.  

Rhuel aims to give his family a better life and to provide the best education possible for his children. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in his stove business.

loans.name: Norma Cecilia

texts.es:
Norma, mejoro la venta de comida y pupusas con la inversión del crédito anterior, su situación económica es más favorable, ya posee una pequeña tienda en la que ofrece a sus clientes nuevos productos como golosinas, bebidas, pan, etc., tiene nuevos clientes, lo que la motiva a vender comida hasta los fines de semana, sus hijos viven en un entorno más confortable.
Nuevamente solicita capital para comprar aceite, gas propano, carnes, huevos, embutidos, bebidas, granos básicos, harina y otros materiales para elaborar la venta de comida y pupusas, de esta manera seguirá trabajando, teniendo ingresos para salir adelante y cancelar la nueva deuda.
texts.en:
Norma has increased her sales of meals and pupusas with the past loan and her financial situation is better. She now has a small store where she offers her clients new products like sweets, drinks, bread, etc. She has new clients which has motivated her to sell meals on the weekends too. Her children live in a more comfortable environment.

Once again she is requesting a loan to buy oil, propane, meat, eggs, sausages, drinks, basic grains, flour and other materials to make her meals and pupusas to sell. Doing this she can continue to work having income to get ahead and pay off her new loan.

loans.use: to buy oil, propane, meat, eggs, sausages, basic grains, flour and other materials.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn, a local farmer from Battambang province, is 52 years old and a widowed mother, blessed with four children.

 Her main sources of income are from pig-raising and vegetable planting. To earn extra income, she works for others for a fee. This is the first loan for Horn with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). 

In a group of three, Horn is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feed and piglets for raising as the new business. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and piglets for raising as the new business.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 39, married and a mother of three sons, living in Rawalpindi. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. He is a hardworking and humble person. He works day and night to make sure that their daily needs are met. He is the sole earner in the family. He provides transportation locally and at short distances. His taxi is not working properly due to wear and tear as it has been constantly driven, but he cannot pay for the maintenance charges due to his low income. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan to help him pay for the maintenance expenses. Their dream is to provide a better education to their children.

loans.use: to help her husband pay for taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Meet Abel. He is a 40-year-old farmer from Nyamira town in the Lake region of Kenya. The place is widely known for banana growing. The area's constituents' staple meal is locally known as 'Matoke', a traditional meal made from raw bananas. The area is rain fed, fertile, and hilly. 

Abel is a father of two who has been doing mixed farming for more than three years now. He loves his job and spends a lot of time tending to his farm. However, he faces a couple of challenges day to day. His main challenge is lack of capital to acquire modern tools and equipment. This makes his work slow and strenuous.

Abel is seeking a loan to purchase a water pump, water pipes, and a water storage tank. These pieces of equipment will make his life much easier on the farm. Instead of making trips to the spring back and forth carrying small quantities of water, a water pump will simply pump water constantly from the spring into the tanks through water pipes. This will save him a lot of time and effort. This will also ensure no more water shortages since the water is stored. 
Investing your loan in Abel will bring him and his family untold benefits.

loans.use: to buy a water pump, pipes, and a tank

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Ngeme is a widow who was born in the 1950s. She was blessed with seven births, but only three children survived. Her two sons and one daughter are grown and they take care of themselves. Ngeme runs a food business known as a mamalishe where she cooks food at home, packs them in small containers and sells them to workers around her street. She starts working from 8 a.m. to midday, and just sells lunch food. She is able to earn a fair profit each day. Aside from food, Ngeme has a poultry business where she raises local chickens by buying them as chicks from villages, and raising them until they are ready  stoell. She is a very busy mama dreaming to own a classic lunch restaurant. 

Ngeme has been with Tujijenge since 2010 and taking several loans. She is a good borrower and always pays attention to her loan status. She used the previous loans, that have since been repaid successfully, to pay school fees for her children and bought cooking ingredients. She is so happier now because her life has improved. Her children have grown and were schooled well, all because of Kiva loans. She is so proud with everyone who has supported her group.

Ngeme is requesting a new loan to buy new serving dishes for her mamalishe business. She will share this loan with her group, Bega kwa Bega, which totals three members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new serving dishes for her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Mary Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Mary tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre quien fue su principal maestro.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm en un negocio que tiene montado con sus padres (Ver Foto).

De este negocio depende la economía de su hogar.

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para realizar la compra de un vitrina grande la cual le servirá para exhibir y vender sus panes de una manera más cómoda, higiénica y fácil, ademas podra pagar a algunos proveedores.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada teniendo en cuenta que para este tipo de negocios se necesitan algunas condiciones especiales.
texts.en:
Mary has a lot of experience in the baking business, thanks to her father's teachings; he was her primary teacher. She has always preferred to work independently. She works every day from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm at a business she started with her parents (see the photo). Her household budget depends on this business.

She currently needs help to purchase a large glass case that will serve to display and sell her breads more easily and in a more comfortable, hygienic manner. She will also be able to pay a few suppliers. The loan will allow her to work in better conditions and to be able to ensure the quality of her products.

Her greatest dream is to be able to have a great bakery that stocks various stores. With this help she will be able to work in a more organized manner, keeping in mind that she needs some special conditions for this type of business.

loans.use: to buy a glass case to display and sell her products in a more comfortable manner, thus being able to sustain her business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es una madre soltera cabeza de hogar y su mayor motivación en la vida es su hijo al que ha tenido que sacar adelante a pesar de las adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para sostenerse y continuar progresando con su hijo. 

Hace un tiempo montó su negocio de crea y venta de cerdos de engorde, para lo cual tiene una cantidad muy pequeña de cerdos.

Emilia es una mujer de gran coraje y valentía, siempre está dispuesta a trabajar y superarse, hoy en día solicita un aliento económico para la compra de cerdos para la cría, así podrá capitalizar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de su producción.

Siempre trabaja con mucho empeño, pues es consciente que de este negocio depende el futuro y desarrollo de su hijo.
texts.en:
Emilia is a single mother and the head of her household. Her main motivation in life is her son who she has had to raise in spite of the difficulties in her life. However she has always had the fortitude to support herself and continue to progress with her son. Some time ago she started a business raising and selling pigs so she has a small quantity of pigs.

Emilia is a woman of great courage and bravery and is always ready to work to better herself. Today she is requesting an economic boost to buy pigs to raise. Doing this she can capitalize her business and improve the quality of her production. She always works with much determination as she is conscious that her future and the development of her son depend on her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Idalia Marina

texts.es: Idalia, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia, en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace dos años y medio decidió por tener su propio negocio para generar ingresos para su hogar. Estableció una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, refrescos, churros, azúcar, harina, manteca, pan, huevos, maíz y otros abarrotes. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener su negocio, el préstamo actual es de 15,000 lempiras y  lo invertirá en la compra de productos como arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, churros, refrescos, agua y otros para mantener surtido el negocio y  aumentar sus ventas. Su meta es crecer en el negocio y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Idalia is 32 years old, married and has two children. She lives with her family in the town of Choloma, Cortes. It has been two and a half years since she made the decision to start her own business to earn more income for her home. She established a store where she sells basic goods, sodas, churros, sugar, flour, lard, bread, eggs, corn and other groceries. She has requested several loans to maintain her business. 

The current loan is for 15,000 Lempiras and she will invest it to purchase products like rice, corn, beans, sugar, lard, churros, soda, water and others to keep her business stocked and increase her sales. Her goal is to keep growing her business and help her family.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, corn, sugar, lard, churros, sodas, water and others to stock her store and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food for her business to resell.

loans.name: José Joaquin

texts.es: El taller de repuestos de electrodomésticos de José está ubicado en un pequeño local, del municipio donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 2 a 31 años. Su idea de negocio inició, cuando por curiosidad personal, empezó a desarmar los electrodomésticos de su casa paterna hace 40 años, y la experiencia día a día lo enseñó a repararlos. Hoy en su taller trabaja diariamente, en un horario que inicia desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde, vendiéndole a visitantes del centro del municipio, lugar que es uno de los puntos comerciales mas importantes de Sabanalarga. Su meta no es otra que incrementar sus ingresos, para apoyar el bienestar de sus hijos y generar empleo. En la actualidad José está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento 	que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales constructivos, para adecuar su lugar de trabajo y generar un impacto en la imagen de negocio, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
José's appliance repair shop is located in a small space in the town where he lives with his spouse and his three children, ages 2-31 years old.  His business idea started 40 years ago when, out of personal curiosity, he started taking apart the appliances in his parents' house and, every day, the experience taught him to repair them.

Now he works in his shop every day; his schedule is from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening.  He sells to visitors from the center of town, one of the most important commercial areas in Sabanalarga.  His goal is only to increase his income to support his children's well-being and to generate work.

Currently José's applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He's going to buy construction materials to remodel his workplace and create a visual impact for his business.  That way his Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Leonid Brezhner

texts.es:
Leonid es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un pequeño negocio en el que vende productos de la marca Herbalife que son productos principalmente para el cuidado personal.

Trabaja allí hace aproximadamente un año y ha tenido la fortuna de poder impactar favorablemente a sus clientes.

El desea mejorar su oferta de productos y es por esta razón que solicita un apoyo económico para darse la oportunidad de gozar de unos mejores ingresos con los cuales podrá adelantar sus estudios y apoyara en los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido de productos de Herbalife con la que actualmente no cuenta, así podrá abastecer su negocio y mejorara su inventario.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Leonid is a man who is actively working to face the world and enjoy a full life thanks to his efforts. He has a small business where he sells Herbalife products which are principally personal care products. He has been involved in this for about one year and has the fortune to positively impress his clients.

He wants to increase his offering of products and for this reason he has requested economic support to give him the opportunity to enjoy higher revenues. He could continue his studies and help with the household expenses. The money will be invested in the purchase of a variety of Herbalife products which he does not currently carry, so he can stock his business and increase his inventory. He has great hopes for his business and thinks it will improve considerably in the future thanks to the aid from these institutions that make it possible for people to dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of Herbalife products.

loans.name: Freedom Group

texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Freedom Group where members act as guarantees for each other. They sell biscuits, toffee, soap, combs, brushes and detergent. 

Rose is 23 years old and has two children living in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. She runs a grocery business, selling biscuits, toffee, etc., which she started with a vision of generating income. She faces the challenges of having inadequate capital and competition. However, she hopes to expand her business to new areas and educate all her children to higher levels of learning. Rose needs a loan to buy more biscuits and toffee and sell.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits and toffee and sell.

loans.name: Hernando Manuel

texts.es:
Hernando con 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa y es padre de 3 hijos. 

Toda su vida fue criado en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  

Actualmente posee cultivos de plátano la cosecha de plátano es vendida en el mercado de la región donde reside, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Hernando es un hombre serio, responsable, comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas y semillas de plátano con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones para poderla vender a un mejor precio en el mercado y obtener más ganancias. 

Todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos, a los cuales les podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tengan un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en:
Hernando is 38 years old, lives with his wife and is the father of three children. All his life he was raised in the fields where he has done agricultural work for the majority of his life. Currently, he has plantain crops. The plantain harvest is sold in the market where he lives and this is how he obtains the necessary resources to sustain his home. 

Hernando is a serious and responsible man, committed to his family and his work. This is why he always keeps moving forward, looking for a better future. For this reason he is requesting his first loan cycle to invest in the purchase of agricultural products such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides and plantain seeds. With this he will be able to continue caring for his crops and to harvest his crops in optimal conditions so he can sell them at a better price in the market and obtain higher earnings.

 All of this will help him get ahead, improving the his life and the lives of his children little by little. He will be able to offer his children a better education so they may have a prosperous future that is full of success.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides and plantain seeds to attend to his crops and improve production.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin is married with two children. He previously took a loan for his agriculture business and successfully paid it back. A while ago, he moved to Baku to live with family and because of that, he started a new business. Now he is working as a plumber. Shahin's little son is sick and the treatment requires a lot of money. Shahin wants to support his new business and increase his monthly income. He wants to buy necessary materials and apparatuses, and for this reason Shahin needs a loan in the amount of 1,200 Azerbaijan New Manat. He says thanks for repeated help from the Kiva organization.

loans.use: to pay for necessary materials and apparatuses.

loans.name: Norma Lilian

texts.es:
Norma es conocida desde hace veinte años por su deliciosa comida. Por las mañanas son las tortillas recién hechas o el olor a miel en las ojuelas, al medio día la carne que prepara es muy famosa por su buen sabor y en las noches el pollo asado seduce a cualquiera que pasa en frente de su comidería. A sus 59 años, esta madre soltera de siete hijos, entre las edades de 43 a 28 años, todos independientes, ha trabajado fuerte para poder salir adelante con ellos, brindándoles entre sus necesidades educación y alimentación. Desde que inició viajando a diario al mercado para poder ofrecer su comida, luego vendió el local y compró su propia casa para ofrecer su comida allí.
Ahora Norma cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, unos en el mismo negocio y otros económicamente gracias a que uno trabaja en la alcaldía u otro como maestro. En estos momentos está en una temporada donde las fiestas patronales de su comunidad sirven de puente para generar mayores ingresos en la venta de comida, por lo que solicita de un préstamo para comprar maíz, arroz, carne, miel, frijoles, plátanos, entre otros para poder ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y brindar mejor precio, ya que compraría al mayor. En sus planes está mejorar su casa, comprar mesas y sillas para poder establecer un cafetín, donde sus clientes puedan tener un servicio completo.
texts.en: For more than twenty years Norma has been known for her delicious food. In the morning it is the freshly made tortillas or the smell of honey on the wafers; at noon, the meat she prepares is very famous for its great taste, and in the evening, the baked chicken seduces anyone who goes in front of her diner. At 59 years old, this single mom of seven children, who are between 43 and 28 years old and are all independent, has worked hard to move ahead in life, giving them education and food. She started traveling daily to the market to offer her food. Later on, she sold her store and bought her own house from where she offers her food. Now Norma has her children's support: some are in the same business and some support her financially because one works at the mayor's office and another one is a teacher. Currently, it is the time of the community feasts, which are good to generate more income in the sale of food. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy corn, rice, meat, beans, bananas, among others, in order to offer quality service to her customers and give a better price, because she would be buying at wholesale prices. She plans to improve her house, buy tables and chairs so she can open a café where her customers can have a complete service.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, meat, honey, beans, bananas, among others.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently, she requests a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nancy Verónica

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven de 20 años de edad, estudia tercer año de licenciatura en computación en la  universidad, está soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive con su madre y dos hermanos.

Nancy trabaja en un centro de desarrollo integral desde hace un año, ella tiene que caminar 30 minutos para llegar a la estación de buses para luego dirigirse al lugar donde trabaja, esto lo hace de lunes a viernes y estudia por las noches. En dicho trabajo, Nancy cuida a niños de escasos recursos económicos, participa como tutora impartiéndoles clases, además les brinda programas de cocina, elaboración de pan y artesanías que luego venden para ir creando sus propios ahorros.
Cliente solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para cancelar $1,000.00 que le prestaron a ella para que se hiciera una operación de emergencia, ya que su vida dependía de esa cirugía.

Nancy sueña con terminar sus estudios en la universidad y especializarse en su carrera para luego poder trabajar y de esta forma apoyar a su familia y a sus hermanos para que estos puedan seguir estudiando y culminar con una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Nancy is a youth of 20 years. She is working on her third year of licensing in computation at a university. She is single and does not have children. She lives with her mother and two siblings. 

Nancy has been working in a developmental center for a year. She has to walk 30 minutes to get to the bus station that will take her to the place where she works. She does this Monday through Friday and goes to school at night. In this job, Nancy cares for children with few economic resources, serving as a tutor giving classes. She also offers programs in cooking, baking bread and making artwork that they later sell to create their own savings. 

She is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to pay off $1,000.00 that was loaned to her to cover the costs of an emergency surgery, since her life depended on this operation. Nancy dreams of one day finishing her studies in the university, and specializing in her career, allowing her to work and support her family and siblings so that they can keep going to school and obtain and professional career.

loans.use: to pay off $1,000.00 that was loaned to her to pay for an emergency surgery.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
La señora Etelvina de 68  años de edad,  es casada  no  tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en su propia casa en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 27 años  al negocio de la elaboración de artesanías para ofrecerlas a los turistas que pasan por esa zona.
Doña Etelvina compra el barro y los elabora en su casa, los pinta y luego los pone a vender, también compra ya elaborados y los decora, con esta actividad a sacado adelante a sus hijos que en la actualidad ya son independientes.
Doña Etelvina está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como ser pinturas, leña, barro y jarros ya elaborados solo para decorar con el apoyo de este préstamo espera obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante junto con su familia.
Está contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y su deseo es que su venta se mejore cada día para así tener mejores utilidades es su sexto préstamo

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Etelvina is 68 years old, married and no longer has children who depend on her. She lives in her own home in a community in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has worked for the past 27 years in a business crafting art to sell to the tourists that pass through this area. Etelvina buys clay and works with it in her home, then paints and sells them. She also buys them already made and then decorates them. 

Through this work she has been able to raise her two children who are now independent. Etelvina is requesting this loan to pay for raw materials like paint, wood, clay and ready-made jugs to decorate. With the help of this loan, she hopes to earn the income necessary to get ahead with her family. She is happy to keep working with Prisma and her dream is that her sales improve every day so that she may have higher profits. This is her sixth loan.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy paints, wood, clay and jugs for her business.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is 36 years old, married and blessed with four daughters. She is self employed and has been running her own beauty salon in Rawalpindi for the past three years. She provides facials, haircuts, manicures and pedicures, makeup, bleaching, etc. She is good at her work and has gained many customers in a short period of time. She also contributes to her family and utilizes her income to educate her daughters and to pay for daily household expenses. 

Now Shama wants to buy more material for her salon since some of the products have finished and some equipment has worn out. For this purpose she requested a loan through Brac Pakistan to help her with her business. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur and a role model for her four daughters.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Las Soñadoras Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  9  mujeres  emprendedoras y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “LAS SOÑADORAS”.  La Sra. ANA de 27  años de edad soltera  y con 2  hijos, la Sra.ana  tiene una pequeña bodega  hace  4 años. La Sra. Ana con la ayuda de su familia a sabido salir adelante tanto así que  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su productos (azúcar, café, leche, arroz,menestras etc.) . Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos y así  seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Ana  y  todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Ana  es la cuarta  persona de la mano derecha se le distingue por su casaca ploma y su cartera de color negro. Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of nine enterprising woman with much creativity in business. This is what the communal group "Las Sonadoras" is like. Ana is 27 years, old, single and has two children. Ana has had a small shop for four years. With the help of her family, Ana has been able to get ahead so much that she has earned the loyalty of her customers which has allowed her to generate the income needed to cover her household expenses. 

In the future, she would like to have her own store where she can sell her products (sugar, coffee, milk, rice, vegetable stew, etc.) With this loan she will be able to invest in the purchase of more products and continue satisfying the needs to her customers so that she can get ahead. At the same time, Ana and all the other members are grateful to Kiva for this loan and for the confidence that has been placed in them. Ana is the fourth person on the right-hand side. She is wearing a gray jacket and has a black purse. She concludes with the promise of fulfilling all of the necessary requirements.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk and rice.

loans.name: Elsen Dario

texts.es:
Elsen es un cafetero trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de café de muy buena calidad, cultivo que asiste todos los días para obtener una buenas cosechas y venderlas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Concordia.

Adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos y soy esposa. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará materiales como tuberías, llaves, pegantes, entre otros, para la construcción de un desagüe y un acueducto con el cual podrá tecnificar su siembra. Este acueducto le permitirá regar su cultivo de una forma más automatizada.

Apoya a un cafetero colombiano con el empuje y perseverancia que distingue a los campesinos!
texts.en:
Elsen is a hardworking and humble coffee grower, who learned to do all kinds of farm work from the time he was a child, thanks to his parents' teachings. This has allowed him to get ahead, and today he has very high-quality coffee crops. He tends those crops every day in order to obtain good harvests and to sell them in the market plaza of the municipality of Concordia.

In addition, he does day-laborer work on different farms in the region; with that work, he supplements the income with which he safeguards the wellbeing of his children and his wife.

With the support of the loan, he will be materials like pipes, faucets, adhesives, and more for the construction of a drain and an an aqueduct with which he will modernize his farming. This aqueduct will allow him to irrigate his crops in a more automated way.

Support a Colombian coffee grower with the spirit and perseverance that distinguish farmers!

loans.use: to buy materials like piping and adhesives to build an aqueduct that will allow him to irrigate his coffee crops in a more modern way, thereby improving his yield.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick has a retail business in Kisumu town where he sells bags, mats, sisal ropes, and sisal baskets. He is 43 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with six children. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. He also has a rental housing business.

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he plans to use it to buy more stocks of goods for sell. These include sisal mats, ropes, and baskets. He will also use part of the amount to repair his rental houses. He will use the generated profits to expand his business.

Fredrick has been paying his previous loans successfully, and his future hopes are to have more rental houses and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
The above picture presents Hellen from the Litein area of Kenya, a young farmer practicing mixed farming. She is a woman in her late twenties from a community not known for farming, but she has been earning so much through agriculture. For the past 15 years, her primary source of income has been milk, tea, and a variety of crops she plants. 

She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. 

Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Hellen believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Hellen waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been running a milk selling business with her husband for the past five years. She has a cow and a buffalo which she uses for selling milk to the people of her community. She also sells butter and cheese to generate extra profit. 

Farzana has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This loan will allow her to purchase one more cow. Farzana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one that will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: Sra. Vilma  de 48 años de edad soltera  y madre de  3 hijo, sra. Vilma tiene una pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza   ya hace unos  5 año, ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio   (cosméticos)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez la Sra. Vilma  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada.a la Sra. vilma Se le distingue por su casaca de color verde oscuro, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Vilma is 48 years old, single, and the mother of 3 children. For 5 years now, Vilma has run a small business selling beauty products. She is to the point of having a loyal customer base which has generated enough profits to cover her home expenses. In the future she would like to have her own location where she can sell her products and obtain greater financial gains. 

With the requested loan, she will invest it in buying more cosmetic products, and this way continue satisfying the needs of her customers and be able to get ahead. At the same time, Vilma and all of the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and the confidence shown in them. Vilma is wearing the dark green jacket, and signs off with the promise to meet all of her proposed payments.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en:
Shafqat, age 34, is a married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at a higher price. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

At present, she has 3 cows, 3 buffaloes and 4 goats. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of 5 children. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs including food, health, clothing and education.   She, along with her husband, has been farming for many years. She is involved in growing different crops of vegetables and fruits which she sells in the local market.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds, insecticides and pesticides, Tahira has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will help her grow more crops which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya is 58 years of age. 

Her great skill in hand embroidery has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over the years, the demand for her hand-embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for her expenses. 

Suraya is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR with which she wants to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins, and pearls.  

She expects a boost in her earnings from this business and hopes she can achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins, and pearls.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 51-year-old married woman. 

She has been running a business selling milk to support her husband financially. Anwar has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Anwar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. 

She is a vigorous lady, and for the past 10 years she has been running a business buying and selling cloth. Zahida buys cloth in various fabrics and in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community.  She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. 

Zahida expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Jeevan

texts.en:
Jeevan is a 32-year-old married woman with 3 children.

Jeevan is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for the last 5 years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. She is in her 9th loan cycle and has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames, etc. This monetary assistance can take Jeevan closer to achieving her dream of providing her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames, etc.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a la ayuda de su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco Maria empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos para su propia vida y desarrollo.

Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad por los cual ha tenido que responder durante 10 años sola ya que el padre de sus hijos los abandonó.

Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora.
Ella pide un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de insumos como tela, hilos, agujas y encajes, con los que podrá continuar con su producción principalmente de pantalonetas, uniformes escolares, blusas, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sostener su negocio y sus hijos de una manera efectiva ya que podrá capitalizarse y progresar.
texts.en:
Thanks to her her mother, who made clothing her whole life long, Maria learned to make clothing at a very young age.   Little by little, Maria started to understand the process and apply her knowledge to her own life and development. 

Maria has three dependent children for whom she has had to take full responsibility for the last ten years.  The father of her children abandoned them. 

Maria is an enterprising, affectionate woman who is always ready to provide the best customer service. 

She is very grateful for everything she has been able to build in her life up to now. 

She is requesting some financial help to purchase supplies, such as cloth, thread, needles and lace.  With these items, she will be able to continue production, primarily of shorts, school uniforms, blouses and other items. 

This loan will allow Maria to effectively support her business and her children as she will be able to capitalize on the laon and move forward.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making clothing, like cloth, thread, needles, lace, buttons and other items, to stock up her workshop and improve her uniform production.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is a young, hardworking lady. She has been providing stitching services in her locality for several years. Mehwish stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.

She is currently in her 4th loan cycle and she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. Mehwish intends to use this loan amount to buy a sewing machine, needles, thimbles, fabric, etc. to create a means of increasing revenues so that she may able to generate a healthier source of income. Mehwish dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, thimbles, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam is a 45-year-old married woman. For about six years, she is been in the business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are very much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to her household expenses.

To help her to continue her operations, Neelam has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors, as well as packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. Buying these materials will enable her to consistently cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is now in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors, as well as packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 32-years-old, married and he supports 4 people in his family. Together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. He has been in the taxi business for 4 years and right now his monthly income is KES 15,000.

He plans to use this loan to buy new wheels for his taxi as well service it so it can be in good condition. He will use the anticipated profits to start a grocery business.

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to own a vehicle for public transport.

loans.use: To buy new wheels and service his taxi.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store and has 10 years of experience in this field. She also purchases stock of goods from the market. She has been able to earn a healthy income from this store.

Sughran is now in her ninth loan cycle. She wants her business to grow, so she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy edibles such as oil, beverages, salt, tea, packaged milk and other items such as shampoo, sprays, etc. Her dream is to expand her store and provide her family with a better standard of living with the additional income.

loans.use: to buy edibles such as oil, beverages, salt, tea, packaged milk and other items such as shampoo, sprays, etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 52-year-old married woman who has been running a milk sales business for many years with the help of her husband. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.
