She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her four children. She uses most of the income to pay for her children’s health and education. This is her eighth year with Kashf Foundation. She has now requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She hopes that her business will expand with the help of this loan and that she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya is a married mother of five children, with one child attending school.  She has no additional family members.  

Lukiya sells charcoal and has been in this business for 1 year.  She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from selling paraffin and renting houses.  She works seven days week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenge is seasonality.  She is aspiring of owing a fully stocked stall.  She owns a home and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to by bags of charcoal

loans.name: Santos Leonor

texts.es: Doña Santos de 41 años de edad es madre  soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace algún tiempo a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Doña Santos eta solicitando un crédito para la compra de quesillo, maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, tomates, repollos, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y así poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Santos, 41, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her three children. For awhile now she has made a living selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas]. Her business is located near her home in a highly-trafficked area, which is why she has a lot of customers. With the profits from her sales she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

Santos is asking for a loan to buy cheese, corn, beans, pork rinds, tomatoes, cabbage, etc at wholesale so that she can continue her work and give her children more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy cheese, corn, beans, pork rinds, tomatoes, cabbage, etc at wholesale.

loans.name: Sonia Virginia

texts.es: Sonia de 32 años de edad se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de cadenas, anillos y aritos de enchape, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el centro en una zona muy transitada, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y por los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos su esposo esta en estados unidos y le ayuda económicamente,  Sonia está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para continuar con su negocio y asi poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sonia, 32, has worked for three years selling metal-plated necklaces, rings and earrings. Her business is in the town center in a well-trafficked area and she has a lot of customers due to the quality of her products and the good prices. She lives in her own home with her two children; her husband is in the United States and helps them financially.

Sonia is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more products at wholesale so that she can continue with her business and give her children more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy metal-plated necklaces, rings and earrings at wholesale.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann runs a food stall in the town of Kakamega and has been in the business for the past two years. She is 23-years-old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of wheat flour and cooking oil for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. In the future, Ann hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To add stock of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers, and by that, I mean that people who make a living off of the land, and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Sharon, a 25-year-old mixed farmer based in Roret, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya.

Sharon is a single mother of one school-going child whom she truly loves and greatly adores. Sharon always describes her upbringing as challenging, that is why she is doing everything in her power to provide a good foundation for her child and to be able to secure her future.

Sharon has been farming for over 5 years. Over the years, she has gained much experience and is now considered one of the best farmers in her village because of the immense knowledge that she possesses. Sharon passionately loves dairy farming and she has even nicknamed one of her cows “Poly” (a person’s name). Since she has excess dairy food and enough space on her land, Sharon has always wanted to buy another dairy cow, but the challenge that she has been facing is lack of finances. That is why Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Sharon to turn their dreams into reality. Sharon believes that the loan will help her to satisfy the milk demand in her area and, through the accumulated profits, she will be able to realize her dream of developing her business into a large enterprise.

Many women in Kenya are responsible for not only producing food, but also feeding their family. Sharon, being a hardworking farmer, wants to provide all of the basic needs that her child and parents require. Sharon is very disciplined with her finances and she knows that, with the accumulated profits, she will be able to fully repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a young ambitious farmer based in the Kisii area of Kenya. She is a mother of 3 who has been doing dairy farming for the last 6 years. She enjoys dairy farming because it is the source of her pride that provides her an honest living. Her biggest challenge though is access to funds/capital.

Risper is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She is deeply wired to dairy farming because of her background which gives her an advantage: She has hands-on farming experience.  

With your loan, Risper will boost her income as a result of increase in the sales volume. The income will enable her to complete her debt and settle some of the farm-related costs.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a married man living in Masindi-Uganda.  He has a video library and does farming.  He started the business to increase his income and his standard of living.  He hopes to build a permanent house; however, he is challenged with inadequate capital.  He wants a loan to buy a generator to boost his business during the time of power black outs.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Mirna Cecilia

texts.es: Mirna de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene mucha clientela ya que sus productos son frescos y a buen precio, con las ganancias de sus ventas pueden salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Mirna esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas futas y verduras por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente d trabajo y podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Mirna, 43, lives in her own home with her partner and their two children. She sells fruits and vegetables in the town market. She has a lot of customers because her products are fresh and well priced. With her earnings she is able to get ahead of the household expenses.

Mirna is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables and wholesale since this is her only source of work and she will be able to give her family the life they deserve without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a single mother of three children living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells clothes and wishes to educate her children up to the university level. She started her business to earn a living; however, she is challenged by stiff competition within the market segment.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah has a food stall in Kisumu town and she has been running it for the past 15 years. She is 34 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 3 children. Right now, her monthly income is KES 21,000.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of food for use in her business. This stock includes wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, beans and milk. Buying these items will enable her to serve more customers and make more income which she will use to provide for her family.

This is Sarah's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya; her future hope is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy stock of food for her business.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the cattle purchase and sale business with the help of her husband for many years. She sells cattle in different markets in the city. She also sells milk in her community to generate extra income.

Bashiran is a mother of six children. Her business is good enough to provide her family with a decent living.

She is in her seventh loan cycle and has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to use the loan to purchase more cattle for resale. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, 60, is a dairy farmer based in the rain-fed Nyanza province of Kenya.  She has a loving husband and 2 children.  She has been a farmer for the last 18 years with milk as her primary income source.

Hellen is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow, allowing her to build up her herds.  In the long-run, this will enable her to afford fixed investments in land and other assets.  Short-term however, she will be able to repay the loan and settle other farm-related costs.  Her family will be directly impacted through improved diet.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en:
Hafeezan is a 46-year-old cloth trader. Hafeezan and her husband have four children. She started a business buying cloth in the city and selling it in her community. The reason she started this business was that it was very difficult for her to meet her family's household needs with her husband's insufficient income. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in providing for the family.

Today, she plays a vital role in supporting her family. She is in her fourth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase a greater selection of cloths in a larger variety, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She hopes that her business will flourish in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of cloths in a larger variety

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Margret. She is a mother of six. She lives in Kisii, Kenya, which is not very far from Maasailand.  Margret has been a dairy farmer for five years; her primary source of income is milk.
Margret is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable job because the demand for milk in the marketplace has never gone down. Despite there being many milk providers, the prices stay the same. 
With your loan investment, Margret would first use the money from the extra milk to service the loan. After paying back the loan obligation, she would then plough the profits back into her business to drive growth. Her strategy is to grow the business and make enough income to provide her family with a good living.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Lydia: a young farmer from Chebara -- a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya -- who has defied the common notion among most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. Lydia is happily married and she and her husband are blessed with 4 children.

Her primary sources of income are milk and tomatoes that she plants on her farm. She also engages in personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture. She practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the varied agricultural training she has been receiving to broaden her skills.

Although she earns handsome profits from farming, she faces one big challenge, and that is high prices of fertilizers, seedlings and inputs. This is as a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agro-vet shop in her area. Lydia is requesting a loan to start an agro-vet shop. The Chebara area has only one agro-dealer who is catering to thousands of small-time farmers who depend upon him solely for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them extra, since he is the only agro dealer and he enjoys a monopoly. Lydia wants to change this and seize the business opportunity. With your loan, she will start an agro-vet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market. Lydia will also help the small-time farmers in her area who have been having serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs for a long time.

With your loan, Lydia will change from the miserable peasant farmer she is right now to a certified agro dealer who will be depended upon by close to 5,000 small-time farmers in her area both for inputs, knowledge and information about improved inputs.

loans.use: To start an agro-vet shop

loans.name: Dairo De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Dairo es un mecánico de automóviles muy experimentado y con gran conocimiento. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través del trabajo empírico.

Adicional a su labor como mecánico también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de SOAT (seguros obligatorios de transito) en el municipio de Támesis, Antioquia.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de seguros de transito para tener un inventario más amplio, adicionalmente requiere el dinero para realizar mantenimiento a su negocio con nueva herramienta.

Con este apoyo podrá continuar con su labor y mejorara gradualmente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dairo is a very experienced and knowledgable car mechanic. He has gains a lot of skills through life experience. In addition to working as a mechanic, he has a small business selling SOAT [mandatory transit insurance) in the county of Tamesis, Antioquia. He is a hardworking and honorable man who knows the significance that the cars have for his bosses and for that reason he always tries to offer excellent service, good quality, and efficiency.

He asks for a loan to buy transit insurance in order to have a larger inventory. He also needs money to do maintenance on his business and buy new tools. With this support he will be able to continue his labor and gradually increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy mandatory insurance to sell to his customers, which will guarantee the sustenance of his business.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 51-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and seven children. Samira’s family expenses are very costly and this is the reason why she works very hard in cooperation with her husband to handle those expenses. She is involved in the agricultural field and today she wishes to increase her sales and, thus, her income, by purchasing products necessary for her business with the loan that she is requesting from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Samira terribly needs to improve her business, with the aim of enhancing the family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase necessary products for her agricultural business

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa ella tiene una tienda en su casa, Don Efraín  se dedica a la venta de granos básicos especialmente maíz, desde hace 5 años, comercializa sus productos especialmente a las señoras que elaboran tortillas, ya tiene clientela establecida que los buscan por las calidad del producto y por los buenos precios, con sus ventas y con la ayuda de la esposa pueden solventar algunos gastos que se les presentan, El cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar maíz por quintales y seguir con sus ventas y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Efraín, 36, lives in his own home with his two children and his wife, who has a store in their home. For the last 5 years Efraín has sold basic grains, especially corn. He sells his product to the women who make tortillas, and has an established customer base that seeks him out for the quality of his product and his good prices. With his sales and the help of his wife, they are able to cover some of their household expenses.

Efraín asks for a loan to buy corn by hundredweight and continue his sales so that he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, 44, is a small holder farmer based in the Kisii area of Kenya.  For the last 15 years, Jackiline has been practicing dairy farming to support her family of 8 children.  Her primary income source is milk.

Jackline appreciates and enjoys dairy farming because it has enabled her to make a living, and is seeking a loan to purchase an additional cow.  Her main challenge over the years has been lack of capital to expand her business, and with the loan Jackline will buy an additional cow to boost milk output.  The income she generates from the additional milk will go to fulfilling her loan obligation.  She will also use the money to help her pay for the high transportation cost of milk to the market. 

With the growth of her business, Jackline wants her children to have a comfortable life and look after the farm in the future when she is old.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Meet Dorica. She is a hardworking dairy farmer from a rural village based in the Kisii area of Kenya. She has seven children. For the last fifteen years, her primary source of income has been milk.
Dorica is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. With your loan, she would be able to grow her asset base and increase milk sales.  She loves dairy farming since it is not so reliant on rainfall: milk production is possible even on days when the elements are hot and dry. 
With your loan, Dorica would be in a position to grow her business and afford the high milk transportation cost that she can hardly afford now. When asked how her family would benefit from the loan, she said, “They will get enough milk.”

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo, de 69 años, inicio con un negocio de mantenimiento, decoración y embellecimiento de motocicletas y automóviles en el municipio de Caldas.

En el momento en que inicio con su negocio, encontró la motivación para trabajar incansablemente y fueron sus 11 hijos.

Hoy en día sus hijos son mayores de edad, pero su espíritu emprendededor y trabajador aun sigue intacto.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como calcomanías, pegantes, pinturas especiales, entre otros elementos que le permitan mantener su servicio disponible para sus clientes y poder llevar el sustento para su hogar.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener  a su esposa que en la actualidad es su mas grande compañía.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 69, started his business maintaining, decorating and embellishing motorcycles and cars in the county of Caldas. When he began the business he found the motivation to work tirelessly - his 11 children. Today his children are grown, but his entrepreneurial and hardworking spirit are still intact.

He asks for a loan to buy inputs like stickers, glues, special paints and other things that will allow him to keep his services available for his customers and help him take home sustenance for the household. With this loan he can take care of his wife who is currently his greatest companion.

loans.use: to buy stickers, glues and other things to continue his work decorating motorcycles.

loans.name: Inayat

texts.en:
Inayat is a 28-year-old married woman who has three children attending school. Her husband is a car mechanic. As for her, Inayat has worked in the agriculture business since 2009 in order to better support her family financially.

Today, Inayat would like to receive a loan from Kiva field partner, Vitas s.a.l., to provide her business with the fertilizers needed to her products more quickly so as to increase her productivity. This would increase her sales and, thus, her income. In the future, Inayat plans to borrow more Kiva loans to expand her business into other areas and maybe open a vegetable shop.

loans.use: to provide her business with necessary fertilizers

loans.name: Alejandra Patricia

texts.es:
Alejandra se encuentra soltera y es una mujer de gran mentalidad emprendedora, sueños y metas claras. 

Desde hace 2 años comenzó a trabajar en un negocio de almacén combinado con café internet y venta de dulces y otros comestibles, la idea de este negocio surge a partir de la necesidad de obtener un empleo que le diera la oportunidad de trabajar independiente, además de que en la comunidad no existía un negocio similar.

Poco a poco fue solidificando su negocio y hoy en dia vende elementos de papelería y presta el servicio de internet.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de vitrinas y surtido de elementos de papelería con los que impulsara su negocio de una manera efectiva.

De esta manera su negocio saldrá adelante y podrá ofrecer en su hogar unos buenos ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandra is single, and she is a woman with a great entrepreneurial mentality, dreams, and clear goals.

Two years ago she began to work in a business that was a combination of an internet café and a store selling sweets and other food items. The idea for this business arose from the need to obtain employment that would give her the opportunity to work independently, and furthermore, because no similar business existed in the community.

Little by little her business strengthened, and now she sells stationery items and offers internet service.

She is applying for financial encouragement to make the purchase of display cases and a stock of stationery items with which she will boost her business in an effective manner.

In this way her business will advance and she will be able to offer her household good income to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy display cases and a stock of stationery items to improve her business and increase sales.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 38-year-old married Lebanese woman. She is from Lebanon and she lives with her husband and three children. Fatmeh is a private teacher working from home. She has worked in this domain for the past 15 years.

She is currently asking for a loan from Kiva field partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase tables to facilitate and arrange the sessions and make the students more content while she is teaching them. In the future, Fatmeh wants to borrow more Kiva loans because she plans to extend the area where she receives her students in order to welcome more learners.

loans.use: to purchase tables

loans.name: Los Geranios Group

texts.es: Crecencia tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. Ella trabaja en su bodega que implemento en su vivienda hace varios años. Años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de salchipapas. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes bebidas golosinas. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su bodega. Ella participa en el grupo “LOS GERANIOS”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Crecencia es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Crecencia is 39 years old. She lives with her partner and two children who are in school. She has been working in her store, which is set up in her home, for a number of years. In previous years she sold salchipapas (a popular Peruvian dish made of sausages and French fries). She will invest the loan in the purchase of more groceries, beverages, and candies. Her great desire is to expand her store. 

She participates in the "Los Geranios" (The Geraniums) group. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan offered. Crecencia is the first one on the left side.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, beverages, and candies.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María es un una mujer ecuatoriana  de 53 años de edad, estuvo casada por varios años, pero su matrimonio fracasó por lo que María decidió separarse definitivamente de su esposo, y fue ella quien sacó adelante a sus hijos, ahora vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Latacunga en un sector urbano, el mismo que está ubicado cerca al terminal terrestre, hace unos 10 años vive en unión libre con Jorge, no tienen hijos con mucho esfuerzo hicieron su casa.
Gracias al esfuerzo que han hecho sus padres  ella  pudo completar sus estudios primarios, ya que la situación económica en su casa nunca fue buena María tuvo que trabajar desde muy niña y así ayudar con los gastos en su hogar
María se dedica en la actualidad a la venta de ropa usada en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad y fuera de ella, a esta actividad la dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo , lo aprendió de su cónyugue actual y trabajan juntos además también reciclan  material como botellas de plástico y los venden , este ha sido su sustento para poder salir adelante y ha ayudado a sus hijos en lo que ella a podido.
María agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral ya que ella invertirá en la compra de mochilas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Maria is an entrepreneurial Ecuadorian of 53. She was married for a number of years, but her marriage broke down, and so Maria decided to definitely separate from her husband, and it was she who raised their children. Now she lives in her own house in the city of Latacunga in an urban sector located near the land terminal. For some 10 years she has lived in free union with Jorge. They have no children. With great effort, they built their house.

Thanks to the effort that her parents made, she was able to complete primary school, since the economic situation in her house was never good. Maria had to work since she was a child and thus help with the expenses in her home.

Now Maria sells used clothing in the various fairs in the city and outside of it. She works in this business for the greater part of her time. She learned it from her current partner, and they work together. In addition, they also recycle materials such as plastic bottles and sell them. This has been their sustenance to be able to get ahead, and she has helped her children with what she was able.

Maria is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making possible the growth of her work life, since she will invest in the purchase of backpacks and pigs.

loans.use: to buy backpacks for the beginning of classes.

loans.name: Rispa

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Rispa, a mother of one. She is a mixed farmer in the Nyanza area of Kenya. Rispa makes a decent living selling milk and crops such as tea among others that she produces on her farm. She also engages in other small businesses to make extra income to meet her family’s needs.

Rispa has been in the farming business for at least four years. She has no plans to quit in the future as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. However, her biggest challenge is limited funds.

She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cowshed. This will provide her animals protection against harsh weather. The housing unit will help her to administer drugs to her animals to maintain good health and hygiene. The cowshed will later come in handy when she scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health.

The additional income from this development will go to her children’s education.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is a 28-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. They are all working together to eventually meet their life needs. Focusing on Maya, she is a private teacher working in this occupation since 2011 at her house. And presently, she is seeking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a laptop as she states that it will help her to better manage her preparations as well as her research. Maya’s only aim is to provide her children with proper education continuously.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es:
A los 12 años, Wilmer aprendía a trabajar la tierra, a cómo sembrar maíz y a descubrir los valores del arduo trabajo para poder salir adelante y así garantizar siempre la alimentación de él y de su familia. Ahora a sus 31 años, ha podido crecer y se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que fueron parte de ese avance, pues gracias al préstamo anterior pudo tener un cultivo con éxito, que le permitiera sustentar a su familia y más ahora que tiene un hijo de dos años de edad. 
En la pequeña finca de Wilmer se siembra maíz, frijoles y sorgo para vender en su comunidad. Para poder cubrir con los gastos de la casa, también viaja a Costa Rica a trabajar en diciembre y regresa en abril para su nueva siembra. Actualmente está en esa temporada, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar Gramoxon, hierbisida, refrescante y abono urea. De igual manera para pagar mano de obra de los trabajadores, recursos que le permitirán tener un producto de calidad para vender y generar buenos ingresos. Con ello podrá ahorrar para comprar un terreno, algunos terneros y mejorar su vivienda, como tanto lo sueña.
texts.en:
At 12 years old, Wilmer learned how to farm. He learned how to plant corn and discovered the value of hard work so he could get ahead and garantee there would always be food for his family. Now, at 31 years old, he has been able to grow and he feels very grateful to all of the people who were part of that achvievement. Thanks to the previous loan, he was able to have a sucessful harvest, which allowed him to provide for his family, especially now that he has a two year old son.

On Wilmer's small farm, he plants corn, beans, and sorghum, which he sells in his community. In oder to cover his household's expenses, he also travels to Costa Rica to work in December and returns on April for the new planting. He is currently in the planting season, which is why he's requesting a new loan to buy Gramoxon, herbicides, and urea fertilizer. He also needs to pay for laborers. These are resources that allow him to have a quality product to sell and generate a good income. With this he will be able to save to buya piece of land, some calves, and improve his house, just like he always dreams.

loans.use: to buy Gramoxon, herbicides, and urea fertilizer and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband, who works as a painter. They have three children, some of whom are still attending school. In 2009, she began her own business producing bread and vegetables. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase fertilizer and seeds to nurture more crops as well as getting flour for bread production. Fatmeh’s only aim is to keep supporting her family no matter what and she states that more Kiva loans will unquestionably improve her business and financials on top of everything.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and flour.

loans.name: Veeramakaliamman Shg-Thiruneelakudi Group

texts.en:
Devi (the lady who is standing with her hand raised) and 12 of her friends Chandra, Chitra, Devi, Chitra, Jayasrimary, Krishnaveni, Palaniyamm, Rajalakshmi, Vijaya, Tamilselvi, Madhavi and Vijaya formed a group called ‘Veeramakaliamman’. All hail from Thiruneelakudi village of Trichy in Tamil Nadu. Most of them are daily wage laborers and help supplement their household income. These diligent women are unable to save money from their monthly income. A major chunk of their income goes towards buying firewood or kerosene, and a lot of their time is spent cooking over traditional ‘chulha’ stoves. These chulhas, apart from being time consuming, emit a lot of smoke, which plays havoc with their health. This adds to their medical expenses.
 
Hence, to tackle these problems, they have approached PAT (Micrograam’s field partner) to buy Greenway cook stoves. The benefits of the Greenway cook stove are that: it leads to fuel savings, uses all solid fuels, minimizes emissions of CO, CO2, supports fast and convenient cooking, is highly durable, and is maintenance-free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost. Hence, they are seeking a group loan repayable in easy installments. They intend to use the loan to purchase Greenway cook stoves. Your loan will help these women to have better health and save a little more money.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools needed for students such as books, notebooks, pens, etc.

loans.name: Vanavil Shg-Kutthalam Group

texts.en:
The Vanavil group of 15 women led by Angammal and her group members are on a mission to make a small but important change to their way of living. All are living in Kutthalam village in Tamil Nadu. Angammal is the featured borrower. These women use traditional stoves for cooking in their homes. The noxious smoke and particulate matter that emanate from the stove are the primary cause for many respiratory illnesses. Their children often complain of breathlessness and their husbands’ productive years, not to mention their own, are reduced because of ill health.
  
Fortunately for these women, improved design and technology offers an alternative cook stove that employs an efficient combustion process to reduce the smoke and hazards associated with the traditional cook stoves. These women are requesting a loan to buy this stove. Your contribution to meet their loan target will help them make a wise and necessary investment in a healthy future.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Madhuraimeenakshi 1 Shg-Athiyur Group

texts.en:
Amudha and seven other women hailing from Athiyur in Tanjore, Tamil Nadu have formed a Self-Help Group (SHG) named Madhuraimeenakshi 1. 35-year-old Amudha is a daily wage laborer, as are the other members of the group. They work long hours outside only to come back home and spend a lot of time cooking over traditional ‘chulha’ stoves that emit a lot of smoke that is detrimental to their health. The smoke affects the children at home too. Besides, there is always the danger of contracting respiratory ailments hovering over their heads.

So Amudha and her group have approached PAT, which is promoting cook stoves as part of their energy initiative with the financial support of Micrograam. The benefits of the Greenway cook stove are: fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of CO, CO2, fast and convenient cooking, high durability, and they are maintenance free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost. Due to all the above reasons, these cook stoves are preferred by the group.
Amudha and her group are, hence, seeking a loan repayable in easy installments, to buy the Greenway cook stoves. Your loan will help these hardworking women to ensure better health for themselves and their families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Isaitamil - 1 Shg - Atchanur Group

texts.en:
Isaitamil Self-Help Group is managed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT). This NGO helps people improve their livelihood in Tamil Nadu.   
 
Devagi is the leader of this group, which includes six more members. She lives in Atchanur village, in her own house with her husband and three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Devagi is a regular customer of the PAT. She has been taking loans for the last one year and has repaid the loans on time.

Devagi wants to purchase a smokeless stove, which is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt., Ltd. Its cost is 1,400 INR. It is designed for daily use. The traditional stoves produce more smoke and are called a kitchen killer. The smokeless stove emits less carbon dioxide and prevents household risks. It also promotes healthier lifestyles by limiting the toxic and hazardous effects of indoor pollution.   

Devagi and the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove to give a healthier life to their families.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Isaitamil Shg - Atchanur Group

texts.en:
Jayarani leads the Isaitamil group of seven other women residing in the Atchanur village in Tamil Nadu. Jayarani is the featured borrower. They are all hardworking married women, and to support their family income and meet their monthly expenditures, they have to work. They are engaged in diverse occupations and either work as daily wage agricultural laborers, or as employees in small private firms, or they run their own small rural businesses. However, with their meager incomes, they still have some ways to go in terms of improving their living conditions. For cooking, they mostly use the traditional chulhas, makeshift stoves that use firewood that emits a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among the family members, but also pollutes their surroundings.    
        
This eight-member group is seeking a loan to purchase eight Greenway cooking stoves. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. They intend to repay the loan amount in easy installments. This loan product will help them in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to purchase low smoke cooking stoves

loans.name: Kavikuyil Shg - Keelathiruppanthuruthi Group

texts.en:
Josphine is 34 years old and resides in Keelathiruppanthuruthi, a small village in Tamil Nadu, India. Josphine is married and they have two children, both of whom are studying in elementary school. Her husband is a laborer in the agriculture fields but is unable to sustain his family with his income alone.
 
Josphine is the featured borrower of the eight-member “Kavikuyil” Self-Help Group (SHG). The group has been receiving loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last four years.   

Josphine and her group would like to take a Kiva loan to purchase a Greenway smart smokeless stove. Each group member is requesting a small loan of INR 1,400, which will be repaid in easy installments. The Greenway smart stove is a single burner, high-efficiency cook stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves.  

Josphine and her group have the opportunity to save time and cut a recurring fuel expense while being able to cook in a healthier environment. This stove has also been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to purchase a smart smokeless stove

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care and timely loans. She lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Kavikuyil 1 Shg -Keelathiruppanthuruthi Group

texts.en:
Metildamary is the leader of the Kavikuyil-1 Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu. Metildamary lives in Keelathiruppanthuruthi village with her two children and husband in her own house. Her husband is a mason. She has taken loans from PAT previously and repaid them on time.  

Metildamary and the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs 1,400 INR. A smokeless stove emits less carbon dioxide, which reduces smoke. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. The smokeless stove is highly efficient and designed for long-term use. This will allow a reduction in problems related to health, deforestation and climate change.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Dorcas. She is an ambitious, hardworking Kenyan farmer based near Lake Victoria.  She has six children whom she has sustained through mixed-farming over the last 15 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, transportation services and other personal businesses.

Dorcas is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. The housing will provide her animals with protection and comfort. The cows will be healthier when she can comfortably ration the feeds and clean the unit regularly. With your loan, you will enable Dorcas to upgrade the state of her farm in a very big way. This will enable her to introduce more productive techniques of dairy farming such as zero-grazing. The increase in returns will enable her to comfortably pay for other farming expenses that constitute her highest monthly expenses. Her family will also enjoy all the benefits that come with an increase in income.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Udhayam Shg - Keelarasur Group

texts.en:
Kolanchiammal leads the group “Udhayam” of six other women residing in the Keelarasur village in Trichy District of Tamil Nadu. Kolanchiammal is the featured borrower. They are all married and to support their family income and meet their monthly expenditure, they have to work. For cooking, they mostly use the traditional chulhas, makeshift stoves that use firewood, which emits a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among the family members, but also pollutes their surroundings.  
  
This seven-member group is seeking a loan to purchase seven Greenway cooking stoves. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. They intend to repay the loan amount in easy monthly installments. This loan product will help them in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless cooking stove

loans.name: Joweriya

texts.en: Joweriya is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells vegetables and fruits. She has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy onions, cabbages, sweet potatoes, tomatoes and carrots. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to own a fully stocked food stall. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in a rented house; her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy onions, cabbages, sweet potatoes, tomatoes and carrots

loans.name: Malligaipoo Shg - Viragalur Group

texts.en:
Jancyrani is a 28-year-old woman who is married with two children. Jancyrani’s husband is a marginal farmer with an average income.

Jancyrani has learned about a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra that uses 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. Most members in her community use conventional firewood stoves in their kitchens, which cause 70% more smoke emissions than the smokeless stove. Jancyrani wishes to be able to save money on fuel expenses as well as to provide a good atmosphere in the house, devoid of caustic fumes.

Jancyrani is a leader of the Malligaipoo Self-Help Group (SHG), which is located in Viragalur village in the Trichy District in Tamil Nadu, India. She and the other 10 members of the group wish to request a group loan in order to buy this smokeless stove. They all are hoping to benefit from the lower fuel costs and safety of lower smoke emissions.   

This is Malligaipoo group’s very first loan from Kiva. The group members are very excited about the opportunity to purchase this sustainable stove and wish to thank the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta finds pleasure in doing her bread-making activities. Not only does she enjoy her hobby, but she earns an income from it as well. A 65-year-old widow, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for her family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with providing her with capital to support her bread-making activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase flour and other ingredients. In the future, Julieta wishes to become a supplier of bread in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Peter, a farmer in Siongiroi. Peter is involved in maize, poultry and dairy farming. He engages in milk and egg production for commercial purposes as opposed to many rural farmers who are in it for subsistence. Peter also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place him in a better position to engage in other agriculture-related businesses, which, in fact, he does.
  
Peter is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. He has been in the farming business for at least 10 years. He has no plans to quit in the future as he finds farming to be not only fulfilling but also lucrative. However, his biggest challenges are the poor road network and lack of market. With your loan, Peter will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when he scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to his children’s education.

loans.use: to construct a cow shed

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani is 54 years old. She lives alone in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. She works at a local market as a sales lady and earns a small monthly income. Nani decided to start a new business in order to increase her income. The startup program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1,200 and to start trading clothes. She will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell at higher prices to increase her income. Nani awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está estudiando la carrera de derecho porque le gusta la profesión para poder más adelante lograr su objetivo en todo, tanto familiar como en lo laboral.
Quiere ser un abogado muy conocido, que pueda ayudar a las personas que necesiten de sus servicios.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jorge is from the city of Paraguarí.  He is studying law because he likes the law profession and he thinks it will enable him to move forwards towards achieving his familial and career goals.  He wants to be a very well-known lawyer, so that he can help the people who need his services.

He is asking for this loan to make school tuition payments so that he can continue studying and working as hard as he has been so far.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
Griselda es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, proviene de una familia humilde, trabaja como empleada doméstica para seguir sus estudios. La carrera que está siguiendo es la de técnica en enfermería, y quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Griselda is from Carapeguá.  She comes from a humble family and works as a housekeeper in order to continue studying.  She is studying to be a nurse, and she wants to be able to improve the quality of her life.  

She is asking for this loan to invest in paying for her degree, since this is a way that she can cover this expense.

loans.use: to make payments towards her degree

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 42 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Teshie. Marie sells suits for a living. She wants to increase the size of her business, so she plans to buy more suits. For this reason, she needs a loan of 1,600 GHS. Marie thanks Kiva lenders for their support. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more suits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lariza

texts.es:
Lariza está cursando el último año de la carrera de nutrición, está esperando por llegar a terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y ejercer la profesión.
Ella es una mujer que quiere salir adelante por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo, quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y también poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad, ya que así podrá seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece ya que su préstamo anterior lo uso en sus estudios y le fue de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Lariza is in her last year of her nutrition degree.  She is hoping to finish her degree successfully and become a nutritionist.  She is a woman who wants to get ahead through her work and effort, and she wants to make her life better and also be able to help her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to make college tuition payments so that she can continue studying as she has been.  She is grateful for the last loan that she received since she used it to pay for her studies and it helped out a lot.

loans.use: to make college tuition payments

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es un joven con grandes metas para lo cual estudia y trabaja incansablemente día y noche, para de esa forma poder ser un gran profesional en el futuro ser útil a su comunidad y su país.
Él está estudiando la carrera de derecho, y comenta que en un futuro no muy lejano quiere poder ejercer su profesión para sobresalir y ayudar a sus seres queridos, y también poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en su gasto de manutención ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir los gastos que tiene en materiales, fotocopias y demás.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man with big goals which he is studying and working tirelessly day and night to reach, because that is how he can become a great professional and be useful to his community and country in the future.  

He is studying law, and he says that in the near future he wants to be able to practice his profession to stand above the rest and help his loved ones while improving the quality of his life. 

He is asking for this loan to pay for his living expenses since that is how he will be able to cover the cost of school supplies, photocopies, and other expenses.

loans.use: to pay for living expenses

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Las grandes montañas, el aire fresco y sus cultivos en crecimiento son quienes a diario le brindan los buenos días a Carlos José. Es un hombre de 34 años, dinámico y trabajador que  por más de veinte años se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Está muy agradecido con el financiamiento de Kiva a través de MiCrédito, puesto que logró comprar abonos y fertilizantes para el buen cuido de sus tierras, lo que le permitió obtener una cosecha de maíz exitosa.  Esto le permitió ganar más clientela e incrementar sus ingresos.  
Trabaja arduamente para poder brindarle a sus hijos de 6 y 12 años una educación de calidad, ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad desea que ellos la tengan. Por lo tanto con anhelos de seguir prosperando solicita un segundo crédito para comprar 2 quintales de abono refrescante, 2 quintales de urea y para pagar la mano de obra para el cultivo de las chiltomas. Estima que el financiamiento será de mucha ayuda puesto que logrará aumentar la producción de su capital. Entre sus planes futuros está comprar más tierras para cultivar otros productos y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, de manera que pueda seguir progresando para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Vast mountains, fresh air, and growing crops are all Carlos José needs to have a good day. Carlos is 34 years old, dynamic and hard-working and for over twenty years he has worked in farming. Carlos is very grateful for his last Kiva loan offered through MiCrédito as he used it to buy manure and fertiliser to look after his land. This allowed him to grow a successful yield of maize, giving him more customers and a higher income.

Carlos works hard in order to offer his children - twelve and six years old - a good quality education. Carlos himself did not go to school and wants his children to have the opportunity that he did not. As a result, with a desire to continue moving forward, Carlos is applying for a second loan in order to buy two hundredweights of manure and two hundredweights of urea, and to pay labourers to grow sweet peppers. Carlos believes that this loan will be of great help as he will be able to increase production. Among his plans for the future, Carlos wants to buy more land to grow more products and satisfy customer demand. He will then be able to continue progressing in order to offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two hundredweights of manure and two hundredweights of urea, and to pay labourers to grow sweet peppers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una persona independiente siempre ha trabajado para estudiar aunque ha sido un poco difícil.
Su meta es recibirse ser una buena profesional útil para los demás y poder progresar y tener su título de Instrumentista Quirúrgica.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus matrículas de estudio.
texts.en:
María is an independent person who has worked to study. This has been difficult, however.

María's goal is to have a profession and to be useful to others. She wants to progress and have her qualification as a surgical nurse.

María is applying for this loan in order to pay tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Arlet Johanna

texts.es: Observando a su madre, quien es una mujer comerciante, aprendió a ver el negocio como una actividad en la cual en el futuro generaria sus propios ingresos; esto la llevó, a prestar dinero para comprarle mercancia a ella,  quien la ayudó dandole una parte de la mercancia a crédito, esto fue desde hace seis (&) años, cuando decidió iniciar su propia actividad, y luego compró una m´quina bordadora bordadora y se dedicó a ofrecer este servicio de   bordado a confeccionistas y posteriormente incrmentó su oferta vendiendo celulares, directamente a sus clientes, mediante crédito, a través del cual recupera el dinero quincenalmente. Hoy su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, organizandolo y dotandolo de un ambiente acogedor que encante a su clientela, pues su meta familiar es tener su propia vivienda, para aumentar el bienestar de su hogar, conformado por su conyuge y su hija de 13 años de edad. Arlet, cree que invirtiendole a su negocio mejorarán su productividad y sus ventas, por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solicitar un credikiva, primer crédito que hace a esta organización, mediante el cual comrpará una máquina bordadora mas y mercancias variadas,como accesorios para celulares,femeninos etc, para atender las necesidades de su clientela  y lograr hacer exitosa esta inversión.
texts.en: By watching her mother - a businesswoman - Arlet learned to see that having a business would be a way to generate her own income in the future. She therefore borrowed money from her mother to buy merchandise, and her mother sold her some merchandise on credit. This was six years ago; later Arlet bought a sewing machine and started offering dressmaking services. Arlet then also began to sell mobile phones to her customers on credit. On this system, she collected payments fortnightly. Today, Arlet's goal is to expand her business, organise it, and to create a welcome environment that her customers will love. In her family life, Arlet's goal is to have her own home and to increase well-being in her household, which is made up of her partner and 13-year-old daughter. Arlet believes that investing in her business will increase productivity and sales. As a result she has come to "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" to apply for a Kiva loan. This is her first loan from the organisation and she will use it to buy another sewing machine and various merchandise, such as mobile phone accessories, women's accessories and more. With these goods, she can attend to her customers needs and make this investment a success.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and various merchandise, such as mobile phone accessories, women's accessories and more.

loans.name: Rosa Eladia

texts.es:
Productos ordenados, excelente atención y una sonrisa cálida es lo que reciben los clientes al entrar a la pequeña pulpería de doña Rosa. Es una mujer dinámica, trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hija de 19 y 20 años de edad, ambas asisten a clases, puesto que desean ser profesionales de éxito. Inició en el mundo de los negocios hace veinte años, comenzó elaborando y comercializando pasteles y cajetas, luego al casarse, invirtió con su esposo para establecer una pulpería que poco a poco ha crecido.
Ella agradece el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica al cultivo del frijol y ha sido un pilar importante en la economía familiar, asegura que la unión hace la fuerza. Con anhelos de seguir progresando, solicita un crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos tales como arroz y frijoles; también aceite, condimentos, huevos, pan, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que desea satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, lo que generará buenos ingresos. Una de sus metas próximas es comprar un freezer para iniciar a vender carne y así su negocio siga en auge.
texts.en:
Neat products, excellent service and a warm smile are what await customers who come into Rosa's little grocery store. Rosa is a dynamic, hard-working and enterprising woman. She is 46 years old, married and has two daughters, 19 and 20 years old each. Both daughters are in school as they want to be successful professionals. Rosa entered the business world 20 years ago. She began by producing and selling cakes and fudge. Later, when she married, she and her husband invested money to start a grocery store that has gradually grown.

Rosa is grateful for her husband's support. He grows beans and has been an important pillar in the family economy. Rosa says that it is working together that strength is created. With a desire to continue progressing, Rosa is applying for a loan to increase production. She needs to buy basic grains, such as rice and beans, as well as oil, condiments, eggs, bread, fizzy drinks, sweets and more. Rosa is putting her trust is this loan as she wants to satisfy her customers' demands; this will generate a higher income. One of Rosa's next goals is to buy a freezer in order to start selling meat and for her business to continue moving upwards.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, such as rice and beans, as well as oil, condiments, eggs, bread, fizzy drinks, sweets and more.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.es: La señora Suzana de 43 años de edad tiene 3 hijas (15, 10,2)  ella posee una tienda hace mas de 8 años ya que ella empezó su venta con unas bolsitas de ricitos y una caja de aguas y esto  ha incrementado al pasar los años  en la actualidad ella posee una gran  variedad de productos a la venta (maíz, tomate, gaseosas, carbón, azúcar, café, dulces, frijol, hielo, pollo, jamón, salchichas etc.) ya que ella se siente feliz de poder complacer las necesidades de sus vecinos, ella solicita un credito ya que una parte del  crédito lo invertirá en  ampliar mas su tienda ya que no cuenta con suficiente espacio para lograr dar a conocer todos los productos que ella posee y la otra parte lo invertirá en compra de en productos para su tienda (Gaseosas, Azúcar, Maíz, Frijol) ella agradece por la comprensión ya que su mayor anhelo  es poder lograr ahorrar para darles una mejor educación a sus hijas y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Suzana is 43-years' old and has 3 daughters (15, 10, 2). She opened her shop 8 years' ago, when all she had on sale were a few bags of cheese puffs and a box full of bottles of water but this has increased over the years and now she has a great variety of products on sale (corn, tomato, soda, coal, candy, beans, ice, ham, hotdogs etc). 

She likes being able to meet the needs of her neighbours which is why she is requesting this loan, part of which she will invest in expanding her shop because she doesn't have enough space to display all of the products she has, and the other part which she will invest in buying products for her shop (soda, sugar, corn, beans).

She is thankful for your understanding because what she longs for the most is to be able to save some money to give her daughters a better education and a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Martha Lucy

texts.es:
Martha, a sus 64 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. 

Ser madre de dos hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 34 años, comenzó a comercializar productos cosméticos como cremas y lociones para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. Su negocio queda ubicado en su propia casa y allí tiene exhibidos sus productos.

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará cosméticos al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta cada vez mas. Este préstamo le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Martha manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de mercancía y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Martha, at the age of 64, is a charismatic, active and helpful woman. 

Being the mother of two children has been her principal motivation to tirelessly fight, day in, day out, as she searches for ways to make a living and provide for her children. 

About 34 years ago she started selling very good quality cosmetic products like creams and lotions to a variety of clients at excellent prices. This allowed her to get to know the industry and pave her career path. Her business is located in her own house where she has her products on display. 

This has led her to request the support of a loan to improve her inventory by buying wholesale cosmetics in order to satisfy the ever-increasing demand. This loan will help her to increase the income she makes from her work.

Martha shows that her age doesn't stop her doing what she is passionate about, which is why she is always setting herself new goals. One of these goals is to become a large-scale merchandise distributor and generate employment opportunities which would enable her to improve the quality of life and wellbeing of her family, as well as those people who help her carry out her daily work.

loans.use: to buy a variety of creams and lotions to stock her business and be able to increase her sales.

loans.name: Claudia Selene

texts.es:
Claudia de 33 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 1 hijo, desde hace cuatro años tiene un negocio de venta de comestibles como dulces y frituras el cual atiende en compañía de su esposo en algunas ocasiones. 

Tiene como sueño mejorar su negocio y tener una mejores ventas en el municipio de Bello, Antioquia.

En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es muy perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Claudia en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario como dulces, frituras y otros comestibles, así podrá incrementar su stock y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás, y también mejorar el bienestar de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia, 33, lives with her partner and has one son. She has been selling food such as sweets and chips for four years, something that her husband occasionally helps with.

Her dream is to improve her business and have better sales in the Bello municipality of Antioquia.

Today, she has a small variety of food and this is very harmful to her business as it does not meet with the demand from her customers.

In view of this, Claudia has decided to apply for a loan in order to organise her business better and buy the necessary assortment of food in bulk. This will increase her stock and allow her to pay better attention to her customers, therefore improving her income to meet the basic needs of any business such as utilities, tax and so on, also improving the welfare of her and her family

loans.use: to buy assorted food items such as sweets and  chips to improve her business by boosting sales.

loans.name: Santos Tito

texts.es:
Santos tiene  53 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado debido al conflicto armado que había en el país y además porque tuvieron que abandonar sus lugares de orígenes, ahora él está casado y su esposa se dedica al cuido del hogar, tuvo seis hijos pero solo 4 viven en casa, los otros dos ya formaron sus propios hogares.

Santos trabaja en una granja de pollos de engorde desde hace siete años, él aprendió este trabajo por unas capacitaciones que impartió una institución, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la agricultura,  actualmente siembra una hectárea de maíz y una de frijoles y el lugar donde cultiva está cerca de su casa a veinte minutos.

Él solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para comprar pollos de engorde, concentrado, vitaminas, minerales y vacunas para su mantenimiento, ademas comprará una novilla de esta forma podrá aumentar su ganado y vender los pollos cuando ya estén grandes, así podrá obtener ingresos económicos para él y su familia.

Él sueña con mejorar su vivienda ya que es de adobe y una parte de ladrillo y quisiera repellarla con cemento y arena, además desea trabajar fuerte para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y enseñarles a ellos diferentes trabajos para que puedan hacer sus propios negocios.
texts.en:
Santos is 53 years old. He was only able to go to school up to the sixth grade due to the armed conflict there was in the country. Also, because he had to leave his place of origin. Now, he is married and his wife takes care of the home. He has six children but only 4 live at home. The other two have their own homes.

Santos has worked on a broiler chicken farm for seven years. He learned this work from some trainings he took in an institution. He also raises cattle and farms. Right now he is growing a hectare of corn and one hectare of beans. The place where he grows in twenty minutes from his house.  

He is asking for this loan from CrediCampo to buy broiler chickens, concentrate, vitamins, and immunizations to keep them. He will also buy a heifer and sell the chickens when they are grown. This way, he will obtain income for him and his family. 

He dreams of improving his home. It is made of adobe and brick. He would like to coat it with cement and sand. He also wants to work hard to support his children in their education and teach them different jobs so they can make their own businesses.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens, concentrate, vitamins, minerals and immunizations to keep them. He will also buy a heifer.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en: Shadia is single with one child who goes to school. She has no additional family members. She is in the business of selling chips and has been in this business for 9 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more Irish potatoes, cooking oil and cabbages. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include fluctuating prices of cooking oil. She aspires to expand her business and also to educate her child up to university level. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and cabbages.

loans.name: Ana Lilian's Group

texts.es: Solidario San Cristóbal  conformado por la señora María de 40 años de edad, quien es propietaria de una mini taller de elaboración de ropa para hogar en gran variedad como cobertores, cortinas, edredones, manteles etc. y es madre de 3 niños de los cuales ya dos son universitarios y una pequeña que estudia en nivel primaria la señora Mari desde hace ya muchos años se dedica a la elaboración de cortinas en variedad y menciona que gracias a DIOS  le ha ido muy bien ya que cuando ella comenzó contaba solo con una maquina hoy día cuenta con tres maquinas las cuales le son muy útiles para elaborar distinto tipo  de costuras ya que no solo quiere quedarse allí si no que tiene grades sueños y ,metas y es el  poder emplear a mas personas según la demanda de mercadería  que se le solicite y poder contribuir aun mas con la finanzas de su familia  y es por ello que toca las puertas de FAPE KIVA para que le otorgue un nuevo crédito para la compra de telas para edredones valorado en 5000 ya que con ello constituye mas ingresos y ganancias para su negocio y familia.
texts.en: Solidario San Cristóbal includes María. She is 40 years old and the owner of a mini sewing workshop for the home. She makes a wide variety of items, such as bedspreads, curtains, tablecloths, etc. She is the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are in college, and a little one who is in primary school. For several years, Mari has worked making a variety of curtains and she says that thank GOD is has gone very well for her. When she started, she only had one machine and now she has three machines. They are very useful for doing different types of sewing. She doesn't just want to do the same thing, she has big dreams and goals of employing more people according to the demand for merchandise that is ordered from her and contribute more to her family's finances. That is why she is knocking on FAPE KIVA's door to get a new loan to buy fabrics for comforters. It will be for 5000 and with it she will get more income and earnings for her business and family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make curtains to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Rosemary. The mother of one lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has been engaged in mixed-farming for 12 years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea and other crops.

Rosemary is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She feels very passionate about dairy farming. She stated that her hobby is milking! Her biggest challenge, however, is the demanding maintenance of dairy units.

With your loan investment, she will acquire a productive cow that produces more than 10 litres of milk daily for sale. This will give her enough income to repay the loan as indicated on her repayment schedule. She will later use the additional income, after servicing the debt, to settle numerous farm-related costs. Rosemary is really excited that she has been afforded access to credit that will eventually boost her income and her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta de 40 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 5 años de edad. Es una mujer emprendedora que cada día busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia, y es por ello que decidió elaborar trapeadores, los cuales confecciona de retazos de tela desde hace 14 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos, además su compañero de vida se desempeña como albañil y es gracias a su trabajo que logra junto a Berta sostener la economía del hogar. Ella habita en casa propia desde hace 28 años por lo que se siente muy feliz, pero el piso de su vivienda y el corredor de la misma son de tierra. Por lo que ella desea encementarlo, aunque no cuenta con los fondos económicos  para ello, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda y el corredor de la misma.
texts.en: Berta is 40 years old. She lives in her own house with her life's companion and their 5 year old daughter. She is an enterprising woman who looks for the way to get her family ahead every day. That is why she decided to make mops. She has made them from fabric scraps for 14 years. She has a good quantity of customers who always seek out her products. In addition, her life's companion works as a bricklayer and thanks to his and Berta's work, they are able to support their home. She has lived in her own home for 28 years and that makes her happy. But the floor in her house and the porch are made of dirt. She wants to cement them, although she doesn't have the funds to do so. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and the porch.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor and porch of her house.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 36 years old and single without any children. She works hard to provide for herself. She runs a business by selling baby clothes in Teshie, Accra. She has been selling baby clothes for two years. Regina has requested a loan of 1,500 GHS through ID Ghana to buy more baby clothes to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from ID Ghana before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to take care of herself.

loans.use: to buy more baby clothes to sell.

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora de 59 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 son mayores de edad, con ella solo viven dos y su hija menor estudia en la escuela de la comunidad.
Además, María tiene a su cargo tres nietos y ella los apoya en sus estudios.

Ella  se dedica a la venta de antojitos desde que era joven, pues tenia que apoyar a sus padres para el sostén de los demás hermanos, además ella conoce sobre arreglos florales y lo aprendió en una capacitación, en estos momentos está elaborando arreglos que le han encargado de algunas escuelas ya que se acerca el mes de independencia, además hace decoraciones para todo tipo de fiestas, esto lo hace durante las mañanas y por las tardes sale a vender antojitos, su hija y nietos son quienes la apoyan en las diferente actividades que ella realiza.

Ella solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para su floristería, además para terminar los arreglos de independencia que le han encargado en las escuelas.

Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda y ahorrar con las ganancias de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 59 year old hard-working woman. She has six children 5 of whom are adults. Two of them live with her and her youngest daughter studies at the community school. Additionally, Maria has three grandchildren in her care and she supports them with their education.

She has been dedicated to selling snacks since she was young since she had to support her parents as well as her brothers. Additionally, she knows about flower arrangements which she learned from a training session. Right now she is making arrangements that some schools have ordered since the month of independence approaches. Also, she makes decorations for all types of parties. She does this in the mornings and, in the evenings, she goes out and sells snacks. Her daughter and grandchildren support her in the different work that she performs.

She is requesting the loan to buy the items she needs for her flower shop as well as finish the independence arrangements that the schools have ordered.

She dreams of improving her house and saving income from her work.

loans.use: to buy resources for her flower shop, as well as finish the independence arrangements that the schools have ordered.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es una mujer de 31 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos y su negocio es la venta de baterías para automóvil.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora, independiente, Fuerte, orgullosa, Buena madre, Alegre, optimista, feliz, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su Negocio lo realiza los jueves y domingos en la feria 16 de Julio, donde un universo de productos —entre usados, robados, rotos y nuevos— espera a los compradores, en las calles estrechas o en las grandes avenidas de El Alto, con un radiante sol o bajo una lluvia torrencial, caminando entre sus puestos, se puede encontrar desde una aguja hasta la pieza de un avión de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, pasando por helados de cerveza, sándwich de chorizo o muñecas que sobreviven desde la década de los 80. 
Daniela es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara, el cual ya no utiliza mucho porque se dedica al comercio y sus clientes mayormente hablan español.
