Su negocio es la venta de baterías en un pequeño puesto de venta improvisado en una de las calles de la feria, utilizando un toldo(sombrilla) y unos metros de plástico como pared, con eso se resguarda del frío, viento, sol y de la lluvia. Ella sueña mejorar su calidad de vida para darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, su deseo es incrementar el capital económico de su empresa para generar mejores ingresos económicos y poder cumplir sus sueños.
Es por esos motivos que Daniela Solicita un préstamo para la compra de baterías y con los beneficios darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Daniela, 31, is married with two children and has a business that sells car batteries.

She is an entrepreneurial, independent, strong and proud woman. She is also a good mother and is always cheerful, optimistic, happy, responsible and hardworking.

Most of her business is carried out on Thursdays and Sundays during the July Feria where many products - used, stolen, broken and new - are sold to buyers in the narrow streets and large avenues in El Alto. Come rain or shine, people walk through the stalls where you can find anything from a needle to a World War II airplane part, icy beers, sausage sandwiches and bracelets from the 80's.

Daniela is of dark complexion, with long black hair and is of medium height. Her mother tongue is Aymara, however she no longer uses this because she works with customers who primarily speak Spanish.

Her business is selling batteries in a small stand on one of the streets of the fair, using a canopy and meters of plastic as a wall to shelter them from the cold, wind, sun and rain.

Her dream is to improve her quality of life and to provide a better future for her children. She wants to increase the economic capital of the company to generate a better income to fulfill these dreams. It is for these reasons that Daniela has applied for a loan, to buy batteries and use the profits to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy batteries and use the profits for a better future for her children.

loans.name: Mauricio Salvador

texts.es: Mauricio de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y sus 4 hermanos. Él es un hombre que demuestra su responsabilidad al apoyar a su madre económicamente, gracias a su trabajo en una panadería donde se elabora diversidad de panes tanto pan francés como pan dulce como: novias,  maría luisa, cachitos, etc.  Mauricio habita en su casa desde hace 40 años junto a su madre por lo que se siente muy agradecido de contar con un lugar donde vivir, pero el techo de su casa se encuentra deteriorado por lo que él desea cambiarlo, ya que la lluvia está deteriorando sus pertenencias y las de su familia. Por lo anterior Mauricio solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Mauricio, 43, lives in his own house along with his mother and his four brothers. He is a man who has demonstrated responsibility by supporting his mother financially thanks to his work in a bakery where he makes a variety of breads such as french bread and pastries like wedding cakes, Maria Luisa cake, and cachitos (stuffed croissants). Mauricio has lived in his house for forty years along with his mother. He feels very thankful to have a place to live but the roof on his house has deteriorated so he wishes to change it since the rain is damaging his and his family's belongings. Therefore Mauricio is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheets, joists, and lumber to change the roof on his house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, joists and lumber to change the roof on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock like vegetables, grains, fruits to stock her business and improve her offerings.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.es:
Eladia tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija que ya es mayor de edad.

Eladia se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, además a la elaboración de petates, estas actividades las aprendió de sus padres desde muy joven, además se dedica a vender productos de lencerías, perfumes, cremas y otros productos de belleza, para comprar mercadería ella debe caminar por veredas y luego tomar el bus que le conduce hasta su destino.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, pagar el alquiler del terreno donde sembrará maíz y frijol, comprará dos cerdos, materia prima para petates y comprará productos de belleza.

Ella sueña con comprar un terreno para construir una vivienda agradable.
texts.en:
Eladia is 49 years old. She's married and has an adult daughter.

Eladia is dedicated to planting maize and beans as well as making bedrolls. She learned these activities from her parents when she was very young. She is also dedicated to selling lingerie, perfumes, creams and other beauty products. In order to buy merchandise, she has to walk paths and then take a bus that drives her to her destination.

She is requesting this loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers, to pay to rent the land where she will plant maize and beans, and to buy two pigs, raw material for bedrolls and beauty products.

She dreams of buying land to construct a nice house.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers, to pay to rent the land where she grows maize and beans, and to buy two pigs, raw material for bedrolls and  beauty products.

loans.name: Faty's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 femmes, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 18 septembre 2010. Ce dernier regroupe des membres du même village et ceux des environs.
Makhe debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de enfants dont 2 filles.
Avec le prêt, elle envisage faire du commerce. Elle va acheter des sacs d’arachide, du riz, des bidons d’huile et tenir une petite boutique.
Avec les bénéfices, elle comte épargner et participer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: This 28-woman group is affiliated with the banc villageois which was created on 18th September 2010. The members of this banc villageois reside in the same village and in its surrounding areas. Makhe, the woman standing to the far right with her hand raised, is 36 years old. She is a married mother to two daughters. She is planning on using this loan to go into business for herself. She will purchase some sacks of peanuts and rice, as well as some cans of oil, so that she can run a small stall. She is planning on using the profits from this venture to contribute to her savings and her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and peanuts

loans.name: Silupe

texts.en: Silupe is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells a variety of foods in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Silupe needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a sack of potatoes, a bag of salt, paper cups, roll paper for chips, packets of curry and a bag of rice. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Silupe has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a sack of potatoes, a bag of salt, paper cups, roll paper for chips, packets of curry and a bag of rice for her food production business.

loans.name: Yirley Paola

texts.es:
Yirley es una joven de 23 años de edad muy juiciosa y con gran gusto por el ahorro, es madre de un hijo de 6 años de edad y productos de sus ahorros quiere invertirlo y crear en su zona residencial un espacio de diversión  para niños, jóvenes y adultos ya que quiere montar un café internet pero con videojuegos. 
La idea nació ante la posibilidad de montar un negocio donde niños puedan acceder a juegos que no pueden tener en su casa pro el alto costo y para Yirley será lucrativo y les podría dar un lugar donde acudir y socializarse para alejarse de las bandas, de sustancias que generen adicción etc. 

Con sus ahorros logro comprar tres consolas de videojuegos y televisores para jugar pero quiere complementar su servicios con una sal de internet pero su capital no es suficiente para cubrir estos gastos, por tal razón solicita un crédito para comprar dos computadores e iniciar su negocio formalmente. 

Su sueño es tener un negocio muy prospero un negocio donde ronde la risa y al alegría de los niños que la única preocupación sea que su tiempo esté a punto de terminar y poder generar empleos.
texts.en:
Yirley is a very judicious, young 23 year old with a great liking for saving. She is mother to a six year old son and she wants to invest her savings and create in her home a fun space for children and adults since she wants to start an internet cafe but with videogames.

The idea was born with the possibility of starting a business where children could play with games that they cannot have at home due to the high cost and for Yirley it will be lucrative and give them a place where they can go and socialize away from gangs and substances that create addiction etc.

With her savings, she managed to buy three video game consoles and televisions but she wants to complement her services with an internet lounge but her capital is not sufficient to cover these expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy two computers and formally start her business.

Her dream is to have a very prosperous business, a business where she is surrounded by laughter and happiness of children and the only worry is when their time is going to end and that she can create jobs.

loans.use: to buy two computers to start her internet cafe and videogame lounge business.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 30 femmes, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 18 septembre 2010. Ce dernier regroupe des membres du même village et ceux des environs.
Nianga, est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 filles et en charge une autre fille. Sur la photo, elle est en position debout et a levé la main. 
Avec le prêt, elle envisage faire du commerce et de l’embouche. Elle va acheter quelques brebis et après élevage revendre. Elle va aussi acheter des bidons d’huile et divers autres produits alimentaires.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne au niveau du banc et une prise en charge personnelle.
texts.en: This 30-woman group is affiliated with the banc villageois which was created on 18th September 2010. The members of this banc villageois reside in the same village and in its surrounding areas. Nianga, the woman standing to the far right with her hand raised, is 44 years old. She is a married mother to two daughters and also has another girl living under her care. She is planning on using this loan for a retail business and livestock farming. She wants to purchase a couple of ewes, then once they've been raised, she will sell them. She also wants to purchase some cans of oil and various other foodstuffs. These profits will allow her to contribute to her savings with the banc and her own daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase two ewes, oil and various foodstuffs

loans.name: Nancy Judith

texts.es: A Nancy de 36 años de edad, nunca se le ha olvidado como su madre, confeccionista, le enseñó a cortar la prenda, prepararla, ensamblarla y venderla; por eso hoy, en el marco de generar ingresos que apoyen el sustento de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge  sus 3 hijos en las edades de 2 a 13 años,   se dedica a la confección de ropa y también vende mercancía variada, que la misma clientela de vestidos le solicitan.  Sus principales productos son las bermudas, pantalonetas, camisas, suéteres etc.  los cuales vende a crédito y de contado,  en los diferentes barrios del municipio donde habita, trabajando diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su meta más adelante es modernizar su taller con maquinarias y equipos, ampliando mas su estructura técnica. Su meta mas adelante, es llevar a sus hijos  a ser profesionales, pero la falta de recursos es su mayor desafío, para llevar a cabo sus sueños de prosperidad. Nancy hoy en dia se ha interesado en los credikivas de  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y está aplicando a su primer financiamiento mediante el cual comprará una fileteadora, maquinaria que dará un mejor acabado a sus prendas y también comprará materias primas como telas en mayor volumen. Con esta inversión impactará positivamente la calidad de sus productos, con lo cual mejora sustancialmente su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy, 36, has never forgotten how her mother, a clothing manufacturer, taught her to cut, prepare, assemble and sell garments. Today, to generate revenue to support her husband and her 3 children aged between 2 and 13 years old, she makes clothes and also sells assorted merchandise that her clients request.

Her main products are bermudas, shorts, shirts, sweaters etc. which she sells on credit or cash in different areas of the town where she lives, working daily from 8am to 6pm. Her goal is to modernise the workshop with machinery and equipment, expanding the technical features. Her next goal is to help her children get a good job, however the lack of resources is the biggest challenge she has to overcome to meet these goals.

Nancy is interested in the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and is applying for her first loan through this to buy machinery that will give her garments a better finish and to buy raw materials such as fabrics in bulk. This investment will impact the quality of her products positively, thereby substantially improving her business.

loans.use: to buy machinery and raw materials such as fabrics in bulk.

loans.name: Atalani

texts.en: Atalani is 20 years old and single with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Atalani needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Atalani will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade for her farming activity.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr:
Cette femme, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 18 septembre 2010. Ce dernier regroupe des membres du même village et ceux des environs.
Elle est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 2 filles et 3 garçons. Elle fait comme activité le commerce et l’embouche ovine qui génèrent des revenus.
Ainsi avec le prêt elle va acheter des moutons et les revendre après élevage. Elle achète aussi des légumes; du lait, elle se rend dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour écouler ses produits.
Les bénéfices sont utilisés  pour renforcer son épargne et participer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: Dieynaba is affiliated with the banc villageois which was created on 18th September 2010. The members of this banc villageois reside in the same village and in its surrounding areas. Dieynaba is a 54-year-old married mother to three sons and two daughters. She earns a living through retail and raising livestock. She wants to use this loan to purchase five sheep, then once they've been raised, she will sell them. She also wants to purchase vegetables and milk, which she will then resell at the weekly markets. These profits will allow her to contribute towards her savings and pay for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep, milk and vegetables

loans.name: Olataga

texts.en: Olataga is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Olataga needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter, and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Olataga has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove for her bakery business.

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en: Luafulu is 62 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for nine years. Luafulu needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new tiller, a crowbar, sprayers, a machete and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Luafulu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new tiller, a crowbar, sprayers, a machete and new boots for her farming activity.

loans.name: Tepatasi

texts.en: Tepatasi is 27 years old and single with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Tepatasi needs a loan to buy a rake, weed killer chemicals, fertilizer, chicken manure, sprayers and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Tepatasi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a rake, weed killer chemicals, fertilizer, chicken manure, sprayers and new overalls for her farming activity.

loans.name: Leataataoleaniva

texts.en: Leataataoleaniva is a 20-year-old unmarried woman with 1 child. She makes and sells chicken pies in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Leataataoleaniva needs a loan to buy boneless chicken, soya sauce, yeast, bags of flour, cooking oil, a new oven and a large frying pan. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Leataataoleaniva has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy boneless chicken, soya sauce, yeast, bags of flour, cooking oil, a new oven and a large frying pan

loans.name: Ato

texts.en: Ato, 35, is divorced with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 6 years. Ato needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a machete, gloves, new boots, new overalls, chemicals, a spade and sprayers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Ato will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a machete, gloves, new boots, new overalls, chemicals, a spade and sprayers.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia, 54, is unmarried with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Telesia needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new overalls and a new sprayer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Telesia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new overalls and a new sprayer

loans.name: Savali

texts.en: Savali is 46 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for nine years. Savali needs a loan to buy a new freezer chest, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sack of onions, sack of potatoes and a bag of sugar. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2005 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer chest, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sack of onions, sack of potatoes and a bag of sugar for her general store.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 49 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Annabelle has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Annabelle has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Marta Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marta tiene 40 años de edad, no estudió pues sus padres no tenían los recursos para mandarla a la escuela, está soltera y tiene 3 hijos, dos de sus hijos trabajan en un taller mecánico y su hija le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar, Marta vive con sus hijos en casa de su madre.

Marta trabaja vendiendo ropa, verduras y antojitos, aprendió este oficio gracias a una de sus tías que la motivó a emprender este negocio para que sacara adelante a sus hijos. 
Marta sale a vender tres días a la semana en la comunidad y muchas veces lo hace en compañía de su hija.

Marta necesita mucho de este crédito para pagar un préstamo que le hizo su hermana, ese dinero lo ocupó para reparar su vivienda ya que era invierno y el techo estaba en mal estado, además comprará frutas y verduras y el resto para comprar ropa para todas las edades y así salir a vender a la comunidad y lugares cercanos.

Marta sueña con hacer una casa para sus hijos ya que la casa donde reside es de su madre, además pretende seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Marta is 40 years old and never studied as her parents didn't have the resources to send her to school. She is single and has three children. Two of her children work in a mechanical workshop and her daughter helps her with the housework. Marta lives with her children in a house made out of wood.

Marta works selling clothing, vegetables and snacks. She learned this trade from one of her aunts and she was motivated to start this business to get ahead with her children. Marta goes out to sell three days a week in her community and many times is accompanied by her daughter.

Marta needs much of this loan to pay off a loan her sister gave her. She used this money to repair her house as it was winter and the roof was in bad shape. She will also buy fruit and vegetables and with the rest buy clothing fro all ages and go out in her community and neighboring communities to sell. Marta dreams of building a house for her children as the house where they live is made of wood and she wants to continue supporting her children in their studies.

loans.use: to pay off a loan from her sister and to buy fruit and vegetables and the rest to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER LA RINCONADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina ella es soltera y tiene 66 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
Los socios que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo las fotos despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members of this group belong to the communal bank “NUEVO AMANECER LA RINCONADA”. This bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco. Bernardina is one of the members. She is 66 years old, single and has two children. She works in the business of selling and raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens, which she raises and fattens. Afterwards, she sells them at different fairs. Through this small business she is moving her children ahead. Her dream is to have a store, from where she can sell the guinea pigs and chickens. The members who are shown on attached pictures to the group picture had their pictures taken after the meeting, because they asked for permission due to work obligations. The other members work selling sweets, clothing, and in the business of grocery stores and restaurants. Bernardina is grateful to those who take part of this dream, and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens, and the food for guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Sulma Azucena

texts.es: Sulma de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos una niña de 15 años de edad y dos varones de 10 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer  que todos los días demuestra su tenacidad para sacar adelante a su familia, y es por ello que decidió trabajar como vendedora en un local de lácteos donde atiende a los clientes que buscan productos como: queso fresco, requesón queso duro, crema, cuajada, etc.  Además su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo de motorista. Sulma habita en su vivienda desde hace 3 años, por lo que se encuentra feliz, pero su vivienda carece de un corredor donde ella pueda hacer sus quehaceres de cómo lavar su ropa, lavar los trastes, y algunos otros oficios necesarios en un hogar, por lo que ella desea construir un corredor en su vivienda, que cuente con techo y el piso encementado, pero no cuenta con el dinero para hacerlo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, polines, pines, tubos de hierro y lamina para construir un corredor en su vivienda.
texts.en: Sulma, 31, lives in her own house along with her spouse and their three children, a 15 year old girl and two boys, 10 and 2. She is a woman who, everyday, shows her tenacity to get her family ahead and it is for this that she decided to work as a vendor in a dairy shop where she tends to customers who are looking for products like fresh cheese, cottage cheese, cream, curd, etc. Additionally, her spouse supports the family thanks to his work as a driver. Sulma has lived in her house happily for three years but her house lacks a corridor where she can do her housework like washing clothes, washing dishes and some other necessary housework. So she wishes to construct a corridor in her house which needs a roof and a cement floor but she does not have the money to do so so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, joists, lumber, iron pipes and sheets to build a corridor in her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, joists, lumber, iron pipes and sheets to build a corridor in her house.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 36 years old, married, and has three children, who are all in school.

Mary Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from rice retailing. 

Mary Joy requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Mary Joy aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to secure all necessary licenses and software to get her business started.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is 44 years old and single with no children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. 

Malia needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Malia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 68 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rizalina has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 14 years.

Rizalina requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Rizalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Making piñatas started off as a way for Marcela to earn some income, while staying home with her four sons. “I make piñatas that are stars with different designs in the front, it can be bigger or smaller,” Marcela said. “I do numbers, balls, hearts, a great variety. It was a great way to work from home.”

Demand for her piñatas grew steadily and when her youngest started school, Marcela expanded her business and opened her own store in Grand Prairie, Texas last year: City Piñatas. Marcela’s grand vision has been to have City Piñatas be a one-stop party supply store, where customers can buy piñatas, the candies that go into the piñatas, rent tables and chairs, buy plates, napkins, table cloths and other party items. “I am going to do everything you need to do a party supply store, and so I needed money for the merchandise,” Marcela said.

When she opened her business’s bank account, she inquired about a loan, and her banker referred her to Accion Texas. “He told me that there was a program called Accion Texas that I could go to that would help me expand and strengthen my business,” Marcela said. 

Marcela will be using her loan to buy the supplies and the equipment that she needs to expand her piñata business into a full-service party supply store.
“It has been a great source of hope to discover Accion Texas, because they are helping me realize my dream,” Marcela said. “To make my dream come true, I need support to go forward. I can work really hard, but I can’t grow, because I need support. I will have the supplies that I need to grow my business and serve more people. But without the investment of this loan, I can’t grow. You can have a car, but without the gas, you can’t go anywhere.”

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment to expand her business's offerings.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia never dreamed of opening her own daycare. With over 20 years of experience in the field of child care, she spent the last 10 years working as the director of a local daycare center in Laredo, Texas. “God gave me a vision,” Olivia said. 

Olivia resigned from her director position at the local daycare and began working on opening her own facility, Holy Hands Learning Center. “I stepped out on faith and watched God work everything out for me,” she said. 

Her center serves children ranging in age from newborn to 12 years. The younger children receiving child care are taught the alphabet, numbers, shapes and colors. The center’s main goal is to prepare children to receive a head start on their education. The after school program is designed to help them successfully complete their homework and gives them the support they need to complete difficult assignments. Since opening last month, Olivia has taken on 32 clients for her learning center and is excited about the growth her business has experienced.  She currently employs two teachers and hopes to hire more in the near future. 

“I am so blessed that I have my family behind me supporting my every move,” Olivia said. “This is where I can see God moving in my life.” Olivia came to Accion Texas Inc. because of the wonderful things she heard about the organization. She needs funding for her new alarm system and for additional educational materials. “It has only been one month since we’ve opened and I can only see things getting better from here,” Olivia said.

loans.use: to pay for a new alarm system and educational supplies.

loans.name: Jonaly

texts.en:
Jonaly is 40 years old, married, and has seven children. Three of her children are in school.

Jonaly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing. 

Jonaly requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan.

Jonaly aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 48 years old, married, and has five children.

Lucita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Lucita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lucita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Lucita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Neysa

texts.en:
Neysa’s business runs on creating timeless memories for her clients. “Our goal is to make our events tell a story about our customer,” Neysa said. “Luxuré Decor is a full service design company that specializes in providing clients with a wonderful experience.”

She started decorating as a hobby from home two years ago. Neysa enjoyed planning events for her family and friends and created custom pieces for each event. Throughout the course of developing her craft, she decided to turn her hobby into a career. “My decor business is based on three things: vision, design and presentation,” Neysa said. “When all the pieces come together, it’s a wonderful sight to see everyone marveling at what we’ve created.”

Luxuré Decor offers specialized packages catering to the budget and style preferences of clients. She gives her clients a taste of luxury at a reasonable price. From centerpieces to program styles, Neysa says her team utilizes their talents to form one-of-a-kind creations that are truly awe inspiring. Her business is in its first few months of operation and she is currently working to increase her customer base and create marketing materials.  After building a stronger client list, Neysa would like to hire two designers to help her with new concepts for design packages. 

“This all began from a simple hobby,” Neysa said. “My ultimate dream is to turn Luxuré Decor into a retail brand.” She came to Accion Texas to help fund her new website, company flyers, and business cards. In the next year, Neysa would like to open a storefront business. For now, Neysa is focused on building her brand.

loans.use: to pay for marketing materials such as flyers, her website and business cards.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. 

She has been operating her own house-rental business for 15 years, and she earns well from this. To improve her profit, Nimfa would like to apply for a new loan for the maintenance of the boarding house. An amount of PHP 50,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place so that they could attract more boarders. She will also use the loan to add to the capital needed for her canteen business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her two children. The couple had to work hard, with the determination of having better income to provide their children with better education, which they don't currently have. 

In the future, Nimfa wants to manage a farming business or a piggery. She dreams of contentment in life by the grace of God. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* group members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micrfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her rental apartment and capitalize her canteen business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita operates a buy-and-sell business. She buys biscuits from a wholesaler and then sells them to customers for a profit. She is thankful that she was previously granted a PHP 50,000 which she used as her capital. She successfully repaid her loan. She also derives additional income from her rental apartment to meet her family's daily basic needs.

She would like now to request for a PHP 15,000 loan for the maintenance of her apartment so her tenants will stay longer. Mercedita now appears in her photo at her buy-and-sell biscuit business.   
 


Mercedita dreams of a continuous success of her business and hopes that her family will always be in a good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her rental apartment

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 43 years old and married. She has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Madeline has a business selling glass and aluminum in the Philippines. Madeline has been in this business for five years. 

Madeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of aluminum and glass for her business.

In the future, Madeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of aluminum and glass for her business.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 58 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school. Amy works very hard to provide for them.

Amy runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.  

Amy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

In the future, Amy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Barcelisa

texts.en:
Barcelisa is 68 years old and married. She has five children.

Barcelisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 35 years and also earns an income from food-vending and clothing-sales businesses.

Barcelisa requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Barcelisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 66-years-old and married with four children.

Ninfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, spices and other groceries.

Ninfa has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thirty years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Ninfa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 47-years-old and married with one child who is in school.

Shirly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Shirly has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Shirly aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for four years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Genalyn would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 50,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Genalyn hopes that her variety store will soon become a convenience store. She also wants her family to have a stable source of income. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she is doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 53 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied a loan to pay for redemption of her pawned coconut land. In the future, Adelia wishes to become a supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for redemption of her pawned coconut land

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Erlinda is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mery

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mery works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a bakery and a general store businesses. Mery is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Mery has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jesselinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Jesselinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Jesselinda is borrowing 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Jesselinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Santa Isabel Visitacion Group

texts.en:
Lorenza is married and has five children who attend school. She and her husband are both teachers in the local school, where her children are able to receive an education. In addition to her teaching and motherly duties, Lorenza has been running a business that distributes various textiles for 15 years and has slowly expanded it to include five employees. 

Lorenza requested a loan, which she will use to expand her textile business to other areas around Lake Atitlán, increase the wages for her employees, and possibly hire additional employees. Lorenza is the president of the Santa Isabel trust bank in the town of Santa María. The group has been together for five years and currently includes eight members. The women in the group have varying levels of education. The businesses of the Santa Isabel members are diverse, from raising chicken to selling corn and beans to running daily consumption stores.

loans.use: to purchase textiles to sell

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia continua con su negocio de hospedaje, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colchones entre otros.
texts.en:
The member continues working in the lodging business.  She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments.  She has had her business for a long time and it's both financially and personally satisfying for her.  She wants to be able to keep on working to support her family.

She's requesting the loan to buy mattresses, among other things.

loans.use: to buy mattresses and other things

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 14 años de edad, su madre y sus 2 hermanos. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante ella sola a su hijo, apoyándose en su trabajo de maestra, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años. Consuelo desea comprar cuatro puertas para su vivienda y laminas para reparar el baño, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cuatro puertas, lamina, madera y pagar mano de obra para colocar las puertas y reparar el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Consuelo, age 41, lives in her own house with her 14 year old son, her mother, and her two sisters.  She is a woman who, thanks to her tenacity, has managed, by herself, to get her son ahead through her work as a teacher.  She has been teaching for eight years.

Consuelo wishes to buy four doors for her house and sheet metal to repair the bathroom.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy four doors, sheet metal, and wood.  She will also pay for the labor to place the doors and to repair the bathroom at her house.

loans.use: to buy four doors, sheet metal, and wood and to pay for the labor to place the doors and to repair the bathroom.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Парвизу 18 лет. Он в этом сентябре поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Он теперь является студентом 1 курса факультета Менеджмента. Парвиз окончил среднюю школу с хорошими оценками. Парвиз читает много книг. Он с детства мечтал получить высшее образование и служить своей Родине. Парвиз не женат и живет с родителями. Его родители не имеют денег, чтобы оплатить за его учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Parviz is 18 years old. This September, he enrolled in Tajik State University of Commerce. Now he is a  first-year student in the Management Department. Parviz graduated from secondary school with good grades. Parviz reads a lot of books. Since childhood, he has dreamed of receiving a higher education and serving his country. Parviz is unmarried and lives with his parents. His parents don't have money needed to pay for his university tuition. He is requesting a loan for 1100 USD to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Rodivico

texts.en:
Rodivico is a businessman from Villa Consuelo, Ozamiz City, Philippines. His wife is a government employee. They are blessed with two children. Because it is hard for them to survive if only his wife is working, he decided to engage himself in a sari-sari (mini-grocery) store with a capital of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). Their primary customers are their neighbors. Successfully, he was able to manage it well, and able to finance the daily needs of his family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, which he became a member of in April 2005. He was able to avail himself of three loans and paid them religiously. 

Now, he applies for a loan of 40,000 PHP to finance the repair of his motor-cab that primarily supports his store for easy transport and delivery. He is looking forward to expanding his sari-sari into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to finance the repair of his motor-cab that primarily supports his store for transport and delivery

loans.name: Faalaeiau

texts.en:
Faalaeiau is a 30-year-old unwed woman with 3 children. She has a small farm where she raises cattle which she can sell in her community or to the public. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Faalaeiau needs a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, large iron poles, bush knives and new gum boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Faalaeiau will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, large iron poles, bush knives and new gum boots.

loans.name: Vailetai

texts.en:
Vailetai is a 28-year-old unmarried woman with 3 children. To earn a living, she runs a small bakery in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Vailetai needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, yeast, icing sugar, custard, cinnamon powder, trays, plastic bags and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Vailetai has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, yeast, icing sugar, custard, cinnamon powder, trays, plastic bags and a large stove.

loans.name: Orquideas Santiago Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Orquideas Santiago” (Orchids of Santiago), is located on the shores of Lake Atitlan in the city of Santiago Atitlan.  The group is composed of nine hard-working women, the majority of whom have never attended school.  They primarily speak the Maya language Tz’utujil.  Although they lack a formal education, these women have succeeded in managing their businesses, providing income support for their families. 

Elizabeth is the group’s treasurer.  She is 45 years old, married, and has five children.  Elizabeth’s business is preparing and selling food, principally Santiago Atitlan’s typical dish “Patin,” which she sells four days a week.  She and her husband are partners, preparing the food and then selling it on the street.  

Elizabeth requested a loan, which she will use to buy more raw material including beef, fish, tomatoes, leaves to wrap the food in, as well as other necessary items.  Her income has helped give their children an education.

Along with Elizabeth, the other eight women of “Orquideas Santiago” have completed a few loan cycles with Friendship Bridge.  These loans have helped increase their small businesses.  They are extremely grateful for the support of Friendship Bridge and its partnership with Kiva investors.  The combination has already had a huge impact on the Guatemalan women.

loans.use: to buy more raw material including beef, fish, tomatoes, leaves to wrap the food in, as well as other necessary items

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai is 59 years old and married with 8 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Faafetai needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, a spade, new boots, gloves and a new machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Faafetai will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, a spade, new boots, gloves and a new machete

loans.name: Aigamanu

texts.en: Aigamanu is a 30-year-old unmarried woman with 6 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Aigamanu needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Aigamanu has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups

loans.name: Me

texts.en: Me is a 71-year-old married woman with 5 children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Me needs a loan to buy bags of bags of sugar, flour, baking trays, plastic bags, a new stove and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Me has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of bags of sugar, flour, baking trays, plastic bags, a new stove and yeast

loans.name: Amilani

texts.en: Amilani is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Amilani needs a loan to buy spades, bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, shovels, gloves and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Amilani will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy spades, bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, shovels, gloves and new overalls

loans.name: Faapala

texts.en: Faapala is 35 years old and single with 1 child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Faapala needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a sprayer, new boots, a machete and a new wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Faapala will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a sprayer, new boots, a machete and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Tiesi

texts.en: Tiesi is a 52-year-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 6 years of experience with this business. Tiesi needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, yeast and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tiesi has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, yeast and paper plates

loans.name: Sulieti

texts.en: Sulieti is 58 years old and married with 9 children. She has a small plantation where she grows cocoa trees to get cocoa beans that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 9 years. Sulieti needs a loan to buy a large outdoor oven, sprayers, rolls of plastic bags, foam cups, gloves and large baskets. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Sulieti will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a large outdoor oven, sprayers, rolls of plastic bags, foam cups, gloves and large baskets

loans.name: Gregoria Hortensia

texts.es: Gregoria de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, desde hace varios años ella posee una tienda ubicada en su casa, tiene varios clientes que la buscan por los productos y los buenos precios, con sus ventas logra solventar algunos gasto de su hogar,  ella solicita un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, huevos, leche, refrescos, pan dulce, golosinas, etc.  y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 47, lives in her own house with her family.

She has had a store in her home for several years.  She has a variety of customers who look for products at good prices.  She manages to pay some of her household expenses with her sales.

Gregoria's requesting a loan to buy basic grains, eggs, milk, soft drinks, pan dulce [sweet baked goods], snacks, and so on.  That way she and her family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, milk, soft drinks, baked goods, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 62 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus dos hijos de 19 y 21 años de edad, además viven con ella su yerno y su nieto.  Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos desde hace 15 años. Juana adquirió un crédito con FUSAI con el cual cambió el techo y le compro balcones a la ventanas de su vivienda, y ahora desea comprar dos puertas, reparar la pila y comprar teja para reforzar el techo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: dos puertas, cemento, arena y tejas para colocar dos puertas, reparar la pila y reforzar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana, 62, is a single mother who lives with her two children, aged 19 and 21, in a house of her own. Her son-in-law and grandson live also with her. Juana is a hardworking woman who has worked as a housekeeper for fifteen years.

Juana received a loan from FUSAI and used it to change the roof and buy bars to protect the windows. Now, she wants to buy two doors, repair a sink and buy roof tiles to reinforce the roof. She is requesting a loan at FUSAI to buy two doors, cement, sand and roof tiles.

loans.use: to buy two doors, cement, sand and roof tiles.

loans.name: Malae

texts.en: Malae is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Malae needs a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller and crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Malae will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller and crowbar

loans.name: Sorbon

texts.ru: Сорбону 21 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями и 2 братьями. Сорбон отлично учился в школе и после окончания средней школы он поступил в Национальный Университет Таджикистана. Данное время он является студентом 4 курса. Его родители имеют доход от выращивания пшеницы и картошки, а также они занимается скотоводством. Сорбон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sorbon is 21 years old. He is unmarried and lives with his parents and two brothers. Sorbon did very well in secondary school and after graduating, enrolled in the National University of Tajikistan. He is currently a fourth-year student. His parents have an income from growing wheat and potatoes. They also practice cattle breeding. Sorbon needs to pay for his university tuition but he does not have the money. He is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a hardworking entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. He is 42 years old, and has children. He oversees the operation of their tricycle unit, and his income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

He owns and drives one tricycle unit (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until wee hours in order to have bigger profits. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in his transportation business every day.

Bernardo is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan assistance to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of his family.

In the future, he hopes that his business will continue to operate. He also dreams to have another tricycle unit. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their motorcycle unit.

loans.name: Nurkhon

texts.ru: Нурхон 47-летний житель района Фархор. Он в течение 5 лет работает кредитным менеджером в микрокредитной организации. Его жена учительница, а сын и дочь являются студентами. Сын Нурхон учится в Государственном коммерческом университете Таджикистана. Сейчас его родители должны оплатить за новый учебный год. Сумма его контракта составляет 1100 долларов США. Нурхон просит кредит в размере 1400 долларов США. За счет этой суммы он оплатит контракт сына, а также купит ему за 300 долларов ноутбук для учебы. Этот кредит важен их семье, так как его сын сможет продолжить учебу в ВУЗе.
texts.en: Nurkhon is a 47-year-old resident of the Farkhor District. For the past 5 years, he has worked as a loan manager at a micro-lending organization. His wife is a teacher and his son and daughter are students. Nurkhon's son studies at the Tajik State University of Commerce. Nurkhon and his wife need to pay for their son's university tuition. This year's tuition is 1100 USD. Nurkhon is requesting a loan for 1400 USD. With this money, he will pay for his son's tuition as well as buy him a 300 USD laptop for his studies. This loan is very important to this family, as their son will be able to continue his university education.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition and to buy him a laptop.

loans.name: Asliah

texts.en:
Asliah has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own retail business of shades, watches and other products. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Asliah would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional merchandise to sell. With 10,000 PHP, she could purchase more items like shades, watches, and other products needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Asliah hopes to grow and expand her business more. She also wants for her two children to complete  their studies and she aspires to finally have their own house and even a small place for them will do. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different products like shades, watches, and other items to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to do carpentry and raise animals

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been a water distributor in her community for years and she earns well from this. She covers all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the goal of having better income.

To improve sales, Emma would like to apply for a new loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water. With PHP 10,000, she could already improve her business and her profit from it. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Emma hopes to have a bigger water station. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of mineral water products needed in her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 28 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Catherine needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, a machete, a new wheelbarrow, and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Catherine will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, a machete, a new wheelbarrow, and new boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk for women, men and children.

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam is 46 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She sells assorted goods to earn a living, and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. 

Merriam has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to pay her children's tuition fees and to save more in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Endrio

texts.en: Endrio is a farmer from Molave. He became a member with PMPC for his farming activities. He took several loans in the past and made prompt payments with no records of default. He has now availed another loan for the next cropping season for land and seedbed preparation. Endrio perseveres and always believes in reaching his goals so that he can continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Ma. Hermalyn

texts.en:
Ma. Hermalyn is single, and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from raising ducks. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. 

In the future, Ma. Hermalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: Pélagie a 44 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants à Adidogomé. Elle fait le petit commerce en vendant des pagnes. Elle s'approvisionne 3 fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans son atelier à son domicile. Pélagie sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Pélagie is 44 years old, married and mother to two children in Adidogomé. She has a small business selling "pagnes" (highly colorful pieces of fabric). She gets her supplies three times a month in Lomé's Grand Market and resells them in her workshop at home. She is requesting this loan to expand her business and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy nine pieces of "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elena works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising ducks. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Tiaina

texts.en:
Tiaina is 23 years old and unmarried with 1 child. She owns and operates a small store selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Tiaina needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her child's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 19 year old unmarried woman with 1 child. She makes and sells barbeque food in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Anita needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, soya sauce, potatoes, mayonnaise, paper plates and tomato sauce. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Anita has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 69 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She is a farmer who grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Victorina has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor expenses. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor expenses

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 68 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. To earn a living, she has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Purita  has requested a loan to buy needed ingredients for her snack vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she would like to improve and expand her business and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy needed ingredients

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a rice retail in Talairon, Oroquieta City and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up her membership with PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. She has now availed a loan to purchase more rice to sell. Daylinda hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Erene

texts.en:
Erene is 39 years old, married and has four children. Two of her children are in school.

Erene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Erene requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Erene has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain this activity.

In the future, Erene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ameyo-

texts.fr: Ameyo a 44 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants à Adidogomé. Elle fait le petit commerce en vendant des jus. Elle s'approvisionne 1 fois par mois au marché assiyéyé et revend ambulante  aux marchés environnants . Ameyosollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Ameyo, who is 44 years old and lives in Adidogomé, is a widow with two children. She has a small business selling juices and gets her supplies once a month at the market in Assiyéyé. She resells wandering around the surrounding markets. Ameyo is requesting this loan so she can expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 70 baskets of fruit.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 41 ans  Abla est mariée et mère de 4 enfants  résidant à d'Adidogomé. Elle  a commencé son petit commerce en  vendant des mêches et des tissages associer son activité de coiffeuse. Elles'approvisionne 2 fois par mois grand marché de Lomé et revend dans un boutique à à son domicile.  Abla sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Abla, who lives in Adidogomé, is 41 years old, married and mother to four children. She began her small business by selling hair extensions and hair weaves alongside her hairdressing activity. She gets her supplies twice a month at Lomé's Grand Market and resells them in a shop in her home. Abla is requesting a loan so that she can expand her business, satisfy her customer demand and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy three dozen hair extensions and hair weaves.

loans.name: Mami

texts.fr: mariée et mère de 2 enfants à 41 ans, Mami réside à Adidogomé. Elle vend des  charbon de bois. Elle achète s'approvisionne 1 fois par mois chez les grossistes. Elle revend en détail à  son domicile. Mami sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Mami, who is 41 years old and lives in Adidogomé, is married and mother to two children. She sells charcoal and gets her supplies once a month from wholesalers. She resells on a retail basis from her home. Mami is requesting this loan so she can expand her business, satisfy customer demand and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 44 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Raihan

texts.ru: Райхан 58 лет, не замужем, мать 2 дочерей. Образование- средне-специальное, с 2009 года работает в больнице санитаркой. На сегодняшний день ее доход составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Райхан начала делать ремонт в своей квартире, однако для его завершения не хватает средств, поэтому она и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Ремонт позволит Райхан улучшить условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Raihan is 58 years old, unmarried and a mother to two daughters. She has a secondary-specialized education. Since 2009, she has been working in a hospital as a janitor. Today, her income is about 8000 som (KGS) per month. Raihan started to make repairs on her apartment, however she does not have enough money to complete them. This is why she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan. The repairs will allow Raihan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her apartment in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 52 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,000 doing this type of work. 

Rosalinda has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities. She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, she hopes to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 66 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more bananas to sell.

Nenita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase bananas

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
_ -   
mariée et mère d' un enfant à 24 ans, Afi réside à Adidogomé. Elle vend des  produits d'alimentation générale. Elle achète s'approvisionne 4 fois par mois à grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend sous un hangar à au marché d'assiyéyé. Afi sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Afi, who is 24 years old and lives in Adidogomé, is married and mother to one child. She sells groceries and gets her supplies four times a month at Lomé's Grand Market. She resells in a shed at the market in Assiyéyé. Afi is requesting this loan so she can expand her business, satisfy customer demand and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy six cartons of soaps and spaghetti.

loans.name: Eli Samuel

texts.es: Eli, tiene 26 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo, reside en una aldea de La Másica, Atlántida.  Hace 5 años realiza su propia actividad  de generación de ingresos, tiene un centro de grabación y video en su casa donde ofrece los servicios de grabación de  música, producción de videos, y reproducción de discos. Toda la música es cristiana y la vende en la misma comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es por 12,000 lempiras y  lo invertirá en la compra de discos, sobres de discos, tintas para impresoras y otros  materiales que necesita para  sacar un pedido que tiene en proceso.  Su plan es  mejorar el negocio y sacar adelante su familia.
texts.en:
Eli is 26 years old and lives in a common-law marriage and has a son. He lives in a village called La Másica, in Atlántida. Five years ago, he opened a recording studio at home. He offers sound recording, and video and music production. He works with  Christian music and he sells it to locals.

Eli is requesting a loan of 12,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy blank discs, disc cases, ink for his printers, and other supplies he needs to fulfill an order. His plan is to improve his business and make headway with his family.

loans.use: to buy blank discs, disc cases, ink for his printers and other supplies to record music.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
_ -
Agée de 48 ans  Massan est marié  eet mère de 1 enfant  résidant à Adidogomé. Ellea commencée son petit commerce en  vendant une Alimentation générale. Elle s'approvisionne 3 fois par mois marché adidogomé et revend dans une boutique à son domicile.  Massan sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Massan, who is 48 years old and lives in Adidogomé, is married and mother to one child. She began her small business by selling groceries and gets her supplies three times a month at the market in Adidogomé. She resells in a shop at her home.
