Massan is requesting this loan so she can expand her business, satisfy customer demand and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and a container of oil.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
_- 
Adzo a 34 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants à Adidogomé. Elle fait le petit commerce en vendant du charbon de bois . Elle s'approvisionne 1 fois par mois au marché assiyéyé et revend dans son quartier  . Adzo sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Adzo, who is 34 years old and lives in Adidogomé, is married and mother to four children. She has a small business selling charcoal and gets her supplies once a month at the market in Assiyéyé. She resells in her neighborhood. Adzo is requesting this loan so she can expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Buganvilias Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Buganvilias” is located in a rural area of the Guatemalan highlands in Cantel, Quetzaltenango. Initially,  eight women made up the group and they are deeply grateful for the line of credit that was granted to them a year ago.  The women have completely paid the loan back with great success.  In the previous cycle, we reported the case of Juliana, now 41 years old, married with six children.  Thanks to her textile business,  predominantly making huipiles (Maya blouses), Juliana has successfully had the ability to provide an education for her children.  She mentioned that without the working capital, the group’s businesses could not grow.  Thus, their families’ well being would not improve.

The group is currently initiating a new loan cycle with nine members, six of whom have already finished several cycles along with three new members.   One of the new members is Mayra, a young woman of 23 years who recently began her own family.  She is the mother of a beautiful seven month-old baby.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Mayra’s business is the making of beautiful aprons that she delivers once a week throughout the community.  She is very excited to begin her first loan cycle.  She plans to use the money to buy fabric of a variety of colors and textures so that her business can grow in size and income. 

Besides the loan, Mayra will receive monthly lessons from the “Microcredit Plus” program of Friendship Bridge.  These lessons will give her the opportunity to develop her leadership and decision making abilities.  Friendship Bridge has found that the combination of small loans along with education in subjects like business management, budgeting, accounting, marketing, customer service, as well as health, hygiene and self-esteem provides very positive results.  

All the women of the Trust Bank “Buganvilia” are extremely grateful for the confidence that Friendship Bridge and Kiva investors have shown them and are also grateful for the opportunity to receive more working capital.  Thank you Kiva investors!!!

loans.use: to buy fabric of a variety of colors and textures.

loans.name: Humberto De Jesus

texts.es: Humberto de 67 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hijo, el es una persona muy honesta y trabajador, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y hortalizas desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Humberto solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y continuar con sus cultivos para darle a su familia una menor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Humberto, 67, lives with his wife and son. He is a very honest and hardworking person, who has been dedicated to growing corn and vegetables for several years. He sells his his products in nearby markets, using the profits to meet the household expenses.
Humberto is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc to ensure he can continue working to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Wend Ya Ye Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est responsable du groupe WEND YA YE.  VERONIQUE se porte bien mais préfère se reposer. FATIMATA est mariée et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont  à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration   depuis  04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son  secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz, 02 bidons d’huile et des condiments.
Mme veut  épargner  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand restaurant et mieux entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en: Fatimata is in charge of the Wend Ya Ye group. Veronique is doing well but prefers to rest. Fatimata is married and mother to three children. The eldest is 11 years old and the youngest is four. Two of the children go to school. Fatimata has had a restauration activity for the past four years and gets her supplies from the market in her area. She would like to buy two sacks of rice, two containers of oil and condiments. She would like to be able to save her profits and her ambition is to open a large restaurant and take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, two containers of oil and condiments.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa de 52 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta  de tamales, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene su clientela ya establecida, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, con sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Rosa solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz, verduras, tomates, hojas de huerta, etc.  que es lo que más necesita para su negocio y seguirle dando a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52, is a hardworking woman who makes and sells tamales. Her business is located where she lives and she already has established clientele. She lives in her own home with her two children. The profits she makes only cover some household expenses.
Rosa is asking for a loan to buy corn, vegetables, tomatoes, vegetable leaves etc; what she needs most to keep her business running and so give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, tomatoes, vegetable leaves, etc.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver works as a security guard, and also manages to find time for his farming activities. He felt he landed in the right place for the capital he needed when he joined PMPC. He knew this would be his last chance to get back on his feet when he went broke after his first business went bad. PMPC came to the rescue for Oliver by lending him money when he needed it the most. Now, he has availed himself of another loan for the next cropping season. He borrowed the money to pay for labor during harvesting. 

Oliver perseveres and always believes he will reach his goal, which is to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for labor during harvesting

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
_ -  
Agée de 37 ans  Ayawa est mariée et mère de avec 4 enfants en charge  résidant à Adidogomé. Elle a commencée son petit commerce en  vendant des produits d'alimentation générale. Elle s'approvisionne 1 fois par mois marché d'assiyéyé et revend sous une baraque à à son domicile.  Ayawa sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Ayawa, who is 37 years old and lives in Adidogomé, is married with four children in her care. She began her small buisness by selling groceries and gets her supplies once a month at the market in Assiyéyé. She resells in a shed at her home. Ayawa is requesting this loan so she can expand her business, satisfy customer demand and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy three baskets of chili peppers, a sack of corn and a container of oil.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta y compra de artesania, la socia está agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member continues with her business buying and selling handicrafts. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time. She has had her business for several years and it brings her personal as well as financial satisfaction. She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

This member is requesting this loan to purchase sweaters, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, among other items.

loans.name: Takku Liguey Group

texts.fr: TAKKU LIGGEY est un groupement de promotion féminin qui regroupe 5 femmes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier et font pratiquement la même activité. Elles se réunissent à  chaque fin de semaine pour faire des cotisations semestrielles. Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt et sollicite celui-ci pour acheter et vendre des denrées alimentaires comme le sucre, l’huile, le savon, le lait etc.…… La présidente Madame Diarra est celle qui a mise une écharpe rouge  sur  la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes  et a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la finir à 20h. Elle souhaite à l’avenir faire des voyages entre Dubaï et Chine pour mieux booster son commerce de l’avant.
texts.en:
Takku Liguey is a group promoting women, which comprises five women. They all live in the same district and have virtually the same activities. They meet up at the end of every week to make the weekly contributions. They are on their fift loan which they are requesting so that they can buy and sell groceries such as sugar, oil, soap, milk, etc.

The president of the group, Diarra, is the one who is wearing a red scarf in the photo. She is married and a mother. She helps her husband manage the daily outgoings and has more than ten years experience in her business. She begins her day at nine o'clock in the morning and finishes at eight in the evening. She would like in the future to travel between Dubai and China so that she can boost her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries such as sugar, rice, oil.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
In the year 2010, James learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, James feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. 

Recently, he accessed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next crop season. James wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Erenia hopes to finance the renovation of their home. She wants to live comfortably in a house with good roofing. She applied a loan from PMPC for her house renovation. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. 

Erenia maintains a label of good standing which  she is thankful for when all her financial needs for her retail business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to finance house renovation

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José con 61 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, domicilio en una zona rural pertenciente al distrito Oyotún, provincia de Chciclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

José se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria, hace 35 años, su servicio lo ofrece en su distrito y alrededores, él solicita préstamo para activo fijo; compra de palanas, machetes, y otros; para poder darle un valor agregado a su servicio, y de esta forma pueda captar un número mayor de clientes, lo que va a ser que sus ingresos aumenten, sus ganancias mejoren y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su esposa también.
texts.en:
José, 61, is married without any dependent children. He lives in his own house in the rural area of Oyotún in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque in the north of Peru.

José is a laborer, 35 years ago, he decided to offer his services around the surrounding areas. He has requested a loan to purchase spades, machetes and other items, in order to improve his service and thus attract more customers. This will increase his income and so improve the quality of life of him and his wife.

loans.use: to buy spades, machetes and other items to improve his service.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 31 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Eufemia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eufemia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Eufemia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 57 years old and married with four children.

Julia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Julia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Julia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Turgunbuu

texts.ru: Тургунбуу 51 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. Тургунбуу в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2001 году с суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Тургунбуу на сегодняшний день имеет 4 коровы, 35 овец. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тургунбуу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и нетелей.  Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность построить большой сарай для скота.
texts.en: Turgunbuu is 51 years old, married and the mother of three children. As an additional source of income for her family, Turgunbuu practices livestock breeding. She started this business in 2001 with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Turgunbuu currently has 4 cows and 35 sheep on her farm. Her average monthly income is 16,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Turgunbuu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy bull calves and heifers. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business so that she will have the opportunity to build a large barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase bull calves and heifers in order to make her business more profitable.

loans.name: Nancy Margoth

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven ecuatoriana de 25 años de edad soltera vive en casa de sus padres, gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio  de sus padres logro terminar sus estudios primarios y secundarios.
 Ella se dedica al duro trabajo de la venta de granos tiernos durante 10 años, a pesar del esfuerzo que demanda esta actividad ella no se da por vencido y saca adelante a su familia, vive en un sector urbano de la ciudad de Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi es un sector caracterizado por la habilidad de criar animales menores, que es la fuente que sostiene a muchas familias en ese sector. 
La actividad a la que se dedica se la heredo de sus padres, tiene el apoyo de ellos y de sus hermanos para su actividad. Es una cliente con mucha experiencia en el negocio, ella ofrece mayormente frejol, arveja, choclo, chochos etc, sus ventas las realiza  en su casa y en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. Requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de granos.
Nancy  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Nancy is an enterprising young Ecuadorean woman. She is 25 years old, single and lives with her parents. Thanks to their efforts, Nancy managed to finish primary and secondary school.

For ten years Nancy has had a hard job selling soft grains. In spite of the effort required for this work, Nancy will not give up and is helping her family to get ahead. Nancy lives in an urban area of the city of Latacunga, in the Cotopaxi province. There area is known to be good for raising young animals, a trade that supports many locals.

Nancy inherited her own trade from her parents. She has their and her siblings' support. Nancy is a borrower who has a lot of experience with her business. She mainly sells beans, peas, and sweetcorn. Nancy makes her sales from her home and at the city's different markets. She needs this loan to invest in buying grains.

Nancy is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making growth at her business and in her personal life possible.

loans.use: to buy more grains to stock up her business.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de carteras, pantalones, blusas y chompas, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member continues with her business buying and selling purses, pants, blouses and sweaters. She has had this business for several years and it is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sweaters, among other items.

This member is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, among other items.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Perla tried her luck on doing a business, focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Perla has borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Perla looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a businessman from Oroquieta. He is  married and has expertise in selling. He runs a little retail store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports his family. Abraham is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, he has applied for a loan to restock his store with basic goods and consumable items. Abraham continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic goods and consumable items

loans.name: Tazhigul

texts.ru: Тажигул 62 года, вдова, многодетная мать 6 дочерей, также у нее был сын, но он погиб в прошлом году. Тажигул на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода почти всю свою жизнь занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день у Тажигул есть 1 дойная корова и 30 овец, также земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, где Тажигул выращивает фасоль. По хозяйству помогают ее дочери и внуки.  Однако Тажигул хочет быть независимой, и не брать денежные средства у своих детей, так как им нужно содержать и свои семьи. Поэтому Тажигул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы, для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого вкусного молока. Часть средств, а именно 20,000 сом (KGS) будет направлена на сбор урожая фасоли, а именно на найм рабочих. Экологически чистую фасоль Тажигул планирует реализовывать местным перерабатывающим фабрикам.  Доходы от кредита позволят Тажигул улучшить благосостояние семьи и в дальнейшем развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en: Tazhigul is 62 years old and a widow. She is a mother many times over, as she has 6 daughters. She also had a son, but he passed away last year. Tazhigul is a pensioner. As her main source of income, she has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming for almost her entire life. Currently, Tazhigul has 1 dairy cow and 30 sheep on her farm, as well as a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans. Her daughters and grandchildren help her with her farm. Tazhigul wants to be independent and not take money from her children, as they need to support their own families. This is why Tazhigul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 60,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow to increase her sales of eco-friendly, delicious milk. A portion of the loan, specifically 20,000 som (KGS), will be spent on hiring workers to help her harvest her beans. Tazhigul plans to sell her eco-friendly beans to local processing factories. The earnings from the loan will allow Tazhigul to improve her family's living conditions and develop her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase her eco-friendly milk sales, as well as to hire workers to harvest her eco-friendly beans.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda, who is 45 years old, is from Tinago, Tugas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children. 

PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her animal sales business. She sold one calf at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good calves, in order to sell them continuously. 

Ma. Linda is now trying to expand her animal sales business and has also decided to venture into a little butcher shop. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 20,000. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs to purchase five pigs to butcher. In addition, she wants her business to be well-known and to manage it well for her loyal customers. 

With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase five pigs to butcher

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Juan , is married and currently lives with his wife and children , he's currently employed in a company were he had a couple of work related accidents , a few months ago he was diagnosed with an eye retina problem and needs surgery, due to economic reasons in the past , he was not able to have the surgery performed .

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Bertha is married, she works as a teacher. She requires an eye surgery since this problem is affecting her job and she is not able to teach her primary students. Bertha is not able to pay her surgery.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Gerardo is currently married and lives with his wife and children, he is currently employed as a chemical engineer and he has now developed vision problems. For a few years he has had difficulty locating objects from far distance and is now affecting him in his job function. The only option he has is to have surgery to correct his vision problem, due to economic reasons in the past the surgery could not be performed.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
Felisa es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, madre de un hijo y su negocio es la venta de libros.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora, buena oyente, solidaria, Fuerte, orgullosa de lo nuestro, Buena madre, Alegre, optimista, feliz, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de lunes a sábado de nueve de la mañana a cinco de la tarde en la zona 16 de Julio una zona caracterizada porque se puede encontrar todo tipo de enseres imaginables, sólo se debe saber dónde buscar. Es necesaria al menos una mañana completa para su recorrido ya que en el trayecto las ofertas son variadas y en muchos casos irresistibles.
Felisa es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, estatura mediana, su forma de vestir es típica (manta y pollera), su lengua natal es el aymará y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su negocio es la venta de libros en un puesto ubicado en una calle de tierra denominada ‘la riel’ (porque antes pasaba el tren por ahí) "Lo que  en realidad tiene que hacer el librero es darte ese libro que estás buscando, pero aún no sabes cuál; es decir, convertir a los no lectores en lectores”, dice Felisa. En el lugar esta librera trabaja, rodeado por alrededor de 300 libros. Entre ellos se esconden verdaderos tesoros  de la literatura nacional, algunos  autografiados, así como obras extranjeras. Unas cuantas ya  han superado los 100 años de antigüedad.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de libros de temporada para mejorar su calidad de vida y aumentar su capital de trabajo, generando mejores ingresos económicos.
es por esos motivos que Felisa solicita un préstamo para la compra de libros por mayor y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felisa, 55 years old, is married and the mother of one son, and her business is selling books. She is an enterprising woman, supportive and a good listener; she is strong, proud of what is hers, a good mother, pleasant, optimistic, happy, responsible and very hard-working.  She runs her business from Monday through Saturday, 9 AM till 5 PM in the 16th of July area.  This area is known as one where you can find anything imaginable, if you know where to look.  At least a full morning is needed to see the place since the items for sale along the way are varied and often irresistible.  

Felisa is of medium stature, with brown skin and long black hair worn in braids, and is of medium stature.  Her mode of dressing is traditional (shawl and multi-layered skirt). Fellisa's native language is  aymará, but she uses Spanish in her work.  Her business is selling books at a stall located on an unpaved street called "the rail" (because the train once passed through there).  "What a bookseller really must do is give you the book you are looking for, although you don't know yet which book it is; that is, to change those who don't read into readers," says Felisa.   This bookseller works surrounded by about 300 books.  Among them are hidden some true treasures of Bolivian literature, some autographed, as well as books from other countries.  A few are more than 100 years old.  

Felisa wants to make her business grow by purchasing books of current interest, in order to raise her quality of life and increase her working capital, generating new income.  This is why Felisa is asking for a loan, to buy books in bulk and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy books in bulk and improve her quality of life

loans.name: Delia Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia Delia Fortunata continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa para bebes, la socia lleva años de dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, camisetas entre otros.

La socia está contenta con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Delia Fortunata, continues with her business selling infants’ clothing She has run this business for several years and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sweaters and T-shirts, among other items.

This member is pleased with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters and T-shirts, among other items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of her family's home. Marites hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing,  supported by her loan of PHP 12,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. 

Marites was given priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. She is thankful that all her financing needs on her retailing business were also supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her home

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 64 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations and she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and eight children. She is a farmer who plants rice.

Lourdes wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put food on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married with four children. She is 50 years old and lives in Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

Lilia is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. Lilia has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Lilia hopes to supply neighboring towns with flowers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for flowers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 49 years old. She is known in the Burgos area for her generosity. She actively participates in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which reason she applied for a loan to buy coconuts to sell. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs for her retail business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is married with three children. She is 31 years old and lives in Paglaum-Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a farmer and grows rice in her fields to earn a living. 

She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers. 

Ritchel has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to buy her own rice mill and to have her own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Jose Irene

texts.es: José, tiene 45 años, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 4 hijos, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe. Se dedica a la producción de café desde hace 8 años, anteriormente solamente cultivaba caña de azúcar. El café que produce lo vende en pergamino en la misma zona. Ha obtenido 5  prestamos anteriores para mantener en buen estado sus cultivos y solicita otro por 5,000 lempiras para invertirlos en la compra de abono, limpieza de café y caña de azúcar y pago de mano de obra para la aplicación de fertilizantes. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la producción. Su plan es dar asistencia a la finca de café existente y sembrar media manzana mas de cultivo.
texts.en:
Jose, 45, lives in a village in Taulabe with his partner with who he has 4 children. He has worked in coffee production for 8 years and before he only cultivated sugarcane. The coffee produced is sold on Pergamino in the same area. Previously, he has had five loans that have helped keep his crops in good condition and is asking for another loan of 5,000 Lempiras to invest in the purchase of fertilzer, coffee cleaner, sugarcane and also to pay for the labor of the fertilizer application. This investment will help improve production.
His goal is to work on his existing coffee farm and plant more apple produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, coffee cleaners, sugarcane and to pay for the labor for fertilizer application.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lolita is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Lolita has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María de 48 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 14 años, tiene clientela ya establecida que la buscan por los buenos precios,  el esposo se dedica a la agricultura entre los dos aportan para el hogar, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar, María solicita un crédito para la compra de verduras como: ayote, elote, chile verde, ejote tomate, pipan, etc. para tener junto con su esposo una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Mary, 48, lives with her partner in her own house. She has been selling fruit and vegetables for 14 years and has already established clientele who look for good prices. Her husband works in agriculture and between the two, they provide for the household expenses.

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables such as pumpkins, corn, green peppers, beans, tomatoes, seeds, etc. to improve the economic stability of her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy pumpkins, corn, green peppers, beans, tomatoes, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Matrona

texts.en:
Matrona has signed up for membership with PMPC and took a loan for the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her. 

Matrona has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. She requested this loan to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela works hard to support her family. Adela is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Adela requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Adela has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Adela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Joseta

texts.en:
Joseta is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joseta is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Joseta has a banana vending business in the Philippines. Joseta requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

Joseta has been in this business for 10 years. Joseta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bernadine

texts.en:
Bernadine is 53 years old and has four children. Bernadine is married and has one child who is still in school.

Bernadine is in the agricultural business, raising pets in the Philippines. Bernadine requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and additional pets to sell.

Bernadine has been raising animal pets for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernadine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional pets to sell

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Felicidad has been in this business for 10 years. Felicidad earns more income from the store.

Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Mylinda

texts.en: Mylinda is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling fruit in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 220,00 loan from NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers. Mylinda has been in this business for six years, and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. Rosemarie is married and has a business to buy and sell dry goods in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like curtains, pants, blouses, etc. to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years now.

Rosemarie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods like curtains, pants, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann works hard to support her family by running a direct sales business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy more products to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for two years and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en: Mylen is 34 years old, married and the mother of four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling eyeglasses in the Philippines. Mylen is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for 14 years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eyeglasses to sell

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимиру — 59 лет. Вместе с женой и 2 сыновьями живет в Виноградово, занимается выращиванием цветов, имеет две теплицы — одна 8 соток, вторая 3 сотки. В бизнесе задействована вся семья. 
Владимир собирается вложить 25 000 гривен в развитие своего бизнеса и закупить семена на 15 000 гривен, а также дрова на 10 000 гривен. Со временем очень хочет построить еще одну теплицу, так как свободной земли на участке у него еще достаточно.
texts.en:
Vladimir is 59 years old. He and his wife live with their two sons in Vinogradovo. He grows flowers and has two greenhouses - one which is 800 square meters and another which is 300 square meters. The entire family helps with this business.

Vladimir is planning to invest 25,000 hryvnia (UAH) in the development of his business. He wants to buy 15,000 hryvnia-worth of seeds and 10,000 hryvnia-worth of lumber. He wants to eventually build another greenhouse as he has enough free space on his plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and lumber.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 55 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age. 

Nelia is engaged in plastic, scrap metal and other junk collecting activities and coconut production, and has been for several years. She has been earning approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing a second-hand motorcycle to be used for business.

Nelia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Nelia hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 44 years old, married and the mother of five children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Teresita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business. She has been in her currently line of work for six years and has successfully paid back a previous loan. Teresita would like to save enough money  to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.en: Olimpia is 67 years old, married and the mother of six children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Olimpia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional used clothing to sell. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Engely

texts.en:
Engely is 42 years old, married, and has three children currently in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Engely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Engely has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. In the future, Engely would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a dry goods business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Daisy is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. This time, she took a loan to purchase a supply of plastic wares for retail. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of plastic wares for retail.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is from Cogon Ozamiz City. She is married with one kid. Her husband is a driver of their own motorcycle business. Her husband is very supported in taking care of their business. 

Aurelia has joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for the chance to avail herself of loans. She is now requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy motor parts. She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future.

loans.use: to buy motor parts

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 65 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their adult age. Florita has engaged in the fish vending business for 10 years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business. 

Florita has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Florita hopes to expand her fish vending business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repairs

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business weaving native mats in the Philippines.

Enriquita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Enriquita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for weaving mats

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from selling ready-to-wear clothing and providing manicure/pedicure services.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria works hard to support her family. Silveria is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Silveria requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Silveria has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Silveria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda works hard to support her family. Alfreda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Alfreda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and equipment for her business.

Alfreda has been in this business for 20 years now.

Alfreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 55 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cleofe has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cleofe requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

Cleofe has been in this business for 12 years. Cleofe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 40 years old, and two of her children are currently in school

Susan has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is 54 years old and widowed with three children. With one child still in school, Desideria works very hard to provide for her family.

Desideria runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, sanitary pads, detergent soap, canned goods and candies to sell.

Desideria has been in this business for 18 years. She sells a variety of items including those listed above and more. Desideria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, sanitary pads, detergent soap, canned goods and candy to sell

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
Игорь занимается выращиванием овощей на собственном участке в Каменке уже 17 лет. У него есть 2 большие теплицы для помидор и теплица для рассады.  Кроме огорода Игорь занимается тем, что возит различную сельхозпродукцию, как арбузы, картошку, лук, и продает на рынках. У него двое детей — 13 и 20 лет. 
Сумму в 20 000 гривен Игорь планирует вложить в приобретение удобрений, пленки и семян на следующий сезон. Дополнительную прибыль будет вкладывать в быт семьи и учебу дочери. Хочет со временем приобрести также грузовое авто, чтобы можно было возить больше продукции и сделать отопление в теплицах.
texts.en:
Igor has been growing vegetables on his own plot of land in Kamenka for 17 years. He has two large greenhouses for tomatoes and one greenhouse for seedlings. Besides his vegetable garden, Igor transports various produce, such as watermelons, potatoes and onions, and sells them at the markets. He has two children who are 13 and 20 years old.

Igor plans to invest 20,000 hryvnia (UAH) in the purchase of fertilizer, plastic covering and seeds for the next season. The additional profit will be invested in household use and his daughter's education. He wants to eventually buy a shipping truck so that he can transport more produce and put in heaters in his greenhouses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, plastic covering and seeds.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Retailing has helped Carlito provide for his family. He retails charcoal and brings a meager income of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. He finds the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all he needs to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for his buyers.

Now Carlito plans to expand his retailing business. He applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. He wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail. He smiles at seeing all his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail.

loans.name: Rezalina

texts.en:
Rezalina is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is a widow and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari (variety) store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Rezalina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Rezalina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe has always supported his two children. He used this loan to purchase bags of animal feeds needed for his hog raising business. He is now on his way to repaying the loan with his new profits.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct sales business selling Personal Collection products in the Philippines. 

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell to her customers for her direct sales business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more Personal Collection products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elsa is 53 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Elsa has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for eight years. Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 30 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Estela works very hard to provide for them.

Estela runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, cereals, milk, juice, coffee and sugar to sell.

Estela has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items including those listed above and more.

In the future, Estela would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, cereals, milk, juice, coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta works hard to support her family. Fausta is widowed and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Fausta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle unit for her business.

Fausta has been in this business for five years now.

Fausta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle unit for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 22-year-old unmarried woman with one child. 

She makes and sells Samoan chips in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Julieta needs a loan to buy a barrel of cooking oil, a large frying pan, a new oven, a strainer, taro, and bananas. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Julieta has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a barrel of cooking oil, a large frying pan, a new oven, a strainer, taro, and bananas

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
Марьяна занимается бизнесом — торгует мужской одеждой. Зарабатывает достаточно для жизни в целом, однако на ремонт жилья, который давно запланировала средств не хватает. Дело в том, что если Марьяна заберет деньги из бизнеса, то это негативно повлияет на доходы в целом, поэтому ей необходимы дополнительные средства. 
Самое главное, на что Марьяне требуются средства — это ремонт крыши, которая давно протекает то тут, то там. Однако она также хочет сделать и небольшой косметический ремонт, а именно — поменять старые двери, туалет и плитку с ванной в ванной комнате. Для этого ей понадобится сумма в 40 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Maryana works in business - she sells men's clothing. She earns enough money to support herself on the whole, however, it is not enough money to make long-planned repairs on her house. The problem is, if Maryana were to take money from her business for this, it would negatively affect her income overall. This is why she needs additional funds.

The most important thing that Maryana will spend this money on is repairing her roof, which has been leaking here and there for a long time. However, she also wants to do a small, cosmetic renovation to her house, specifically replacing the old doors, toilet, tiles and bathtub in her bathroom. For these repairs, she needs 40,000 hryvnia (UAH).

loans.use: to fix the roof of her house, as well as replace the doors, toilet, tiles and bathtub in her bathroom.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Margret, a member of Umoja Women Group. She is 32 years old, married and blessed with six children.

Margret does dairy, maize and beans farming. She uses part of her produce for consumption and sells the rest. She underwent Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise management and she is now able to manage her business. Margret wants to start rearing goats, which she will supply to slaughter houses. She is borrowing a loan to start her activities. 

She hopes her business will flourish and result in additional income. This will enable her meet her family's needs such as food and clothing.

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felisa is 40 years old and her two children are in school.

Felisa has a business buying and selling recyclable materials in the Philippines. Felisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more recyclable materials to sell.

Felisa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money to afford to sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Glenda is 44 years old and her five children are in school.

Glenda has a shell-craft business in the Philippines. Glenda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like shells and wire for her business.

Glenda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells and wire for her business

loans.name: Hedda

Hedda runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, beer, shampoo, diapers and biscuits to sell.

Hedda has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items including those listed above and more. 

Hedda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, beer, shampoo, diapers and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Juliebee

Juliebee has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Julita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for five years now.

Julita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Lagilagi

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also for the expansion of her business. Lagilagi has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jasmin

Jasmin has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jasmin aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Jennifer

Jennifer requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more trays of eggs to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 15 years now.

Jennifer would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Lucena

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lucena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials for her handicraft business.

Lucena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

Ma. Evelyn has a handicraft business in the Philippines.  Ma. Evelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

Ma. Evelyn has been in this business for 6 years. Ma. Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Denden

texts.en:
Denden is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Denden works very hard to provide for them.

Denden runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, salt, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Denden has been in this business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, salt, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is named Zipporah; a member of Witeithie Women Group. She is thirty five years old, married and blessed with two children.

Zipporah farms maize, beans and potatoes and also sells second hand clothes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

She will use the loan to buy more second hand clothes which will enable her to increase income levels. She plans to use the profit in funding her children education.

Zipporah is grateful to Kiva and their leaders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy a stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Nancy, a member of Umoja Women Group. She is 53 years old, married and blessed with nine children.

Nancy is involved in dairy farming. The training she received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled her to run the business effectively. She is applying for a loan to enable her to achieve her goal of expanding the business, by buying more dairy cows to help increase the amount of milk produced. She plans to use the profits to support her children education. 

Nancy is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Silika

texts.en:
Silika is a 34-year-old woman who is married with four children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has six years of experience with this business. 

Silika has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter

loans.name: Sauimalo

Nia needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. Nia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dress making. 

Aida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felicitas is 51 years old, and has two children who are still in school.

Felicitas has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Felicitas has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Glezel

Glezel has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tina

Tina needs a loan to buy new pots, basins, cooking oil, soya sauce, onions, a large frying pan and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees. Tina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.name: Maria

Maria needs a loan to buy bags of flour, yeast, a frying pot, cooking oil, soya sauce, boneless chicken and beef. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Maria has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, yeast, a frying pot, cooking oil, soya sauce, boneless chicken and beef

loans.name: Iliganoa

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a large frying pan, a new oven, a strainer, plastic bags and a barrel of cooking oil

loans.name: Maitua

Maitua needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and to help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Tamaseugogo

texts.en: Tamaseugogo is a 35-year-old, widowed woman with two children. She runs a bakery making pies in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Tamaseugogo needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. Tamaseugogo has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, butter and a large stove.

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es:
Doña Kattia tiene 41 años de edad, de amplia trayectoria en Fundación Mujer, se dedica a vender ropa, zapatos, colonias, reloj y cualquier artículo personal que le soliciten; ella los compra a un proveedor. Desde hace 4 años inició con la venta de productos por catálogo; su actividad se ha incorporado muy bien a su negocio ya que cuenta con una clientela muy exclusiva, dado los años de trabajo en el comercio. Demuestra tener muy buena actitud en su negocio. Como mencionó en la visita realizada, Fundación Mujer ha aportado la mayor parte del patrimonio a lo largo de estos años, su clientela ha aumentado y continua innovando, con el objetivo de contribuir a los ingresos del hogar. Actualmente desea este crédito para comprar mercadería ya que se encuentra en una temporada alta. 
Kattia se ha convertido en una mujer luchadora, ha logrado salir adelante con la crianza de sus hijos y hermanos, ya que su madre es una mujer alcohólica que los abandonó desde muy pequeños, ella decidió brindarles una crianza digna. Demuestra ser una mujer muy trabajadora con deseos de mejorar la condición de vida familiar. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la atención personalizada y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en: Kattia is 41 years old with a long history with Fundación Mujer. She sells clothes, shoes, cologne, watches, and any personal goods that are requested. She buys them from a provider. She began selling products from a catalog 4 years ago. She has incorporated this activity in her business since she has an exclusive clientele due to her experience working in commerce. She demonstrates a good attitude in her business. As mentioned, Fundación Mujer has supported a lerge part of the business for several years. Her clientele has grown and she continue expanding in the hopes of contributing to household expenses. Currently, she wants this loan to buy merchandise since it's the high season. Kattia has become a hard-working women. She has been able to get ahead while raising her children and siblings since her mother is an alcoholic who abandoned them at a young age. She has brought them a dignified childhood. She is a hard-working woman with dreams of improving her family's life. She chose Fundación Mujer for the personalized attention and low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise.

loans.name: Saunia

texts.en:
Saunia is a 30-year-old unmarried woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Saunia needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Saunia has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is 43 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Jacinta has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter.

loans.name: Peleiupu

texts.en:
Peleiupu is a 41-year-old, unmarried woman, with two children. To earn a living, she runs a small bakery in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Peleiupu needs a loan to buy a large stove, bags of sugar, flour, cooking oil, a large frying pan, and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Peleiupu has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a large stove, bags of sugar, flour, cooking oil, a large frying pan, and paper plates.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 45 years old, single, and has three children. She makes and sells elei printed material, which she has been doing for one year. 

Veronika requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy fabric paint, stencils, rubber designs, brushes, and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase fabric paint, stencils, rubber designs, brushes, and rollers

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos dos varones de 17 y 18 años de edad y una niña de 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre que todos los días se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia apoyándose en su trabajo, en el cual presta sus servicios de seguridad en un  centro escolar, cercano a su vivienda lo que además le permite estar cerca de su familia. Efraín habita en vivienda propia desde hace 42 años ya que es herencia de su madre, por lo que se siente muy feliz, pero el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado, ya que tiene mucho tiempo en  uso, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Efraín is 43 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife and 3 children (two sons, 17 and 18, and a 6 year old daughter). Every day he strives to get his family ahead. They rely on his job as a security guard at a school, which is near his house and allows him to be close to his family. 

Efraín has lived in his own home for 42 years. He inherited it from his mother and he is very happy about this. However the roof of the house is in poor condition due to its age and so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanised sheet metal, beams and wood in order to change the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheet metal, beams and wood in order to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Felixberta requested a loan from NWTF for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old and married with three children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. She has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Gina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa is a 26-year-old, unmarried woman with 2 children. 

She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living, and she has 1 year of experience with this business. She needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiling pan and soft drinks. She has been a member of SPBD since 2004.

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiling pan and soft drinks

loans.name: Tausuai

texts.en: Tausuai is a 25-year-old single woman with no children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Tausuai needs a loan to buy pies, bread, butter, jam, paper plates, a boiler, sugar, and rubber gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tausuai has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.name: Faitele

texts.en: Faitele is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Faitele needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy, and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. loans.name: Grigoryi

texts.ru:
Григорий занимается выращивание овощей на собственном участке в с. Нововодяное уже 45 лет. У него есть 3 большие теплицы и 3 теплицы для рассады. Все они под отоплением. Выращивает Григорий в основном помидоры и огурцы. Григорий всю жизнь жил в селе, в своем доме, занимался хозяйством. Раньше работал в совхозе, потом работы не стало и он начал выращивать огурцы. 
Так как на следующий сезон надо закупить все необходимое, Григорию понадобилась дополнительная сумма в 40 000 гривен для приобретения пленки на 15 000 гривен и угля на 25 000 гривен. На полученные от прибыли средства Григорий очень надеется закончить ремонт в доме: недавно он вставил окна и сделал небольшой внутренний ремонт, осталось перекрыть крышу, которая совсем старая уже.
texts.en:
Grigoryi has been growning vegetables on his own plot of land in the village of Novovodyanoye for 45 years. He has three large greenhouses and another three greenhouses for seedlings. All of them having heating systems. Grigoryi primarily grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Grigoryi has lived his whole life in the village, in his own home and has always been in farming. Previously, he worked on a collective farm, then this type of work was eliminated, so he began growing cucumbers.

As he needs to buy necessities for the next growing season, Grigoryi needs additional funds in the amount of 40,000 hryvnia (UAH) - 15,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy plastic covering and 25,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy coal. With the profits from the loan, Grigoryi really hopes to finish his home repairs. Not long ago, he put in windows and did small internal renovations. The repairs he has left are to re-cover the roof, which is completely in disrepair.

loans.use: to purchase plastic covering and coal.

loans.name: Kalina

texts.en:
Kalina is 20 years old, single, and has one child. She operates a small bingo game business, which she has been doing for one year.

Kalina requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy a bingo machine, playing cards, bingo balls, bingo bottles, and new tables. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Kalina joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, playing cards, bingo balls, bingo bottles, and new tables

Isidra has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa roofing to sell

Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.  She sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. 

Ma. Theresa requested a loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items like bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Laupama has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, and material

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a 19-year-old single mother with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year.

Hana needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Hana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and a spade
